loans.name: Jimboy

texts.en: To make a living Jimboy owns and manages farmland, planting and harvesting vegetables in his village and selling them at the market.  He earns well from this and has successfully repaid his previous loan from GDMPC that he used to buy farm inputs. Currently, he took a new loan to buy fertilizer for this cropping season. He plans to use the additional revenue generated by his business to improve the farm as well as the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for this cropping season

loans.name: Racel

texts.en: To make a living, Racel owns and manages a store selling goods in her village, and she earns well from this. She provided for her family's needs and successfully repaid her previous loan from GDMPC that she used for additional capital. Currently, she is taking a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She plans to use the profits, in addition to her capital, to gain more income in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Harutyun

texts.en:
Harutyun is from Kapan town of the Syuniq region. He is a father of a 3-year-old daughter and lives with his wife and daughter in Kapan town. Harutyun has been providing renovation services for two years. He provides both internal and external renovation of houses and receives different orders. However, the tools that he uses in his work are old, and it is becoming very difficult for Harutyun to provide good quality service. 

Now, by applying for this loan, Harutyun asks financial support to be able to purchase tools and materials needed for providing renovation services. The loan will greatly help Harutyun to organize his work more effectively and satisfy his clients' needs. 

He has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

The loan is very important for Harutyun, and he hopes for lenders' support and good will.

loans.use: to pay for tools and materials for providing renovation services

loans.name: Kauta

texts.en:
Kauta is a 42-year-old married man with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is selling phones and accessories alongside repairing phones in order to boost his income. His main challenge is limited capital. However, he has a vision of constructing a personal residential house and expanding his business into new market areas.

Kauta is requesting a loan to buy phones to sell.

loans.use: to buy phones to sell.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 41 years old and married, with one child in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Nenita has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 13 years.

Nenita requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like spices, meat, fish, eggs, etc.

In the future, Nenita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like spices, meat, fish, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 56 years old, married and has six children.  

Ruth is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She has been farming rice for five years now, and she has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. 

Ruth requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

In the future, Ruth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Ethel

texts.en:
Ethel is a hardworking woman with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her main business is running a retail shop, alongside lending money and farming in order to boost her income. She is facing challenges of limited capital and seasonal changes that affect her income. However, she has a vision of constructing a house and having a big farm of animals. 

Ethel has asked for a loan to add stock of cooking oil, bread and sugar to sell.

loans.use: To add stock of cooking oil, bread and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Melba Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Melba es originaria de la ciudad de Granada. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la elaboración de costura de ropa de Bebe, y venta de ropa nueva. Se siente agradecida con KIVA y MiCrédito ya que ha logrado obtener más productos a un mejor precio. Solicita el nuevo crédito para comprar: Tela, Seda, Hilo  y ropa nueva. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda porque podrá compra una mayor cantidad de productos y obtener descuentos en sus compras.
texts.en:
Melba is from the city of Granada. She is a businesswoman; she makes her living sewing baby clothes and selling new clothes. She is grateful to KIVA and MiCrédito because she has been able to obtain more merchandise at a better price.

She is requesting this new loan to buy fabric, silk, thread, and new clothes. She believes that this loan will be very helpful because she will be able to buy a larger quantity of merchandise and get better discounts on her purchases.

loans.use: to buy fabric, silk, thread, and new clothes.

loans.name: Sovann's Group

texts.en:
Sovann is 51 years old and widowed with one son, who is still in school. She lives in a rural village of the Moung Russey district, where crop farming is a common way to make a living. To make a living, Saovann has been growing various kinds of vegetables. The current business earns her about 18,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) to meet the family’s needs.
 
Sovann has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle and completely paid back the past loan, which helped her better support her family. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Sovann is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers, pesticides and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase her family’s income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Savy's Group

texts.en:
Savy is aged 35 years and married with two children. She lives in a rural village of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice and working as paid workers. The current business earns them about 56,000 KHR per day.

Savy has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan which has helped her to better support the family. Now she is leading her group to seek a loan. Savy will use her portion to pay for harvesting rice. She hopes to earn more income from her rice paddy.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting rice.

loans.name: Sileap's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Sileap is aged 33 years and married. She has three children, two of whom are dependent on her and still in school. To make a living, she and her husband have been growing beans and selling grocery items.  The current business earns them about 80,000 KHR per day and they save about 30,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

Sileap’s group consists of two members who have been with VisionFund for four cycles and completely paid back the past loans. Those have helped Sileap better support her current business. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers, pesticides and seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to buy more grocery items for resale. She hopes to earn more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Maa Tarini Shg (F) Group

texts.en:
Jamuna is in her first loan cycle with "Maa Tarini SHG" self-help group through People's Forum. In picture the lady standing with raised hand is Jamuna. She likes this type of funding because it allows her to grow her businesses. 

Jamuna is 38 years old and married. She has three children. Her husband is also in business; he works in mobile village markets on market days.

Jamuna makes a living raising and then selling goats to the local butchers in the near market. She has been doing this business for the last 10 years. She spends most of her time taking care of her business but she also raises chickens to help her husband with the household expenses. She will use the loan to buy more goats, goat kids and feed. Her goal is to have a bigger goat business.

All the members of this group are women and all are sharing a common goal to give a better life to their children. All the group members live in a small village of Odisha, India, and all are engaged in different activities.

On the behalf of this group, Jamuna says, "We are very grateful to Kiva and its lenders for giving us this opportunity to grow."

loans.use: To purchase more goat kids, goats and feed.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is 48 years old, living with her spouse and six children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a greengrocer by profession. 

She thinks that her son can easily run a tea cafe and can generate reasonable income through this business. She wants to start a tea cafe for her son, but she does not have enough capital to buy milk, tea, a wooden stall, a cauldron for boiling milk, etc.

Therefore, Zahida requested a loan for her son, so he would be able to buy a stove, milk, tea, cups, a cauldron and a wooden stall for a tea cafe.

Zahida thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a stove, milk, tea, cups, a cauldron and a wooden stall for a tea cafe.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is an old client with Ugafode Microfinance who applied for a loan of UGX 3,000,000. He runs a small retail shop in Ruti, a surbub of Mbarara town. He has been doing this for more than five years. 

He is a hardworking man who has managed to save money from his sales, which has enabled him to acquire a small piece of land in Mbarara town where he constructed a house. The purpose of this loan is to complete his house. He will use a portion of it to restock his business.

loans.use: To complete his house and to restock his retail store.

loans.name: Jameela

texts.en:
Jameela is a 27-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  Jameela owns a small business to sell clothing to the ladies of her hometown door to door.  She roams from one door to another with a lifted bundle of clothing over her head to offer clothing. She purchases clothing from the market at a low price and sells it for a higher price. She wants to involve her husband in this business so he can offer clothing to the gents.  But she does not have cash on hand to buy gents clothing for her husband.  Therefore, Jameela requested a loan so she can buy a variety of clothing for her husband.

She wishes for a bright future for her children and dreams to provide them with a better education.

She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy clothing for her husband to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Al-Manal Group

texts.en: Al-Manal is a group of five women from Taiz, Yemen. They are hardworking women. They have requested a group loan, and they will hold each other accountable for loan repayment. Manal, who is 25 years old, is the leader of the group. She is a resourceful and honest woman. She lives with her family in a small house in Taiz. She is very hardworking and doing her best to earn money. However, she is unable to buy home appliances for her house, because what she earns is hardly enough to buy food and pay the rent for the house. She decided to help buy home appliances, so she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER to buy home appliances for personal use. She hopes that she will be able to improve her family's conditions.

loans.use: to buy home appliances for personal use.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul lives in Cherengani, close to Kitale, in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s highest towns. The rich soil makes it one of the nation's biggest maize-producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers there have started planting bluegum trees, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.  

Paul is married and has five children. He and his wife have been farming for 15 years, and grow maize, beans, vegetables and bananas. They are also cultivating trees, including the acacia, which is excellent for honey production: one tree can support three colonies; the honey produced is light, golden and delicious. 

This is Paul’s first loan with Kiva, and he plans to use the income generated to invest in projects on his land. He is very excited for the chance to start beekeeping and honey production.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Jumagul

texts.ru: Жумагул 62 года, вдова, воспитала 3 дочерей. Две дочери находятся в России на заработках, работают в ресторане - посудомойками. Ежемесячно высылают часть своей зарплаты в Кыргызстан матери для финансового поддержания. Младшая дочь живет с Жумагул помогает ей по хозяйству. После смерти супруга, Жумагул очень долго не могла пережить утрату близкого человека. Нужно было воспитывать и ставить на ноги девочек и Жумагул решила взять хозяйство и материальную ответственность в свои руки. Разведением скота занимается с 1983 года, начав этот бизнес с 1,000 сом KGS с покупки одной коровы. Благодаря ее неустанному труду и выдержке, на сегодняшний день она получает ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 5,000 сом KGS. В хозяйстве у Жумагул имеется: 4 дойные коровы, которых она доит 2 раз в день, из молока делает творог, кефир и сметану, продает реализаторам. В целях увеличения поголовья скота Жумагул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом-на покупку 1 коровы для дальнейшего разведения. На доходы от кредита Жумагул планирует увеличить поголовье скота, а также намерена сделать ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Jumagul is a 62-year-old widow who has raised three daughters.  Two of her daughters are migrant workers in Russia who wash dishes in restaurants.  Every month, they send part of their salary to their mother in Kyrgyzstan as financial support.  Jumgaul's youngest daughter lives with her and helps her around the house.  For a long time after her husband's death, Jumgaul found it very difficult to live through the loss of someone so close to her.  She needed to raise and care for her daughters, so she decided to take the responsibility for her household into her own hands.  

Jumgaul has been involved in raising livestock since 1983, a business she started with the purchase of one cow for 1,000 som KGS.  Thanks to her hard work and support, her monthly income is now 5,000 som KGS and her farm now has four dairy cows which she milks twice a day.  She makes tvorog (quark), kefir and sour cream from their milk and sells it to retail customers.  With the goal of increasing her head of livestock, Jumagul has turned to the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" for a loan so she can buy one cow to raise up.  She plans to use the income from this to further increase her head of livestock, as well as to make repairs to her home.

loans.use: to buy cow

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip lives near Cherengani, close to Kitale, in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is close to Uganda and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the residents has helped preserve the soil and ensure that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide bees with high-quality forage. 

Philip is married and has four children. He and his wife are farmers, and they grow maize, beans and bananas. He has been farming for 13 years, and has put a lot of time and effort into his land. 

Philip is excited to become a beekeeper because he sees it as a good investment that makes use of his land while helping his farming. This is his first loan, and he hopes to use the income generated by his beehives to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Walther Ricardo

texts.es:
Walther tiene 34 años de edad estado civil Unión Libre vive con su esposa  y con sus hijos, de 4, 2,3 y 1 años. Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.
La ventanilla se llama SAN NICOLAS se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Nicolás, perteneciente a la parroquia Ricaurte cantón Urdaneta, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Walther se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace algunos años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar. 
El crédito solicito para la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es comprar un terreno.
Le gusta trabajar en el campo.
texts.en:
Walther is 34 years old. He lives in a common-law relationship with his wife and their children aged 1, 2, 3 and 4. They live in Ventanas Canton, in the province of Los Rios. The "San Nicolas" communal bank is located in the community of San Nicolas which belongs to Ricaurte Parish, Urdaneta Canton. The members work in agriculture and livestock. 

Walther has been working in agriculture for several years, growing corn and rice. He buys his supplies in Ventanas and sells his product in Ventanas' markets. The loan he is requesting will help him to increase the revenue for the use of the family and to invest in supplies. His dream is to buy land. He enjoys working in the country.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Sakir

texts.en:
Sakir is 47 years old, married, and raising 5 kids together with his wife. His kids work at a local market, while his wife helps him tend the family farm.  They all live together as one big, happy family. Everyone contributes as they can toward the family's well-being. Character-wise, Sakir is a very hardworking and caring father to his children. He has the equivalent of a high school education, and raises livestock for a living, first starting 14 years ago. 

Thanks to his persistent efforts, Sakir currently has a calf on his farm, and his monthly income is nearly 150 AZN. To further develop his farm, Sakir is seeking a loan of 2,000 AZN from Aqroinvest CU and Partners to buy some cows, fatten them, and sell them for a profit at a local market. He plans to use any extra money that the loan will allow him to continue to buy more livestock for his farm, as well as to make some home repairs.

loans.use: to buy more livestock for his farm, and to make some home repairs.

loans.name: Faice

texts.en: Faice is 60 years old. She is married with three children between the ages of 18 and 24. She is married to a man who sells local juices. She has requested the loan to buy more sorghum which is used in making a local juice. The profits from the business will be used to pay the children’s school fees.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum to use in making juice.

loans.name: Shamil

texts.en:
Shamil is 39 years old and lives with his wife, three children and retired parents. Samil has a big family and numerous problems. Together with his wife, they just do their best to provide normal living conditions for all of them. Samil is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his family in the Bilasuvar IDP settlement. 

He raises sheep and sells them for meat. He has been doing this business for six years and is a very hardworking person. He puts a lot of effort into this activity, because he wants to support his family without lacking financially.

Samil is keeping a flock of sheep in his own yard. He fattens them and takes their meat to the central bazaar, where butchers and customers purchase it. People use mutton for traditional dishes like kababs, dolmas, pilovs, etc. 

This is going to be his fifth loan. He requires 2,000 AZN to purchase 15 sheep in order to sell more meat in the winter. Shamil is optimistic about this loan, because in winter more people consume meat, due to the holidays and increased customers in restaurants.

loans.use: to purchase 15 sheep in order to sell more meat.

loans.name: Job

texts.en:
Job lives and works near Cherengani, in western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence and individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups live in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflowers, sugar cane, millet, and beans. The area is near East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes it a high-potential beekeeping region. 

Job is married and has five children. He is a reverend at a local church, while his wife focuses on farming full-time. He and his wife grow maize, bananas, oranges, and grass for livestock fodder. He has been farming for 10 years and is planning to expand his farming activities. 

Job is very happy to be able to start beekeeping and is excited to receive his beehives. He plans to use the income generated by his beehives to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas lives and works in Cherengani, close to Kitale town in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions. Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.

Thomas is married and has six children. Both he and his wife farm their land, and are currently growing maize, beans, fruits, guava and avocado, as well as tending livestock. 

Thomas is very happy that his group has been given access to beehive loans through Kiva and is looking forward to having a source of natural honey for his family. This is Thomas’ first loan, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to pay his children’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 43 años de edad, está casada y tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad con quien vive en su casa propia. María se dedica a la venta de comidas para eso cuenta con un puesto en el mercado cerca a su casa en donde atiende de manera amable y cordial a sus clientes ganándose su preferencia. Se inició hace más de 10 años con un capital propio y preparando en pequeñas cantidades, viendo la acogida que tenía su negocio, decidió continuar, y hasta el momento cuenta con el apoyo de su mamá en la preparación y atención de los clientes, compartiendo sus ganancias con ella. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable porque eso casi siempre acaba todo lo que prepara para vender, dejándole buenas ganancias. Decidió empezar con éste negocio debido a la necesidad de contar con un oficio y un ingreso económico para cubrir sus gastos y apoyar a su esposo. Viendo los buenos resultados que está teniendo con su negocio tiene planes de continuar y hacerlo crecer. En esta oportunidad solicitara S/.1500, está contenta de saber que tendrá acceso a un apoyo financiero para concretar sus planes. El  monto solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra de utensilios para cocina como ollas, platos, vasos y otros, para renovar los que tiene, así brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria is 43 years old, married, and has a three-year-old child who lives with her in her own home.  Maria sells meals and has a stand in the market near her house where she caters to her customers in a friendly and cordial way, earning their loyalty. She started more than ten years ago with her own capital, preparing meals in small quantities.  Seeing the positive response, she decided to continue and now has her mother helping out in preparing the food and tending to the customers.  Maria shares her earnings with her mother. She thinks her business is quite profitable because she almost always sells everything she prepares, leaving her with a good income. She decided to start this business due to her need to have a job and income to cover her expenses and support her husband. 

In view of the good results she is having with her business, she has plans to continue to make it grow.  At this time she is seeking S/.1500 and she is pleased to know that she will have access to financial support so she can realize her plans. She will invest this money in the purchase of cooking utensils such as pots, plates, glasses, and other items, so she can replace her old ones and thereby offer better service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy utensils such as pots, plates, glasses, and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for medical treatment for her daughter

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine has been running a cafeteria in their village for five years. Her income has helped a lot to augment their living situation, and she has successfully repaid her previous loan that she used in her business. 

She has expanded her services by providing catering services in their village during occasions. Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy raw ingredients needed for catering. She is hoping to generate more income for the future needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for catering.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma operates a business raising pigs for sale and has been doing this for six years, earning well for family needs. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying piglets. 

Being a member of GDMPC helps her improve her quality of living. 

Recently, she took a new loan to purchase additional piglets. She plans to use her revenue to build a livestock shelter for business expansion.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets.

loans.name: Gerry

texts.en: Gerry operates his transportation-services business to make a living. He earns well from this for the family, and had successfully repaid his previous loan used for improving the vehicle. Currently, Gerry has a new loan from GDMPC micro-finance for motor maintenance and repairs costs. When he saves enough funds, he will buy a vacant lot for farming in order to earn more income.

loans.use: with motor maintenance and repairs.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn previously accessed a PHP 50,000 loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another PHP 50,000 loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products, to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell should result in greater profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marilyn dreams to be more successful in business and hopes to give her children a good life and education. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Kyeganywa Farmers' Group

texts.en:
George a member of Kyeganywa farmers group. He is a hardworking man with four children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. 

His main business is farming, the business he started with a vision of buying stock in order to boost his income. He also deals in animal sales. He is facing challenges of price fluctuation and high taxes levied on animals; however, he has a vision of educating his children to higher levels of learning. 

George has asked for a loan to buy cows to sell.

He is a member of this group in which each member guarantees the other to get a loan.

loans.use: to buy cows to sell.

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard lives and is involved in farming in Kitale in the North Rift area of Kenya. He is married and has nine children. He has practised farming for the past 18 years, where he produces and sells milk,eggs,maize,and some vegetables. Besides farming,he also has a transportation business where he transports people and goods via a motorbike. In farming he enjoys poultry the most,but in poultry the major challenge is poultry diseases.
Leonard chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they help farmers with loans that will improve their farming activities,and their loans are also on a short- term basis, thus easy repayment of the loan. With this loan, Leonard will be able to increase his production and thus give his children a better education.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools for providing construction services.

loans.name: Loem's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Loem is aged 53 years and married with six children. To make a living and support their family, Loem and her husband have been farming rice and growing sesame as their primary business for ten years. The current business earns about 37,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

This is the fifth micro loan for Loem with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now leading her group to request a loan, Loem, will use her portion to pay for  harvesting rice. She hopes to cultivate her rice to earn more income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting rice.

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
Sokha is age 32 years and married with two children. She is a rice farmer who has been in this business for 11 years to make a living. She supplements the family’s income by selling grocery items. She can earn about 26,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

She is a fifth-cycle client with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Sokha is going to use her portion to pay harvesting fees, and she will use a portion of it to spend on more grocery items to sell. She hopes to earn more income for her family.

loans.use: to pay harvesting fees and buy grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Sarahi Nohemí

texts.es: Sarahi es originaria de la ciudad de Granada, Soltera. Tiene 22 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de artículos del hogar. Inicio su pequeño negocio con el apoyo de su mama y poco a poco fue saliendo adelante. Su meta próxima es conseguir más clientes a los cuales les pueda ofrecer sus productos. Solicita el crédito para la compra de Artículos de hogar tales como: Planchas, Licuadoras, Abanicos, Arroceras entre otros. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá ofrecer mejores productos a sus clientes. Su plan futuro es incrementar la cartera de clientes de su negocio.
texts.en:
Sarahi is originally from the city of Granada. She is single and 22 years old. She works as a shopkeeper, working in the sale of home goods. She started her small business with the support of her mother and little by little she moved forward. 

Her next goal is to obtain more customers to whom she can offer her products. She is requesting the loan to purchase home goods like irons, blenders, fans, and rice makers, among others. She estimates that the loan will be very helpful to her since she will be able to offer better products to her customers. Her future plan is to increase the group of customers of her business.

loans.use: to purchase home goods like irons, blenders, fans, rice cookers, among others.

loans.name: Somaly's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Somaly is a 41-year-old married mother of four children, all of whom are dependent on her and still in school. She and her husband have earned a living through growing beans and selling grocery items. The current business earns her about 120,000 KHR per day and she manages to save about 50,000 KHR each day for future needs after deducting daily expenses. 

Somaly has been with VisionFund for three cycles and completely paid back the past loans which have helped her family have enough food. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income from her rice paddy so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis is 45-year-old lady, living with her spouse and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother. Her daughter has reached the age of marriage and Nargis wants to save so that she can arrange a dowry for her daughter. It seems impossible in the absence of a profitable source of income.

Nargis's two sons have been driving auto rickshaws for many years. Their incomes are insufficient to feed their own families. Both of her sons have to maintain the auto rickshaws but they do not have sufficient funds to do this. Therefore, Nargis requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so her sons can fix their rickshaws and cherish their families.

loans.use: to pay cash for the maintenance of rickshaws.

loans.name: Bajramsha

texts.en:
Bajramsha is from the Ashkali community and is a mother of six children, three boys and three girls, between ages 1.5 and 11 years old, with only two of them currently attending school. The last year has been very difficult for Bajramsha since her husband passed away, leaving her to raise six children on her own and creating a state of depression for her. 

Bajramsha used to work together with her husband, selling different pieces of clothing in a market, but after his death she was unable to continue their business, due to family and house responsibilities. Instead, she now receives a social pension and some assistance from a humanitarian organization, but it is not enough money and she continues to be very poor and to live in bad conditions. 

Bajramsha has applied for a loan in the amount of EUR 600 (Euros) in order to facade the inside and outside of the house, creating better insulation for the home, by keeping the heat in and the cold out. This will not only improve the overall living conditions of her family and allow them to live comfortably in the winter, but it will also contribute to their overall health and well-being.

loans.use: to facade the inside and outside of the house, creating better insulation for the home, by keeping the heat in and the cold out.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a married lady with two children hailing from Ruharo, a suburb in Mbarara municipality. Unfortunately, her husband’s earning is meager and he also doesn’t mind about the family and even the children’s school tuition. 

She operates a business dealing in clothes and it’s where she earns income for survival with the children. Because of the little earnings from the shop, she has been forced to also venture into banana planting. She is requesting a loan of UGX.1,000,000 to improve on the plantation. This she hopes will improve her productivity and income in the long run.

loans.use: To buy mulches for the banana plantation.

loans.name: Sarin

texts.en:
Sarin, 49, lives in a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district, Cambodia. She is married and has two children, both of whom are still in school. For the last 12 years, Sarin has been growing rice and watermelon. To supplement her income, she also sells grocery items. She is able to earn about 25,000KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

Sarin has been with VisionFund for five cycles. She has used the past loans wisely and successfully to improve her family’s livelihood. She is now applying for a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland and will use a portion of it to buy zinc to renovate her old house. She hopes to earn more from her crops and have a decent house for living in.

loans.use: to buy zinc to renovate her old house.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Cosma

texts.en:
Cosma is 24 years old, single and a resident of Masanafu in Rubaga divison. 

Cosma started a plastic Chinese shoes business two years ago. His business is strategically located in the business center of Kampala. 

However, Cosma has a challenge of inadequate capital which limits his business growth because he doesn’t have enough capacity to stock his business to the maximum. Hence, he is requesting financial support of two million UGX in order to boost his business. 

Cosma is a hardworking and ambitious young man.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Pastora Evangelina

texts.es:
Pastora tiene 56 años de edad estado civil unión libre,  vive con su esposo. Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.
La ventanilla se llama SAN NICOLAS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Nicolás, perteneciente a la parroquia Ricaurte cantón Urdaneta, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Pastora se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Ventanas en Agroquímicos Briones y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.
El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado a fomentar su economía. Su sueño es tener una vivienda digna para vivir.
Le gusta viajar con su familia.
texts.en:
Pastora is 56 years old. She lives with her husband in a common-law relationship in the  canton of Ventanas in los Rios Province. The communal bank is called "San Nicolas" located in the community of San Nicolas belonging to Ricaurte Parish, Urdaneta Canton, The members work in agriculture and livestock.

Pastora works in agriculture, growing corn and rice. She buys her supplies in Ventanas at Agroquímicos Briones and sells her product in Ventanas' markets. The loan she is requesting is to buy fertilizer, urea and liquid fertilizer for her corn and rice crops. The loan will help her to boost her finances. Her dream is to own a dignified home. She enjoys traveling with her family.

loans.use: to plant corn.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es viuda y vive en casa de su hijo en la zona de miraflores de la ciudad de La Paz. 
 
Actualmente trabaja en un empresa de seguros de vida como promotora pero ademas percibe una renta de jubilada, con estas dos actividades ella se mantiene y cubre sus minimas necesidades.
El crédito que solicita es para pagar un tratamiento medico, ya que adolece de la garganta y los médicos del seguro no pudieron curarla.

El sueño de Maria es poder terminar su casita e irse a vivir ya que actualmente vive incomodando a su hijo.
 
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito en IMPRO y la primera vez en KIVA.
texts.en:
Maria is a widow and lives in her son's house in the area of Miraflores in the city of La Paz.

Currently, she works for a life insurance company as a promotor but she also receives retired income. With this two activities, she maintains and covers her minimal necessities.

The loan that she is requesting is to pay for medical treatment since her throat hurts and her medical insurance couldn't cover it. Maria's dream is to be able to finish her little house and go to live there since currently she is bothering her son.

This is the first time she has requested a loan from IMPRO and the first time from Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for medical treatment of a sore throat.

loans.name: Maria Olivia

texts.es:
María, se encuentra descapitalizada, por lo que opta por otro crédito para surtir el inventario de su negocio, necesita comprar reconstituyentes, vitaminas, suplementos alimenticios, entre otros, con base natural y química para seguir a tendiendo a sus clientes.
Con el préstamo anterior ella surtió el negocio en su momento y le permitió seguir trabajando, aumento sus ventas, atrajo más clientes, cancelo la deuda y ha podido cubrir los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en: María finds herself without capital. She has decided to request a loan to invest in her business. She will buy tonic, vitamins, food supplements, etc. both natural and chemical, to continue to service her clients. With the last loan she stocked her business which allowed her to continue working, increased her sales, attracted new clients, paid off her debt and covered the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy tonic, vitamins and food supplements.

loans.name: Kaniypa

texts.ru: Канийпе 44 года, замужем, вместе с супругом Жанибеком воспитывают 7 детей. Канийпа многодетная и счастливая мама. Старшие трое-студенты, остальные трое-школьники, а самая младшая дочка -дошкольного возраста. Канийпа гордится своими детьми, за то что привила им любовь и уважение друг к другу, а также трудолюбие. У Канийпы - среднее образование, она оптимистично идет по жизни, знает конкретно чего хочет и добивается всего своими силами. Канийпа знает как правильно использовать и планировать денежные средства для достижения поставленных целей. Канийпа вместе со своей семьей в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, стартовав 25 лет назад, с покупки скота на 3,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Канийпы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 9 овец, 2 лошади, 2 козы. Для содержания скота имеются все условия: сарай для содержания скота, отгонные пастбища. Сено и корма для скота заготовлены в достаточном количестве. У каждого члена семьи есть свои функциональные обязанности, и каждый старается внести свою лепту в улучшение материального положения своей семьи. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Канийпа обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом -на покупку одной дойной коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Канийпа планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство времянки.
texts.en:
Kanpiya is 44 years old and married; she and her husband, Janibek, are raising seven children.  Kanpiya is rich in children and a happy mother.  The three eldest children are in college, the next three are in school and the youngest daughter is not yet in school.  Kanpiya is proud of her children and the fact that they are all hard-working children who love and respect each other.  Kanpiya has a high school education and her outlook on life is optimistic.  She knows exactly what she wants and she goes after it with all her strength.  She knows how to properly spend and budget her money to reach her goals.

As the main source of income for their family, Kanpiya and her husband raise livestock, a business they started 25 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 3,000 som KGS.  Thanks to her hard work, Kanpiya now has two dairy cows, nine sheep, two horses and two goats on her farm.  She has everything she needs to take care of the animals, including a barn and a roaming pasture, and she gives them enough hay and feed.  Every member of the family has their own responsibilities, and everyone tries to contribute to the betterment of their family's living conditions.  Their monthly income is 15,000 com (KGS).  

With the goal of developing her farming business further, Kanpiya has turned to the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" for a loan to buy one dairy cow to increase her head of livestock.  She plans to use the income from this loan to further increase her head of livestock, as well as to save up money to construct outhouses.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more paracetamol, cough tablets, quinine, etc. for her business,

loans.name: Waggwa

texts.en:
Wagwa is a third time borrower client of Ugafode microfinance ltd (MDI), applying for a loan of five hundred thousand shillings (500,000). Wagwa has paid all his previous loans well and on time. His previous loan to his business expanded it, and this enabled him to get an average income that has enabled him to provide his children and family relatives with their basic needs.

Wagwa says he has regular clients, but now he has an immediate challenge of paying tuition for his children, who were not given report cards because of fee balances owed. Thus, he is applying for a loan to clear them. He thanks Kiva lenders through Ugafode for coming in handy when he has exhausted all his financial sources.

loans.use: To pay tuition for his children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more underclothes, body cream, powder, soap, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more artificial hair, rice, and oil to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more rice and oil for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more dishes for resale in her business

loans.name: Maa Laxmi Self Help Group

texts.en:
The group Maa Laxmi Self Help Group has nine members who are all from the same neighborhood. In the picture, the lady seated second from the right side is Santilata.

Santilata is a 30-year-old lady who lives with her husband and two children, age 9 years and 7 years, in small village of Odisha, which is in eastern India. Both the children are studying in a local school. Santilata, together with her husband, takes all the responsibility for all the household expenses. 

In order to help with all the family expenses, Santilata has been selling breakfast foods like samosa, badi, iddli, and dosa, along with other meals and snacks through a food stall near her house. She buys her inventory from a wholesaler near her village. 

In order to strengthen the business and respond to client demand, she wants to add more different types of food items in her food stall, which the locals call a “tiffin center.” She wants to purchase more inventories in bulk to reduce the purchasing price and transportation costs. 

All the other group members are engaged in various activities like small grocery shops, vegetable shops, fish selling, etc. Their goal is to increase their business activity to help support their families.

Santilata, along with her group members, has requested a loan amount of 135,000 INR for their projects.

loans.use: To purchase inventory in bulk such as flour, sugar, rice, oil, gas, and spices for her food stall.

loans.name: Maa Chandi Thakurani Self Help Group

texts.en:
The featured borrower of this group is Bishnupriya who is sited second from left with register in picture. She lives in Eastern India in the state of Odisha with her husband and two children in a joint family with her husband’s parents, his elder brother and his elder brother’s wife. Bishnupriya's husband and his brother work at the local petrol pump to provide for the family. However, their earnings are not enough to support all the household expenses, so Bishnupriya is requesting a loan so she can buy a cow to raise and bring in extra income for the family. 

She has never been in a business before, but she is excited to start and contribute to the household needs. While she only finished primary education, she says, “I want a better future for my children, I want them to be highly educated and settled in a good way.” 

She says thank you to People’s Forum and Kiva for helping her get this loan and helping her family improve their livelihoods.

loans.use: To purchase her first cow to start a milk business.

loans.name: Maa Mangla Shg (A) Group

texts.en:
Santilata is one of 12 women in her village who stepped up to form Maa Mangla SHG so they could help support each other financially and improve their families’ standards of living. In the picture, the lady who is seated third from left is Santilata. They also attend business training sessions together that are run by the local NGO. All of the women are taking out a group loan to expand their businesses, which include agriculture, small shops, and dairy farming.

Santilata is using her loan to further develop her agricultural business, which she works in with her husband to support their three children. They have a 10 year old son and two teenage daughters who attend the local school. Specifically, Santilata will use the loan to buy more seeds and fertilizer and to purchase additional land to cultivate the crops on. She says she is “excited for my Kiva loan so I can improve my business and improve my life.”

loans.use: To buy more seeds and fertilizer and to purchase additional land for her agriculture business.

loans.name: Erlita

texts.en:
Erlita, who is a married mother of one, has been operating a business in front of her house since 2012, an enterprise she started with her own capital of $300. Living in a town by the main road, many people, including students, come to buy everyday, and she is making a good income.

Erlita will use this $1000.00 loan to buy coffee, sugar, cigarettes, water, noodles, bread, oils and slippers to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy coffee, sugar, cigarettes, water, noodles, bread, oils and slippers

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica lives near Cherengani, close to Kitale town. Veronica is married, and has five children. Her husband works as a police officer, while she farms their land. She has been farming for eighteen years, and is currently growing maize, millet and doing dairy farming as well.

This is Veronica’s first loan, and she plans to use the income generated by her beehives to invest in her land and educate her children.

Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda, and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano that straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Ednah

texts.en:
Edna lives close to Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.

Edna has four children, and has been farming for twenty years. She is currently growing coffee, bananas, maize, beans, and vegetables on her farm. She is excited to start beekeeping for two main reasons: "I love honey. I substitute sugar for honey any time. I am also sure it will make me good money over the years."

This is Edna's first loan with Honey Care, and she plans to use the income generated by her beehives to increase the number of beehives on her farm. Her hope for the future is, "to grow economically and be comfortable in life."

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
A $1,000 loan is offered to Fatima to improve her business.  She opened her kiosk in 2001 with her own $500.

She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store like fish, milks, Sagiko (a soft drink), coffee, sugar, cigarettes, noodles, salt, soap and water. She is generating a good income from selling her things from the kiosk.

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business, and she is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: to buy fish, milks, Sagiko (a soft drink), coffee, sugar, cigarettes, noodles, salt, soap and water

loans.name: Musharafkhon

texts.ru:
Мухарафхону 44 года. Она уроженка городка Исфары. Мурафахон замужем и с мужем воспитывает двоих сыновей. Сыновьям 21 и 19 лет. Одной из причин, по которой муж Мушарафхона ее очень сильно любит, это из-за того что она вкусно готовит. Мушарафхон как и многие таджички умеет готовить и старается, чтоб ее блюдо понравилось ее мужу. В Таджикистане, особенно в районах и селах мало кафе и столовых, потому что большинство женщин умеют готовить. Мушарафхон не исключение. 
   Мушанафхон пользуясь своим мастерством, решила начать собственный бизнес. Она хочет заняться выпечкой кондитерских изделий. Но чтобы начать данный бизнес ей потребуется купить печь и продукты для выпечки. Она решила взять кредит, чтобы приобрести необходимые средства. Для Мушарафхон ее новая деятельность уже значить многое и она верит и надеется на Вашу помощь.
texts.en:
Musharafkhon is 44 years old. She is a native of the town of Isfara. Musharafkhon is married and with her husband is raising two sons. Their sons are 21 and 19 years old. One of the reasons that Musharafkhon's husband loves her so much is that she cooks so deliciously. Musharafkhon, like many Tajik women, knows how to cook and strives for her dishes to be enjoyed by her husband. In Tajikistan, especially in the districts and villages there are few cafes and dining halls, because the majority of women know how to cook. Musharafkhon is no exception.

Using her skills, Musharafkhon decided to start her own business. She wants to make baked goods. But in order to start this business, she needs to buy ovens and products for baking. She decided to take a loan to acquire necessary means. Her new activitiy already means a lot to Musharafkhon and she believes in and hopes for assistance.

loans.use: to purchase ovens and products for baking

loans.name: Marubeni

texts.es:
Marubeni, de 38 años de edad, está casada con Digno y tiene 02  hijos de 12 y 10 años de edad con quienes vive en su casa propia. El negocio que tiene Marubeni es la venta de comidas. Todos las tardes instala su mesa en el frontis de su casa propia y oferta todas sus viandas preparadas, además de refrescos, atendiendo muy amablemente a sus clientes quienes son en su mayoría sus propios vecinos, y la recomiendan a otros personas que con el tiempo se vuelven sus clientes habituales. Se inició hace más de 08 años con un préstamo particular, comprando y vendiendo en pocas cantidades, para luego ir aumentando de acuerdo a la demanda de sus comidas, y hasta el momento lo realiza ella sola. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las ganancias que le deja, ya que casi siempre acaba todo lo que prepara para vender. Además comenta le gusta su negocio pues conoce de cocina y se decidió a empezar por la necesidad de contar con un ingreso propio y tener un oficio pues la pensión para sus hijos no les alcanzaba y tenía apuros económicos. En esta oportunidad solicitara S/.600 está contenta de saber que seguirá teniendo acceso a una línea de crédito para continuar con sus planes.
El  monto solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de ingredientes tales como arroz, verduras, carnes, entre otros.
texts.en:
Marubeni is 38 and married to Digno, and they have two children aged 12 and 10 who live with them in their own home. Marubeni's business is selling ready food. Every afternoon she sets up her table at the front of her house and offers all her prepared food, as well as snacks. She provides an attentive service to her customers, who are principally her neighbours. They recommend her to other people, who become regular customers over time. She started off more than 8 years ago with a private loan, buying and selling in small quantities, and then increased them according to the demand there was for her meals. She has done this on her own until now. She considers her business quite viable because of the profits it provides, since she almost always sells everything she prepares for sale. In addition, she comments that she enjoys her business because she knows about food, and she decided to start it off in order to have her own income, as the pension for her children was not enough and she had economic issues.

On this occasion she is asking for a loan of 600 PEN, and she is happy that she will continue to have access to a line of credit to continue with her plans. She will invest the loan in buying ingredients such as rice, vegetables, and meat.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice, vegetables and meat.

loans.name: Las Esmeraldas Group

texts.es: Mirell de 37 años de edad es  separada con 02 hijos en etapa escolar, actualmente pertenece al grupo “Las Esmeraldas” constituida por 07 socias responsables, ya que no han tenido problemas en sus pagos. Mirell se dedica a la venta de bebidas, comenzó hace 03 años  dicha actividad la cual  le ha ido bien. Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación a logrado apoyar a sus hijos en  sus estudios. En esta oportunidad solicito el  crédito  para la compra de bebidas como agua mineral, gaseosas y cervezas. Posteriormente piensa instalar una bodega, pues así asegura ella tendrá mayores ganancias. El grupo “Las Esmeraldas” agradece  a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito.    Mirell es la primera del lado izquierdo y viste polo color verde.
texts.en:
Mirell is 37 years old, separated, and has 2 school-aged children. Currently she belongs to the group "Las Esmeraldas," which is made up of 7 responsible associates, who have not had problems with their payments. 

Mirell works in the sale of beverages. She started this activity 3 years ago, which has gone well for her. With much effort and dedication she has been successful in supporting her children in their studies. 

In this opportunity she requested the loan for the purchase of beverages like mineral water, sodas, and beer. Afterward she is planning to set up a shop, since in that way she will be assured of having better profits. The "Las Esmeraldas" group is thankful to the people who made this loan possible. Mirell is the first one from the left and is wearing a green shirt.

loans.use: to purchase beverages like mineral water, sodas, and beer.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: Bertha de 74 años de edad, es divorciada y madre de 03 hijos, los cuales ya son independientes. Vive sola en su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Bertha es la confección, confecciona ropa para damas, caballeros y niños para toda ocasión, promociones,  quince años, escolares y otros, lo cual lo realiza en su casa propia en un ambiente bien equipado con máquinas de coser y muebles, donde atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes. Trabaja en una empresa privada medio tiempo y por las tardes realiza la actividad de costura. Comenta que esta actividad  es  rentable porque le da un buen ingreso económico porque  dio  una buena educación a sus hijos y comodidad. Puede pagar los gastos de su casa. Antes de empezar con este negocio su sueldo no le alcanzaba. Espera seguir creciendo y comprar nuevas máquinas y ampliar su negocio. En esta oportunidad solicitara S/.1200, está muy contenta de poder contar con el apoyo financiero que viene recibiendo, ya que así avanzara con su negocio y se convertirá en una gran empresaria. Con el préstamo solicitado comprará materiales de confección como telas, elásticos, entre otros  para implementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Bertha is 74 years old, divorced, and the mother of 3 children, who are already independent. She lives alone in her own house. Bertha works in sewing. She sews clothing for women, men, and children for all occasions, school years, quince años (15-year-old birthday parties), school uniforms, among others. She does this in her own house in a well-equipped environment with sewing machines and furniture, where she attends to her customers in a very friendly way. She works in a private business half time, and in the afternoons she sews. She comments that this activity is profitable because it gives her a good income because she gave comfort and a good education to her children. 

She can pay for the expenses of the house. Before starting this business her wages were not enough for her. She hopes to continue growing and to buy new machines and expand her business. In this opportunity she is requesting 1200 PEN. She is very content to be able to have the financial support that she is receiving, since in this way she will advance in her business and will become a great businesswoman. With the requested loan she will buy sewing materials like fabric and elastic, among others to help her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials like fabric and elastic, among others.

loans.name: Ganzhina

texts.ru: Ганжине 20 лет. Она хорошая девушка с приятным внешним видом, которая имеет математический клад ума. Ганжина является студенткой 2 курса Таджикского Государственного Технологического Университета. Ганжина учится на хорошие оценки и ее преподаватели довольны ею. По специальности она бухгалтер аудит и будущим она хочет стать хорошим специалистом. Ее родители не в состоянии в этом году оплатить за ее учебу в университете и Ганжина надеется только на вас. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебы в университете. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Ganzhina is 20 years old. She is a kind young woman with a pleasant outlook, who has a real gift with mathematics. Ganzhina is a second-year student at the Tajik State Technological University. Ganzhina studies with good grades and her teachers are happy with her. She is majoring in audit accounting and in the future wants to become an expert.

Her parents are not in a position to pay her tuition at the university and Ganzhina hopes for support. She is requesting a loan for tuition at the university.

loans.use: to pay for tuition

loans.name: Angel

texts.en:
Angel has been providing the services of carrying passengers and baggage to their destination for many years in order to earn a living. He earned enough from this that he was able to provide for his family, and he has successfully repaid his previous loans used for the business. 

Currently, he took a new loan to cover repairs and maintenance costs. It is good to improve his services to gain more customers and profits. While saving a portion of his income for any future family emergencies, Angel plans to buy a new motorcycle to add to his business.

loans.use: to cover repairs and maintenance costs.

loans.name: John Bosco

texts.en:
John Bosco is a 36-year-old married man who used his previous loan to buy welding materials. He lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is metal fabrication and welding, along with electrical installation in order to boost his income. He is facing the challenges of limited space and capital to carry out his business activities with ease. 

His dream is expanding his business to new areas and also educating his children to the university level. John Bosco is in need of a loan to buy welding materials for his metal shop.

loans.use: to buy welding materials for his metal shop.

loans.name: Martha Lucía

texts.es:
Martha ha sido ama de casa durante los años que lleva casada, madre de 2 hijos a los que cuidó y sacó adelante con gran esfuerzo y amor, luego de que crecieron ya tenía más tiempo libre, por lo que comenzó a capacitarse en diferentes artes como confección, manualidades, y artesanías y, poco a poco fue elaborando sus productos y comenzó a comercializarlos entre sus vecinos y amigos, adicionalmente ofrecía ropa, lo que complementaba sus ingresos. De esta forma ha generado ingresos con los que apoya a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.
El crédito que solicita será invertido en la compra de insumos y mercancía al por mayor (telas, hilos, pinturas, figuras en cerámica, entre otros), esto le permitirá continuar con su labor y ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes, además podrá cubrir los pedidos que tiene pendientes, esto le ayudará a mejorar las ventas e ingresos.
Martha manifiesta que su proyecto a futuro es fortalecer y hacer crecer aún más su negocio con el ánimo de generar oportunidades de empleo para algunos familiares que lo requieren y así mejorar la calidad de vida de todo su entorno familiar.
texts.en:
Martha has been a housewife since she got married.  She is the mother of two children whom she took care of and brought up with great effort and love. Once they were grown she had more free time so she began to teach herself different crafts such as sewing and handicrafts. Little by little she created her products and began to sell them to her neighbors and friends. She added in clothing which added to her income. This has generated income which supports her husband with the household finances.

The loan she is seeking will be used to invest in the purchase of supplies and merchandise at wholesale (fabric, thread, paint, ceramic figurines, etc.).  This will allow her to continue to work and offer more variety to her customers.  It will also allow her to fulfill the orders she already has, and will increase her sales and income. Martha states that her future plans are to strengthen and grow her business even more with the aim of generating job opportunities for some family members who need it and thereby improve the quality of life for her whole family.

loans.use: to buy supplies and merchandise at wholesale (fabric, thread, paint, ceramic figurines, etc.

loans.name: Ivane

texts.en: Ivane is a 36-year-old married man from Gori City. He lives with his wife, two sons and one school-aged daughter. The only source of the family's income is Ivane's work; trading with fruit and vegetables. He started this activity one month ago, and generated 400 GEL. Only this income is hardly enough for a five- member family to meet all daily costs, so Ivane decided somehow to expand his activity to another area of work and start a mushroom business. He requested a loan 5000 USD to purchase a special variety of mushroom seeds and after it's growing, start trading with this product. Ivane's loan was approved with the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, that enables people to start or re-start businesses. This loan will be a huge support to this hard-working man and his family, to ensure his children get a good education and better living conditions. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to cultivate a special variety of mushrooms.

loans.name: Kimheng's Group

texts.en:
Age 57, Kimheng is widowed and lives with her family in a rural area located in the Mongkol Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province. She has four children. She earns a living through raising pigs. She can earn about KHR 50,000 per day from the current business and is able to save about KHR 40,000 each day for the future. 

This is the second loan for Kimheng with VisionFund. She used the first loan wisely and successfully to improve her family’s livelihood. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Kimheng is going to use her portion to buy pig feeds for her pig. She hopes to fatten her pigs so as to sell them for a good price.

loans.use: to buy pig feeds for her pig.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Mach's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district, Mach is a 40-year-old mother of one son, who is still in school. She is a rice farmer in the local area and supplements her family’s income by growing cassava for 22 years. The current business earns her about 36,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s need. 

Mach has been with Vision Fund for one cycle, and completely paid back the past loans which have helped her to better support her family. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Mach is going to use her portion to pay for harvesting her cassava. She hopes to earn more crops so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting her cassava.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Evangelist

texts.en:
Evangelist, 47, is a resident of Kyanyanda Rugaaga, Isingiro district. He dropped out of school upon the demise of his father, which left him with no means of raising fees for his education. Pushed by the need to support his aging mother and young siblings as the elder son in the home, he settled at their home and started serious maize farming. 

This business grew and helped him to sustain his father’s family and to support education for his young brothers. He later obtained a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from Ugafode which helped him to purchase a maize-milling machine, which added value to his product.  

Now, Evangelist is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 UGX to help him buy another maize-milling machine, because he cannot meet the increasing number of customers by using only one machine.

loans.use: To buy a maize-milling machine.

loans.name: Villamhor

texts.en:
Villamhor is 25 years old and manages corn crop production to earn a living and sustain the needs of his parents and siblings. He wishes to earn and save more income from his business to offer a comfortable life to his parents and future family.

To achieve his wish, he plans to add up his capital by borrowing from lenders. So, he is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase corn seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming. He hopes that lenders will grant his requested loan in attainment of his goal in life.

loans.use: to purchase corn seed, fertilizers and insecticides for use in farming

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en: Due to hardships of living, Analyn and her husband are striving hard to increase their income to support the necessities of their family. They operate a motorcycle transport business and they also sell different frozen foods within the local community for additional income. To further improve the business, Analyn is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) to buy spare parts and accessories for her motorcycle. She also wants to buy frozen foods to sell to generate more income.  Through patience and hard work, she believes that someday, she will become financially stable and give her children a bright future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and accessories for her motorcycle, and to buy frozen foods to sell.

location.town: Brgy. Don Mariano Perez, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Mohinisso

texts.ru: Мохиниссо трудолюбивая женщина. Она родилась в 1988 году. Мохиниссо замужем и имеет маленьких детей. Она никогда нигде не работала. Мохиниссо решила организовать свой бизнес, так как она нуждается в деньгах. Она решила организовать свой бизнес скотоводством, так как она живет в сельской местности и имеет хорошие условия для развития данного бизнеса. Мохиниссо с такой целью обучилась в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки скота. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Mohinisso is a hard working woman. She was born in 1988 and is married and has small children. She has never had a job. She decided to form her own busines, since she needs to earn money. She decided the business should be raising livestock because she lives in a rural area and has the right set up for this work. With her goal in mind, Mohinisso took a course called Reach Success, offered by the Association of Business Women, and earned a certificate. She is asking for a 5000 somoni loan to buy livestock. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy cattle to start a new business

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en: Thomas is a 46-year-old hardworking man who has six children. He lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. He used his previous loan to buy soap, sugar and other items for his shop. Thomas has fulfilled his personal goals of educating his children and has built a permanent home.Though Thomas has a main hardship of competition, he has hopes of owning a wholesale shop in the near future. He intends to use the loan to buy soap, sugar, salt, crates of sodas and beers for the festive season to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap, sugar, salt, crates of sodas and beers for the festive season to sell.

loans.name: Aniceta

texts.en:
Aniceta is 53 years old and married with five children. For the past five years, she has operated a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines. Aniceta is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Aniceta is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Meredith

texts.en:
Meredith is a hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines for the past 14 years. She also earns additional income from running a general store. Meredith has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF.

Meredith is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more boxes of dried fish to sell. She dreams of repairing and renovating her family home in the future.

loans.use: to purchase boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, oil, pepper, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Maa Mahamayee Self Help Group

texts.en:
Saudamini is the president of Maa Mahamayee SHG and she is pictured here, third from left, in a sky-color sari. She lives with her husband and his parents along with her three children, one son and two daughters. Her husband works as a teacher at the local school and she has been managing a small cable business, supplying the people in her village with wires and cords for their different activities. Together their incomes support their family. 

Saudamini is now asking for a loan to expand her cable shop so she can also start selling badi and papad, two local fried snacks made from ground wheat and lentil flour. She notices many of her customers in the main market are hungry when they are shopping and suspects she will be able to significantly increase her income once she adds this part to her business. She will also buy more cables in bulk so that she can get them at a cheaper price per unit and earn more profits.

She says thank you to Kiva and, “I am excited for this Kiva loan for a new bright future in my family’s life.” 

The other women in her group are also engaged in running small shops and agriculture.

loans.use: To purchase more wires and cords for her cable business and to start her snacks business.

loans.name: Abdusalom

texts.ru:
Абдусалом в настоящее время живет с женой и матерью.  Он занимается откормом и куплей продажей коз и овец. Из-за нехватки корма   он вынужден был продать свой скот.  Теперь он хочет купить скот и зимой  пасти , чтобы весной смог продать подороже. Его сыновья работают в России, но они присылают деньги своим женами детям  на проживание, поэтому ему больше некуда обратиться  за финансовой поддержкой и  с этой целью   Абдусалом обратился в МДО Арванд , что бы получить кредит для покупки скота. Это его очередной  кредит в Арванде.
 С помощью этого кредита в этот раз он собирается купить корову  тем самым развивая свой бизнес.  Он  планирует  производить молоко и крут(кисломолочные шарики) и другие молочные продукты, чтобы потом продовать и приносить доход для благополучия своей семьи.
texts.en: Abdusalom currently lives with his wife and mother. He is in the business of raising and selling goats and sheep. He had to sell his livestock because of a lack of feed. Now he wants to buy more livestock and winter feed so that he can resell them in spring for a profit. His sons work in Russia, but they send money for their wives and children to live on, so he can not ask them for support. He contacted MDO Arvand for a loan to buy livestock. This is not his first loan from Arvand. With the help of the credit this time he plans to buy a cow to develop his business. He plans to produce milk, krut (cultured milk balls) and other milk products to sell and earn income for the wellbeing of his family.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Ines

texts.en:
A $1,000 loan is offered to Ines to improve her business. Ines opened her kiosk in 2000 with her own working capital of $100.

She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store like a refrigerator, noodles, coffee, sugar, salt, milks, water, Sprite, beer, Sagiko and Coca Cola. She is generating a good income from selling.

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. She is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, noodles, coffee, sugar, salt, milks, water, Sprite, beer, Sagiko and Coca Cola

loans.name: Omm Sairam Self Help Group

texts.en:
Bijuli is the president and featured borrower of Omm Sairam SHG. She is standing fourth from left in picture. She formed this group so the women of her village in Odisha, a state in eastern India, would be able work together and help each other improve their livelihoods. Through the group they support each other financially and emotionally.

Bijuli lives with her husband, their two small children, and her husband’s parents in the village. Her husband works at the local grocery shop while she tends to the children, as they are too young for school. As they are growing, however, they can take care of themselves a little more, and Bijuli has more time. She would now like to go into business to help contribute to the growing family expenses.

For this reason, she is taking a loan to start growing vegetables, particularly ladies’ fingers or orchra, which is really popular in her town. She is excited for this loan and the opportunity to go into business. She says, “Thank you, Kiva” for giving her this opportunity.

The other women in Bijuli’s group are also engaged in small agricultural businesses or run shops in the village market. They will use their loans to improve their businesses and help provide for their families.

loans.use: To purchase vegetable seeds and fertilizers to start her new vegetable business.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina lives in a town with her family. Since 2012, she has been operating a kiosk that she started with her own working capital of 300 USD. Angelina generates a good income from selling products.
