Angelina is requesting a 600 USD loan to purchase stock such as candles, coffee, sugar, soap, shampoo, and oil to improve her business. In the future, she is thinking of running a bigger business.

loans.use: to buy candles, coffee, sugar, soap, shampoo, and oil

loans.name: Secundino Antonio

texts.es: Don Secundino es un señor que laboró como guarda de seguridad pero la empresa donde trabajaba dejo de operar, ahora con su liquidación empezó su propio negocio, la venta de paylas  y peroles que realiza junto a su esposa en las calles cerca a su casa, don Secundino solicita este crédito para continuar la construcción de un cuarto que ha venido haciendo paulatinamente, con el préstamo anterior solamente logro comprar una parte de los materiales, espera con este terminar esta obra tan importante para su familia.
texts.en: Don Secundino worked as a security guard, but the company he worked for closed down. As a result, he set up his own business, selling pots and pans with his wife in the streets near his home. Don Secundino is requesting this loan to continue building a room he has been working on slowly. With the previous loan, he only managed to buy some of the materials he needed. He hopes that this time, he can finish this work which is so important for his family.

loans.use: to buy cement, iron, sand and blocks.

loans.name: Timiditha

texts.en:
Timiditha is a fish vendor from Lila, Bohol. She is married with seven children. The youngest child is four years old. 

Timiditha sells fish to help augment the income of their household. Her business started more than 10 years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy various fresh fish, to meet the family's daily needs.

In the future, Timiditha hopes to expand her fish-vending business and increase business profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy various fresh fish

loans.name: Eligio

texts.en:
Eligio is a good farmer. He has been running this kind of business for ten years. He is 43 years old, married to Libeta and blessed with three children. The couple wants to cover all the basic necessities of their children. 

However, due to insufficient capital Eligio decided to seek a loan amounting to PHP 10,000. This loan will be used to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for his farming business. He hopes to produce better crops as a result of this loan in order to protect his family from poverty.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides used in farming.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en: Ernesto operates a general store in his village and he earns enough from this that he has been able to provide the needs of his family. He has also successfully repaid his previous loans used for additional capital.  Presently, Ernesto is taking a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.  He is determined to improve his general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Hanifan's Group

texts.en:
Hanifan is a 29-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She requested a loan for her husband’s greengrocery business. Her husband sells seasonal vegetables from a cart. He purchases fresh vegetables in bulk and sells in the local community from his cart. 

He is using a donkey cart to carry excess vegetables. With his donkey cart he can easily carry more vegetables than a manual cart. His savings have been spent to purchase the donkey cart, and he does not have enough money to buy more stock of vegetables to sell.

Therefore, Hanifan requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner so that her husband can buy vegetables in bulk in large quantities. Hanifan is very thankful to  Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

Note: Hanifan stands in red dress in the picture above.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en: Zainabu is a resident of Nkokonjeru in Mbarara District. She started a small retail shop some 4 years back, but could not yield anything because of lack of capital. That is when she got to know about Ugafode microfinance and acquired a loan of 1,000,000 UGX which helped her business grow, and because of Zainab’s hard work, she continued expanding. Now she is requesting another loan of 1,000,000 UGX to boost her business. This will help her meet her client's needs and also increase her profits. She is a hard working young woman.

loans.use: To buy retail stock to sell to her customers

loans.name: Audith Maria

texts.es:
Ella Audith, es una mujer de 25 años, llego a la ciudad de Bogotá hace 7 años para estudiar, trabajar y empezar a alcanzar las metas y propósitos. 
Audith actualmente  tiene una familia conformada por esposo y una hermosa hija de 5 años; actualmente trabaja en una casa de familia.
Audith aspira estudiar  auxiliar de enfermería en la institución campo alto, porque le gusta ayudar a las personas, es muy paciente y no es asquienta, para hacer más llevadera la complicada situación en la que un ser humano se encuentra al estar enfermo así como también el sentirse útil o necesitada por los demás,. Quiere brindarle un mejor futuro a su familia y tener una estabilidad económica.  
El convenio con kiva seria bueno porque ella tendría una ayuda económica extra para la familia y para ella misma.
texts.en:
Audith is a 25-year-old woman who came to the city of Bogotá 7 years ago to study, to work, and to begin to accomplish her goals and purposes.  

Her family is composed of her husband and a beautiful little girl, who is 5 years old.  Currently, she works at home.

She hopes to study to be a nursing assistant at the CampoAlto School because she likes helping people, she is very patient, and she is not squeamish.  She wants to make the complicated situation in which people who are ill often find themselves more bearable, and she wants to feel useful and needed.  

She wants to provide a better future for her family—and the Kiva agreement would be good, as she will have extra financial help for her family and for herself.

loans.use: to pay for a semester's tuition.

loans.name: Inga

texts.en: Inga is a 45-year-old woman. She lives with her eight-year-old son. Inga is a teacher at a local school. In addition, she is involved in agricultural activities. She has a vineyard and grows grapes to sell. Inga requested a loan to start up a business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 2000 GEL to renovate a flat. After the flat is renovated, she will rent it out and will generate income. With the increased income, Inga will provide better living conditions for her son. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to renovate a flat and rent it out.

loans.name: Horacio Guillermo

texts.es:
Horacio ha sido un hombre trabajador y pujante, actualmente es jubilado de una empresa textil muy reconocida en la ciudad, a la cual le dedicó 40 años de su vida.
Con el dinero de la liquidación decidió emprender su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes que ubicó en un espacio de su vivienda, con el ideal de seguir siendo productivo y generar ingresos para solventar los gastos del hogar.
Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para fortalecer su negocio, pues desea realizar mejoras locativas (pintar y poner una reja) y comprar surtido al por mayor (granos, lácteos, gaseosas, mecato, carnes frías, entre otros), esto le permitirá dar una mejor imagen al establecimiento y además tendrá más variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes, satisfaciendo sus diversos gustos y necesidades, esto dará como resultado un incremento en las ventas y por ende, en los ingresos que percibe.
Horacio, a sus 65 años de edad, manifiesta que aún tiene energías para seguir trabajando en pro de la consecución de su sueño que es tener un supermercado, en el que los clientes encuentren todo lo que necesiten en un mismo lugar, esto le permitirá tener una mayor rentabilidad y podrá disfrutar de una vejez tranquila, sin ninguna preocupación monetaria y además podrá apoyar económicamente a sus 4 hijos.
texts.en:
Horacio has been a hard-working and thriving man. Currently he is retired from a textile company that is well recognized in the city, to which he dedicated 40 years of his life. With the close-out pay he decided to start his own business, a grocery store that he placed in part of his home, with the ideal of continuing to be productive and to generate income to pay for the expenses of the home. 

Currently he is requesting the support of a loan to strengthen his business. He wishes to make improvements to the store (paint and place a screen), and to stock up in bulk goods (grains, milk products, sodas, cakes, cold cuts, among others). This will allow him to give a better image to his establishment and have more variety in products to offer to his customers, satisfying their diverse tastes and needs. As a result, this will give an increase to his sales and consequently, the income that he receives. 

Horacio, in his 65 years of age, expresses that he still has energy to continue working for the achievement of his dream, which is to have a supermarket, in which his customers find everything that they need in the same place. This will allow him to have a better profitability and he will be able to enjoy a calm old age, without any monetary worry. Furthermore, he will be able to financially support his 4 children.

loans.use: to make improvements to the store (paint and place a screen) and to stock up in bulk goods (grains, milk products, sodas, cakes, cold cuts, among others).

loans.name: Sabohat

texts.ru: Сабохат участвовала в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она участвовала в данном курсе, потому что она хочет организовать свой бизнес. Она планирует организовать свой бизнес изготовлением и продажей кондитерских изделий. Она хочет открыть кондитерский цех. Сабохат будет управлять бизнесом сама. Она воспитывает одного ребенка. Сабохат всегда хочет условия проживания для своего бизнес. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки муки, сахара и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Sabohat took part in the Reach Success course organized by the Association of Businesswomen, and earned a certificate. She attended the class because she wants to start her own business. She plans to start a bakery, where baked goods will be made and sold. Sabohat is going to run the business herself. She has one child. She has always wanted a space for her business. She is asking for a 5000 somoni loan to buy flour, sugar, etc. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy flour and sugar to start a new bakery business

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is an entrepreneur from Amulung. She is 47 years old, married and had three children.

She is raising hogs for future sale. Now, she wanted to improve the growth of her hogs but she had insufficient funds, so that is why she is asking for a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy feed and medicines for hogs. She hopes to keep improving her business for better sales and income, too. 

She hopes to keep developing her business and become a successful hog raiser someday.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for hogs

loans.name: Moustapha

texts.fr:
Moustapha fait un renouvellement de crédit dans la même structure. Un renouvellement qui lui permettra d’acheter des poussins et de faire de l’aviculture. Comme il l’avait déclaré, il voulait diversifier son activité et faire de l’élevage de poulets de chair en sus de sa boutique d’alimentation générale qu’il tient depuis plus de 14 ans.
Moustapha a comme charge, la location de sa boutique et l’entretien des membres de sa famille. Toujours dans la logique de diversifier ses activités génératrices de revenus, il compte sur l’IMCEC pour réaliser son vœu.
texts.en:
Moustapha is renewing his loan with the same arrangement. This is a renewal that will enable him to purchase some chicks for poultry farming. As he had stated, he wanted to diversify his business and raise frying chickens along side his grocery store, which he has had for fourteen years. 

Moustapha’s expenses include the rent for his store and caring for his family members. Constantly diversifying his revenue-generating busineses, he is counting on IMCEC to make his wishes come true.

loans.use: to purchase chicks to raise and also various goods for his shop

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina is 50 years old, married, and blessed with two children. For the past seven years, she has owned and operated a restaurant in her village. Saturnina earns a net income of 6,000 PHP each day. She spends her daily profit on school fees for her children as well as purchasing hog and chicken feed to sell and generate additional income. 

Saturnina is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan to purchase raw meat, fish, vegetables, and soft drinks for her restaurant. In the future, she hopes that her business will continue to grow so that she can earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase raw meat, fish, vegetables, and soft drinks for her restaurant

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a 32-year-old married man with two children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has been in the farming business for 10 years in the rural areas of Kyenjojo. He obtains additional income from salary from the tea estates. He started his business to get more income for educating his children and to build a permanent home. He is faced with lack of capital to expand his banana plantation farm to a large estate and the increasing banana bacterial wilt in Kyenjojo. Robert is requesting a loan to pay workers.

loans.use: to pay workers.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 36 years old and married with four children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past three years, she has run a general store in the Philippines where she sells a variety of items such as shampoo, canned goods, detergent, soap, cooking oil, noodles and other products. Delia works very hard to provide for her family.

Delia is requesting a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items such as shampoo, canned goods, detergent, soap, cooking oil, and noodles to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, canned goods, detergent, soap, cooking oil, noodles, and other products

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 44 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Evangeline is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional livestock for her business.

Evangeline has been raising livestock for two years and earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock for her business.

loans.name: Ramurah

texts.en:
Ramurah, 42, is a single mother with four children who are aged 16, 20, 22, and 23 years respectively. She lives on the outskirts of Kyotera town with her family.

Ramurah is a businesswoman who deals in welding and hardware. She operates her two businesses in the nearby trading center where she works twelve hours a day, seven days a week. She supplements her income with agriculture growing coffee. She says that her clients are local people from nearby villages.

Ramurah has been in these businesses since 1992 and she started them with the aim of getting money for paying school fees and taking care of the children's other needs. She has acquired this loan in order to pay tuition for her daughter. This is her ninth loan and she has been able to educate her children.

Her greatest dream is to educate all her children but she faces the challenge of poor payments by her customers who take materials on credit and take long to settle their debts.

She describes herself as a hard working lady.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees

loans.name: Maa Tarini Self Help Group

texts.en:
In 2004, nine women from a village stepped out and formed Maa Tarini Self Help Group in Odisha, a state in eastern India. They help each other, sharing their problems and solving them together.  They also celebrate their festivals together in their village.
  
Ranjita, who is an active member of this group, is engaged in a fishing business. In the picture, the woman standing in the middle is Ranjita. She purchases the fish from different places and ponds and sells them near the market in the village. She, along with some group members, also does fish rearing in a pond that is near her house. Ranjita’s husband also does this business and helps Ranjita. In this way, she is earning some money that she puts towards household expenses. However, it is not sufficient to manage all her daily activities and monthly family expenses, as her three sons and one daughter, ages 18, 15, 13 and 11 years, are all studying in the local school. 
	
Therefore, she wants to use a loan to enlarge her business. Specifically, she along with some other group members, wants to take a pond on rent and will purchase more baby fish to rear. In this way, they can earn a good amount after all expenditures in the business. 

Some of the group members are doing fish businesses and other are engaged in some other activities like vegetable cultivation and selling, small grocery shops, etc. Ranjita and her group members have requested a loan of 198,000 INR for the group.

loans.use: To rent a pond and purchase young fish to raise.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 38-year-old man living in Masindi, Uganda. He has a poultry farm located in a rural area and he also earns a salary. George started his business to earn a living and he hopes to educate his children through higher institutions. His major business challenges are inadequate capital to maintain his stock and the scarcity of chicken feed.
 
George is requesting a loan to buy chicken feed.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed

loans.name: Gulira

texts.ru: Гулире 33 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 сыновей. У Гулиры - высшее образование, окончила университет, по специальности "биоэкология". Трудовую деятельность начала в средней школе, затем вышла замуж, но продолжила работать. По характеру Гулира очень ответственная, общительная, жизнерадостная. В данный момент Гулира в декретном отпуске по уходу за ребенком. Вместе с мужем Гулира занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 10 лет назад, с покупки скота на 30,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Гулиры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь, 1 бычок, 2 теленка, 40 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 4,000 сом (KGS) от реализации молока, также обрабатывает 2,0 ГА земли, где в основном выращивает -фасоль и картофель. Полученный урожай реализуют оптовым поставщикам. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулира обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку жеребят для увеличения поголовья скота. После закупки жеребят, они будут находиться в собственном хозяйстве. Летом скот будет под присмотром пастуха. Доходы от кредита Гулира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на расширение сарая для содержания скота.
texts.en: Gulira is 33 years old, married and has three sons with her spouse. She has a college education, having graduated from university with a degree in bio-ecology. She began working in a high school, then got married but continued working. Gulira is naturally very responsible, sociable, and cheerful. Currently she is on maternity leave to care for her baby. Gulira and her husband farm and raise livestock. They started 10 years ago with 30,000 som (KGS) worth of livestock. Thanks to hard work, they now own 2 dairy cows, a horse, two calves, and forty sheep. Their monthly income is 4,000 som (KGS) from milk sales. They also farm on 2 hectares, growing mainly beans and potatoes. They sell the harvest to wholesale suppliers. With the goal of further developing the business Gulira contacted the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan to buy foals to expand their herd. The foals will stay on their own property. In the summer the livestock are under the care of a shepherd. Gulira plans to invest income from use of the loan into further expanding her herd, and plans to save money to expand the livestock barn.

loans.use: to buy foals

loans.name: Agustino

texts.en:
Agustino is a 55-year-old man with six children who lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. He is a farmer who also sells produce. Agustino is a hardworking man. His major business hardships are weather changes that hinder his harvest and inadequate capital to meet increasing business demands. 

Agustino is requesting a loan to construct a chicken house and buy chicken feed. His personal dreams are to fulfill his family’s needs, especially to educate his children. In the future, Agustino would like to diversity his farm and venture into mechanized farming and a wholesale poultry business.

loans.use: to construct a chicken house and buy chicken feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more toothpaste, soap, body cream, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Fernando wants to become a public accountant but needs a degree to make it possible. Fernando is currently attending the Universidad San Fransisco Xavier, working towards his degree in public accounting and finance. He expects to graduate in April, 2015, but without a loan is unsure how he will be able to continue affording his education. He says that his alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until he could return. Fernando says that it is important to him to graduate on time so he can enter into the job market as soon as possible. 

With this loan, Fernando plans on buying his school books. Up until now he has been managing to get by without them, but it has become a challenge. With books and school supplies he feels he will be able to get better grades. 

Fernando currently works 30 hours a week in a store, but making time for his job, his classes, and studying is a challenge. With a career in public accounting and finance, he expects to earn $14 a day. With four other siblings, Fernando is unsure how he will be able to finance his education on his own without the assistance of a Vittana loan.

loans.use: to pay for textbooks.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.en:
Juan dreams of becoming a computer engineer. To achieve his goal, Juan has enrolled in the Universidad Autónoma Juan Misael Saracho. He plans on graduating in December, 2014, but without a loan from Vittana, he fears that he will need to defer his graduation. 

With this loan, Juan plans on purchasing his much needed textbooks and school supplies. With the proper books, Juan feels he will be able to study more effectively and earn better grades. 

In addition to his responsibilities at school, Juan currently works 30 hours a week in a computer repair shop and earns $6 a day. With a degree in computer engineering he expects to earn $20 a day. 

As the youngest of four, with one older sibling attending college already, Juan is unsure how he will be able to finance his education on his own without the assistance of a Vittana loan.

loans.use: to pay for textbooks.

loans.name: Santina

texts.en: Santina is applying for a loan of $600.00 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is 38 years old. She is married and she has six children. She is running a kiosk in front of her house and she will use the loan to buy a refrigerator and items to keep in her store such as soft drinks (Fanta, cocacola, Sprite, Saigiko), beer, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, slippers, water, milk and bread. She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future. She is living in a town near the school; her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people, including students, come to buy.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator, soft drinks, beer, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, slippers, water, milk and bread.

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en:
Josephat lives near Cherenagni, close to Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region.

Josephat is unmarried, and has no children. He is a relatively new farmer, having farmed for only two years, and he is currently planting maize, beans and sunflower as well as raising livestock. His sunflower crops will be particularly welcome to his beehives, as bees love to forage on sunflower when it is in bloom. 

This is Josephat’s first loan, and he plans to use the income generated by his hives for personal use as well as to start some new projects on his land.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Miguel Francisco

texts.en:
Miguel dreams of becoming an environmental engineer. Miguel was accepted into the Universidad Autónoma Juan Misael Saracho and now with the chance to achieve his dream, he is concerned about affording his final graduation fee. He plans on graduating in June, 2014, but without a loan from Vittana, he fears that he will need to defer his graduation. 

Often there are fees for earning your title in environmental engineering before graduating. With a loan, Miguel plans on covering the cost of his graduation fee. 

In addition to his responsibilities at school, Miguel currently works 30 hours a week and earns $17 a day. With a degree in environmental engineering he expects to earn $25 a day. Miguel's parents never had the opportunity to complete their high school education. Because of this, the family's finances were always tight while he was growing up. With one younger brother and one younger sister, Miguel hopes to be a role model for his younger siblings by being the first in his family to graduate from university.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees.

loans.name: Sheril

texts.en:
Sheril lives close to Sindo, a small town in Homa Bay county. Homa Bay county is located in southwestern Kenya, and it borders onto Lake Victoria, the second-largest lake in the world. Populations are dense close to the lake, where many individuals make their living from fishing, and a few work in the small but slowly growing tourism industry. A popular tourist attraction in Homa Bay county is Ruma National Park, a game reserve that is home to the rare roan antelope, a shy species distantly related to the reticulated giraffe. Most people in Homa Bay make their living from farming, and the rolling hills of the area are dotted with fields and fruit tree plantations.

Sheril is married and has three children. Her husband is a social worker. She has been undertaking farming for five years and she is currently growing millet, beans, maize and sweet potatoes in her farm. She is excited about beekeeping as it will be an opportunity for her to earn extra income.

This is Sheril’s first loan with Honey Care and she intends to use the proceeds from her beekeeping to pay for her children’s school fees and to provide for their basic needs. Sheril’s hope for the future is to save up enough money to educate her children and to own her own livestock.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a computer, printer and certifications to launch her business, and to pay for marketing.

loans.name: Lili

texts.es: Lili, de 44 años de edad, esta casada con José y tiene 04 hijos de 21, 18, 13 y 7 años. La a actividad que realiza Lili es la venta de productos comestibles de primera necesidad, para eso cuenta con una tienda que instaló en el interior de su vivienda, donde atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes que en su mayoría son sus vecinos y ha sabido ganarse sus preferencias por el buen trato que les brinda. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable pues sus productos son de primera necesidad y se venden a diario. Antes de empezar con su actividad, no tenía problemas, pero si los deseos de generase sus propios ingresos. Por tanto, viendo los buenos resultados que está teniendo, tiene deseos de continuar con su negocio e incursionar en otro negocio de venta de ropas, pues ha visto que es bastante rentable. En esta oportunidad solicitara S/.1200. Está contenta de saber que contará con el apoyo financiero para avanzar con su negocio. El  monto solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de productos comestibles tales como arroz, leche, azucar, entre otros.
texts.en:
Lili is 44 years old, married to José, and has 4 children who are 21, 18, 13, and 7 years old. Lili works in the sale of food products that are basic necessities. She has a store that she set up inside her home, where she attends to her customers in a very friendly way, the majority of whom are her neighbors. She has been know to satisfy their preferences due to the good treatment that she gives them. 

She considers her business to be very profitable since her products are basic necessities and are sold daily. Before starting with this work, she did not have problems, but she wished to generate her own income. Therefore, seeing the good results that she is having, she has wishes to continue with her business and enter into another business of selling clothes, since she has seen that it is very profitable. On this occasion she is requesting 1200 PEN. She is happy to know that she will have the financial help to advance in her business. She will invest the requested amount in the purchase of food products like rice, milk and sugar, among others.

loans.use: to buy food products like rice, milk and sugar, among others.

loans.name: Hisham

texts.en:
Hisham is a 34-year-old married man from a small village near Jenin city. He lives with his wife and a little son in a small, simple house. Hisham is an employee in the public sector where he earns a low income. Hisham works also on his land, where he plants seasonal fruits and vegetables and sells his crops at the local market. 

Hisham took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy an agricultural tractor for his farm. By taking this loan, Hisham will be able to increase his productivity and improve the family conditions. 

Hisham appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy an agricultural tractor for his farm

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
To make a living, Domingo manages his own rice farm in his village. He earns well from this. He successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC that he used for farm fertilization. Becoming a member of GDMPC helped him to improve his quality of life. 

Recently, he took a new loan to purchase fertilizer for this cropping season. He hopes to see his children successful in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Bisojida

texts.en:
Bisojida was born in 1972. She is married and bringing up 3 children. 

Bisojida began her business with selling milk 10 years ago. She developed her business little by little. She changed her business some years ago. Now, Bisojida sells industrious goods such as threads, screwdrivers, glue, etc. She has a place to sell in a local market. She works hard to provide her children with food and education. She is going to increase working capital. Bisojida is asking for a loan of 1,500 Somoni to buy industrious goods such as needles, threads, glue, etc. She awaits your support and, in advance, thanks you for your charity.

loans.use: To buy industrious goods such as needles, threads and glue

loans.name: Nigina

texts.en: Nigina was born in 1987. She is married and has 2 children. She is a successful businesswoman in her village. She has a beauty salon. Her shop is located in the center of her village. She manages the business successfully and has regular customers. She is proud of her job because she makes up brides-to-be for their wedding celebrations. She is going to develop her business. She also wants to rent wedding dresses to brides. She is asking for a loan of 1500 USD to buy wedding dresses. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy wedding dresses to rent out.

loans.name: Reymund

texts.en: Reymund, 47, is married. He is a farmer who dreams of increasing his crop production so that he can generate greater profits every crop season. Income from his business goes toward his family's daily needs, such as food and other household expenses. Now,he is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy corn seeds, fertilizer and insecticide for his farming business. He hopes to yield better crops through these purchases. A better yield will help improve his living situation and financial stability.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizer and insecticide for his farming business.

loans.name: Louise

texts.en: Louise is 21 years old. She is single with one baby child. She sells different items such as rice, flour and salt. With the loan she wants to buy more maize flour to sell. The profits will be used to expand the business by buying more stock to sell. She was very happy with the previous loan that helped her to restock her business.

loans.use: to buy more maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Peruth

texts.en: Peruth is 30 years old. She is married with five children. She has been in business for the past fifteen years. She has been selling soda and beer. She has requested a loan to buy more beer to sell. She plans to reinvest the profits from her business to ensure a better future.

loans.use: to buy more beer to sell.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is a 49-year-old man with three children, all attending school, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. 

His main business is compound-cutting and designing. He has been running the business since 2000. After working as a watchman for some time, he decided to buy a grass-cutting machine, thus employing himself. His main challenges are competition and also limited capital to start-up another business. His dream is building a good house. 

Vincent has asked for a loan to renovate his house.

loans.use: to renovate his house.

loans.name: Immaculate

texts.en:
Immaculate used the previous loan to buy clothes and pay school fees for her children. She has continued with the same business of selling clothes alongside earning money from rentals. Her main challenge is low capital. However, she has a vision of educating her children to higher levels of learning. 

Immaculate needs a loan to stock more secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.use: to stock more secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Martha Guadalupe

texts.es: Doña Martha es originaria de la ciudad de Granada, Viuda y madre de dos hijos ya independientes. De 50 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de comideria y pulpería. Inicio su negocio hace diez años con una pequeña pulpería, y poco a poco también comenzó a vender comida rápida por las tardes. Solicita el crédito para la compra de Mesas y Sillas para su pequeño negocio de comida. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda para mejorar las condiciones de su negocio y lograr atender de una mejor manera a su clientela. Su plan futuro es ofrecer sus productos en ferias que se realizan en su ciudad y mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Doña Martha is 50 years old and is from the city of Granada.  She is a widow and the mother of two children who now live on their own. She is a businesswoman who runs a small eatery and general store. She started her business ten years ago with a small general store and bit by bit she began to sell fast food in the afternoons. 

She is asking for this loan so she can buy tables and chairs for her small eatery. She thinks that this loan will be very useful so she can improve the condition of her business and provide better service to her customers. In the future she plans to offer her products at local fairs and to fix up the infrastructure of her house.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs for her small eatery.

loans.name: Hem's Group

texts.en:
Hem lives in a rural village of the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is 28 years old and married with two children, both of whom are dependent upon her and in school. To support her family, she has been farming rice and growing cassava for ten years. The current business earns her about 38,000KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Hem has been with VisionFund for one cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. She will use her portion to buy zinc for building her house, and she will use a portion of it to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her rice paddy so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Marcela María

texts.es:
Marcela es una joven de 24 años de edad, que se ha desempeñado como vendedora de mostrador en diferentes almacenes del municipio, así ha obtenido experiencia y ha generado ingresos para apoyar a sus padres con la carga económica del hogar. 
Pero, con su espíritu de superación y con las ganas de salir adelante, desea iniciar su propio negocio de venta de mercancía por catálogo, ya que se ha dado cuenta que es un negocio rentable, pues los productos que ofrecerá son muy reconocidos y solicitados por las personas que tienden a cuidar su salud y nutrición; es por ello que solicita el crédito con el que comprará mercancía al por mayor (malteadas, suplementos dietarios, multivitamínicos, entre otros), esto le permitirá tener disponibilidad para poder comenzar a ofrecer sus productos, con lo que espera generar recursos suficientes para mejorar la economía familiar.
Marcela manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es posicionarse en el mercado y lograr una estabilidad económica favorable para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Marcela is a young 24 year old woman who has worked as a demonstrator in different stores in town.  This way she has gained experience and earned income with which to support her parents with the household expenses.

With her spirit for success and desire for getting ahead, she wants to start her own business of selling merchandise via catalog, because she has learned that this is a profitable business and the products she will sell are known and sought after by persons who want to care for their health and nutrition.  She is asking for this loan in so she can buy merchandise in quantity (milk shakes, dietary supplements, multivitamins, etc.)  This will allow her to begin offering her products in hopes of generating sufficient resources to improve her family finances.

Marcela says that her main desire is to position herself in the market and improve her family’s financial conditions.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Sayda  Brigeth

texts.es:
Ella es Sayda tiene 16 años, acabo de terminar el bachillerato en el colegio Rembrandt lo cual para ella ha sido una experiencia inolvidable ya que le gusta estudiar y esforzarse para que todo le salga excelente ya que ella quiere salir adelante para ayudarle a los padres y darles todo lo que necesiten, ya que son lo único que tiene porque ella no tiene hermanos y la mama no puede trabajar debido a que tuvo una complicación de salud  y el único dinero que entra es el que gana el padre que trata de rebuscarse de una y otra manera para sacar a la familia adelante y poderle dar estudio a la hija, por este motivo ella necesita del convenio de kiva para que el padre tenga más facilidades de pago. 
Ella quiere estudiar enfermería ya que le parece muy interesante aprender todo acerca de la salud y del funcionamiento del organismo de los seres humanos, además que es una carrera con la cual se puede encontrar trabajo un poco más fácil y de este modo puede ayudarle a el padre con los gastos de la casa y comprar las cosas de el.
texts.en:
This is Sayda.  She’s 16 years old and is about to finish her high school degree at Rembrandt high school.  High school has been an unforgettable experience for her because she likes to study and make an effort so that everything comes out well for her.   She wants to get ahead so that she can help her parents and give them everything they need.  Since she doesn’t have any siblings, she is all they have.  Her mother can’t work due to a health complication; the only money that comes in is what her dad earns.  He tries to scrimp and scrounge one way or another to get his family ahead and give his daughter an education.  Because of this, she needs a Kiva agreement so that her father can have easier terms of payment.

She wants to study nursing because it seems really interesting to her to study everything about health and the functioning of the human body.  Additionally, it is a degree with which she can find work a little more easily.  So, she’ll be able to help her father with the household expenses and buy his things.

loans.use: to pay for registration for one semester

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Nyagota Kilimo Group

texts.en:
This group is part of the Nuru International group of farmers called Nyangoto Kilimo and is based within Kuria West District. The members of the group came together in order to grow socially and economically through agriculture.

The person raising his hand is Jacob, 35, who is married with two children who go to school. Jacob has been a member of the group for two years and he is the group’s chairperson.

Jacob has been learning better farming methods within his group and desires to use hybrid seeds and fertilizers on his farm to grow maize, sorghum and millet during the 2014 long rains season. He is, however, constrained financially and is hoping to receive a loan from Kiva that will enable him purchase these farm inputs. He believes that the use of hybrid seeds and fertilizer will increase his yields and he will not only get enough food for his large family but also be able to sell the surplus and invest in a business to obtain money to pay for his children’s school fees and other domestic uses.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet.

loans.name: Tomás

texts.es:
Tomas esta separado de la esposa y vive con su hija menor en la zona de Munaypata de la ciudad de La Paz,  de profesión protesista dental (elabora prótesis dentales).
 
Actualmente trabaja por mas de diez horas en su propio domicilio en un taller que instalo en la planta baja de la vivienda. Tomás a muy corta edad tuvo problemas con su dentadura por lo cual su objetivo principal fue estudiar para protesista, ahora  lo que hace es mejorar la salud de las personas   para que tengan una mejor nutricion, ya que según los estudios que realizo todas las personas productos de una mala dentadura tienen un mal aliento, mala masticacion, ocacionando que la salud vaya desmejorando.

El crédito lo requiere para compra de oro para las prótesis dentales, pues tiene varios pedidos de clientes que desean que sus prótesis tengan en sus dientes una chispa de oro. 

Es la sexta vez que solicita crédito en IMPRO y la segunda vez en KIVA.
texts.en:
Tomas is separated from his wife.  He lives with his minor daughter in the Munaypata area of the city of La Paz.  He makes dental prosthesis.  

He currently works for over ten hours in his own home.  He works in a shop that he installed on the ground floor of his house.  Tomas had dental problems at a very early age.  Therefore, his main objective was to study to make prosthesis.  What he does now is to improve peoples’ health so that they have better nutrition.  According to the studies that he did, all of the people who have bad teeth have bad breath and bad chewing.  This impairs their health.

The loan that he needs is to buy gold for the dental prosthesis.  He has several orders from customers who wish that their dental prosthesis have a bit of gold.

This is the sixth time that he has requested a loan with IMPRO and the second time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy gold to put in some customers' teeth according to their orders.

loans.name: I Putu

texts.en:
I Putu, working as a farmer, specializes in rice fields. This work is practiced as the area supports, with enough water, throughout the year and over a large area.

Due to weak economic conditions, I Putu has no paddy fields. He serves the rice processing property of others and will be paid after the harvest. Today he got a job to cultivate a paddy area of 3 hectares. It requires a capital of 10,000,000 IDR which will be used to hire tractors, buy seed and fertilizer and pay for labor. With the skills he has, I Putu is always able to deliver maximum results in every harvest and all of his customers are satisfied. With all the planning that he's done, I Putu is optimistic that the results will be obtained in accordance with the target. 

I Putu has a dream to open a shop in front of his house.

loans.use: to hire tractors, buy seed and fertilizer, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Shoira

texts.ru: Шоира добросовестная женщина. Ей 31 года. Она вдова, так как ее муж умер несколько лет назад. Шоира сама воспитывает своих 3 не совершеннолетних детей. Шоира работает упорно для того, чтобы зарабатывать на жизнь. Она имеет свой собственный бизнес. Шоира изготавливает салаты и продает на местном рынке. Она имеет свою торговую точку. Шоира также делает консервы. Шоира хочет увеличить оборотный капитал и таким образом увеличить доход. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки банок, овощей и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Shoira is a conscientious woman.  She is 31 years old and a widow, as her husband died a few years ago.  Shoira is raising three young children herself and she works hard to provide for her family.  She has her own business making salads and selling them at the local market, where she has her own trading stall.  She also makes conserves.  Shoira wants to increase her working capital so she in turn can increase her income.  She is asking for a loan of 2,000 somoni to buy jars, vegetables, etc.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and jars to increase her working capital

loans.name: Abduhamid

texts.ru: У него трудное условия жизни и низкий доход, но доброе сердце и хороший нрав. Он – Абдухамид из Таджикистана, которому 43 года, женат и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Более 10 лет он занимается скотоводством. Его сыновья помогает ему в ведении бизнеса. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами он хочет развевать свой бизнес, а для этого ему необходимо увеличить оборотный капитал. Он запрашивает займ на сумму  5000 сомони, чтобы купить скот. Доход, который он будет получать от бизнеса, будет использовать для образования своих детей и улучшения условия жизни. Он нуждается и ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: He has difficult living conditions and a small salary, but he has a kind heart and a good temper.  He is Abduhamid from Tajikistan and he is 43 years old and married with three children.  For more than ten years he has been raising livestock.  His children help him run his business.  With the goal of providing for his family's needs, Abduhamid wants to increase his business, for which he will need to increase his working capital.  He is asking for a loan of 5,000 somoni to buy cattle.  He will use the income from this increased business for his children's education and to improve their living conditions.  Abduhamid needs and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle to increase his working capital

loans.name: Dúo Mezquital Group

texts.es: Dúo Mezquital, este dúo esta formado por el señor Jharint Augusto de 33 años de edad, el se dedica a la venta de carnitas y chicharrones , se ha dedicado a esta actividad desde hace 8 años, en esta oportunidad esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mesas y sillas para su negocio ya que en esta epoca de navidad es cuando mas se vende y el mobiliario que tiene no le es suficiente para toda su clientela que lo visita, esperando que ustedes le puedan ayudar con el credito silicitado.
texts.en: One of the members of Dúo Mezquital is Jharint Augusto, 33.  He has been selling meat products and pork crackling for eight years.  He is asking for a loan to buy tables and chairs for his business because Christmas is a time when he sells the most and the furniture he currently has is not enough to seat all his customers.  He hopes that you can help him get the loan he has asked for.

loans.use: to buy chairs and tables for selling pork crackling in his business

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru: Дилором родилась в 1987 году. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Дилором решила организовать свой собственный бизнес, так как она не имела в течение многих лет источника дохода. Дилором очень хочет улучшить условию проживания. С такой целью она обратилась в ИМОН за займом. Дилором участвовала в курсе. «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Дилором запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки скота и корма для скота, чтобы организовать бизнес. От полученного дохода она собирается улучшить условию проживания. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Dilorom was born in 1987. She is married and has two children. She decided to start her own business since she hasn't had a source of income for many years. She really wants to improve her living conditions. With her goals in mind she approached IMON for a loan. She attended the Reach Success course presented by the Association of Businesswomen and earned a certificate. Dilorom is asking for a 5000 somoni loan to buy livestock and animal feed to start her business. She plans to use the income earned to improve how she lives. She is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy cattle to start a new business

loans.name: Panglan Indah Group

texts.en:
Island of the Gods, Bali, is predominantly a Hindu religion, and some people from Badung regency, precisely Panglan village, are joined together with MUK in a loan program intended for a pig-breeding group. For housewives in Bali, it has become commonplace to have a pig at home that is used to support the family income and the husband's income. But the problem is, most of them do not know the correct way of raising pigs. To improve their skills, they join a group. In addition to exchanging information, they are also applying for a loan from MUK.

Ni Nyoman, a housewife, has three children, and all of them are still in elementary school. Her husband works as a driver. She became the head of the Panglan Indah group to enhance their capacity in terms of raising pigs and raising capital for the business. The loan proposed will be used to buy three piglets, and the rest to buy feed. In a period of six months, the pigs are ready for sale. The advantage gained from this effort will be used entirely to support the economy of the family and for saving.

loans.use: to buy three piglets and feed

loans.name: Nozima

texts.ru: Нозима хочет организовать бизнес купле  продажей детской и женской одежды.  Нозима родилась 1982 году. Она имеет  высшее  образование по специальности юриста. Она разведена, имеет двоих детей.  Семья состоит из трех человека.    Бизнесом, Нозима будет, занимается дома.  Ее покупателями будут родственники, соседи, знакомые и подружки.  Нозима будет заказывать товар с Дубая, где живет ее сестра со своей семьёй.  Нозима будет отправлять деньги через знакомых сестре, а сестра будет отправлять товар. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 долларов США для покупки женской и детской одежды, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Nozima wants to start a business buying and selling children's and women's clothing.  She was born in 1982 and she has a higher education in law.  She is divorced and has two children.  Her family consists of three people.  Nozima will run her business from her home.  Her buyers will be relatives, neighbors, acquaintances and friends.  She will order her goods from Dubai, where her sister lives with her family.  Nozima will send money through acquaintances to her sister, and her sister will send her the goods.  She is asking for a loan of $2,000 to buy women's and children's clothing to start her new business.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy children's and women's clothes to start a new business

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline is a married woman and a mother of four children from Bohol, Philippines. She has been engaged in seaweed farming, together with her husband, for more than ten years now. Evangeline is asking for a loan to buy seaweed seedlings, straw, rope and sticks for seaweed farming. With this, she will be able to improve her seaweed farm.

loans.use: to buy seaweed seedlings, straw, rope and sticks for seaweed farming.

loans.name: Rudelyn

texts.en:
Rudelyn is 32 years old and married with three children. Rudelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Rudelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, bread, juice, dried fish, candies, etc. to sell.

Rudelyn has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, bread, juice, dried fish, candies, etc. 

Rudelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like canned goods, bread, juice, dried fish, candies, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a married parent of ten children, Josephine works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell vegetable business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from farming rice. Josephine is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall.

loans.name: Mimosa

texts.en:
Mimosa is a married parent of four children. She runs a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming vegetables. Mimosa works hard to support her family and she has been sustaining her business activities through her past 32 loans from NWTF.

Mimosa is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients such as meat, vegetables, noodles, spices, and other products for her business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase meat, vegetables, noodles, spices, and other ingredients

loans.name: Ma. Dewanie

texts.en:
Ma. Dewanie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a peanut butter vending business in the Philippines. She has run her business for five years and also earns additional income from selling vegetables and fattening pigs. Ma. Dewanie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans through NWTF. She is pictured here happily selling peanut butter with her granddaughter.  

Ma. Dewanie is requesting an 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients such as peanuts, sugar, butter, and other items for her business. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy peanuts, sugar, butter, and other ingredients

loans.name: Ethel Jane

texts.en:
Ethel Jane is single and works hard to support her family with her buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines.

Ethel Jane has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more dried fish to sell to her customers. Ethel Jane has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Ethel Jane would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is 50 years old and married with four children.

Estelita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy more goods to sell in her general store.

Estelita has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 25 years and also earns additional income from farming bananas and corn.

Estelita aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Mama Inuka Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Esperance est une commerçante d’une expérience de 4 ans, âgée de 34 ans et mère de 6 enfants dont  3  étudient et 3 autres sont encore gosses. La cliente est membre d’un collectif d’Affaires « Mama Inuka ». Elle est vendeuse de friperie. Elle installe ses marchandises sur la rue dans un quartier animé de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son activité. Elle va acheter 2 ballons de friperie. Son conjoint est un chauffeur de transport en commun(Taximan motar). Elle démarraé ses affaires avec le fonds  reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite acheter une parcelle, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs non bancables en leur accordant de microcrédit pendant, ce moment poste conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays.Il sied de signaler que certaines clientes portent leurs bébés.
texts.en:
This client, Esperance, is a merchant with four years of experience. She is 34 years old and the mother of six children, of whom three are students, and three others are still very young. This client is a member of the business collective “Mama Inuka”. She sells used clothing and sets up her merchandise on the streets in a busy district in town. 

She is requesting a loan from Hekima to grow her business. Her is going to purchase 2 bales of used clothing. Her husband is a motorbike taxi driver. She started off her business with funds from her husband. For the future, she would like to purchase a parcel of land and to provide education and food for her children. 

She thanks Hekima for its support of unbanked women entrepreneurs by according them microloans during this time of post-conflict in the eastern part of the country. It should be noted that certain clients are carrying their babies.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing to sell

loans.name: Malaika Group

texts.fr: La cliente Ndababo est une commerçante et membre du groupe d’affaires «Malaika», entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 43 ans et mère de 13 enfants, qui 11 étudient et 2 autres sont encore gosses. La cliente est une vendeuse de sorghos. Elle installe sa marchandise à son domicile devant son enclos, où, elle a su gagner sa clientèle. Elle commença ses affaires avec le premier capital reçu de son mari. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 10 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 6 sacs de sorghos.  Ainsi, elle souhaite acheter une parcelle et la construire, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. En définitif, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs exclues de système bancaire classique, surtout ; pendant ce moment difficile poste conflits dans la region de l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
This client, Ndababo, is a merchant and a member of the business group “Malaika”. She is an energetic entrepreneur, 43 years old, and the mother of thirteen children, of whom 11 are students, and two others are still very young. This client sells sorghum. She sets up her merchandise at her home in front of her fence, where she figured out how to earn her customers. She started her business with initial capital from her husband. Later on, she benefited from a loan from the microfinance institution Hekima. She has been in this business for ten years. 

This new loan is going to be used to purchase 6 sacks of sorghum. Thus, she would like to purchase a parcel of land and build upon it and to provide education and food for her children. 

In conclusion, she thanks Hekima very much for promoting autonomy for women entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system, especially during this difficult time post-conflict in the eastern part of the country.

loans.use: to purchase sorghum

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy lives in Masindi, Uganda. He sells produce alongside farming to supplement his income. Kennedy started the business to cater for his family's needs. His family dreams are educating his children and providing them with all the basic needs. However, he faces a challenge of inadequate capital to purchase stock, and poor roads that make transportation of produce to his store difficult.

Kennedy intends to use the loan to buy produce.

loans.use: to buy produce to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a feeds business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feeds to sell for her feed-selling business.

Teresita has been in this business for two years. Teresita earns more income from raising livestock.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feeds to sell

loans.name: Anally

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Anally works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling of charcoal and firewood business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Anally is borrowing 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase more stock of charcoal and firewood to sell for her business.

Anally has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of charcoal and firewood to sell

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a 35-year-old married woman living in Masindi, Uganda. She practices commercial farming from which she gets an income to look after her family. She started the business after getting advice from her friend, who encouraged her to utilize the land that was free. She has excelled and hopes to educate her children and buy more land for farming. However, she faces a challenge of finding laborers.

Juliet is asking for a loan to pay laborers to weed her field.

loans.use: to pay laborers to weed her field.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Three years ago, Delia was asked by a florist friend to help her prepare flower arrangements and decorations for an event she was working on. Owning her own cleaning business, Delia was always looking for opportunities for additional income and decided to help her friend. Though Delia thought this would just be a one-time project, she found that she had an eye for creating beautiful flower arrangements.

“I took pictures of the arrangements we made with my phone and people started asking me for flower arrangements,” said Delia. “I eventually started to approach friends who were having special events and offered to help with the decorations and flowers. They started recommending me to others.” 

Delia launched her own flower design business, specializing in custom arrangements for variety of events from weddings to Mexican quinceaneras. For Delia, it is not just about making beautiful flower arrangements, but creating an ambiance for a room that is perfect for the event. She prides herself in her personal touch and doing arrangements that do not look “commercial.”

“I love working with flowers and it is nice to see people enjoying my work,” said Delia. “When I cleaned, nobody really noticed my work, but when I decorate with flowers, they do.”

Delia is now looking to expand her business and acquire new customers. She will use her $5,000 Kiva loan to purchase materials to make more flower arrangements and a computer to help market her business with social media.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make more flower arrangements and a computer to help market her business with social media.

loans.name: Aureia

texts.en:
Aureia runs a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of 600 USD. Aureia is a hardworking woman.

Aureia is requesting a 1,000 USD loan to buy stocks such as oil, milk, eggs, coffee, and bread to improve her business. In the future, she hopes to run a bigger business.

loans.use: to buy oil, milk, eggs, coffee, and bread

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel, es la responsable de los gastos de su familia, se dedica a vender tortillas, ella vive junto a su hija, es soltera, no posee ayuda del extranjero, el negocio lo tiene desde hace 28 años y lo atiende de 8 a.m. A 5:00 p.m., es un oficio que aprendió de su mamá, tiene muchos clientes satisfechos por su producto.
Con el capital comprara leña, gas propano, maíz y cal, son los materiales que necesita para trabajar y que su negocio funcione, espera tener una producción más abundante, atraer más clientes y generar los ingresos que necesita para continuar cubriendo los gastos familiares.
Sueña con incluir otra opción de compra en su negocio  y de esa manera continuar mejorando la calidad de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Isabel is the one who is responsible for the family expenses.  She sells tortillas.  She is single and lives with her daughter.  She does not have help from abroad.  She has had the business for 28 years.  She tends to her business from 8:00 a.m until 5:00 p.m.  She learned this trade from her mother.  She has a lot of satisfied customers because of her product.

She will use the loan to buy firewood, propane gas, corn, and lime powder.  These are the materials needed for her work and for her business to function.  She hopes to have a more abundant production, to attract more customers, and to generate the income needed to continue covering the family expenses.

She hopes to include another buying option in her business.  This way she will continue improving her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy firewood, propane gas, corn, and lime powder.

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en:
Matilda dreams of becoming an accountant but without a degree knows it may never be possible. Matilda was accepted into CCA and now, with the chance to achieve her dream, she is concerned about affording her graduation fees. 

She plans on graduating in February, 2014, but without a loan from Vittana, she thinks that she may need to take time off to work and save until she can afford the graduation fee. This fee is often more expensive than the semester's tuition and is a frequent impediment for graduating students in Tarija. 

In addition to her responsibilities at school, Matilda currently works 40 hours a week as a cashier and earns $17 a day. With a career in accounting, she expects to earn $25 a day.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees.

loans.name: Salamat

texts.ru: Саламат 27 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Саламат - высшее образование, окончила университет, по специальности "экономист и менеджер". В 2006 году вышла замуж за Омурбека, в данный момент заботливая мать двоих детей и хорошая жена. С 2010 по 2011 г. работала бухгалтером - кассиром в сельской управе. По характеру Саламат очень ответственная, общительная, жизнерадостная. Саламат животноводством начала заниматься сразу после замужества, а точнее с 2006 года с покупки скота на 20,000 сом KGS. После реформы земли и распределения земельных участков начала параллельно заниматься полеводством.  Благодаря упорному труду Саламат, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 8 лошадей, 30 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 8,000 сом (KGS) от реализации молока, также обрабатывает 1,8 ГА земли, где в основном выращивает -фасоль. Полученный урожай реализуют оптовым поставщикам. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Саламат обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Саламат планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Salamat is 27 years old, married, and is raising two children with her spouse. Salamat has a college education, having graduated from university with a degree in economics and management. In 2006 she married Omurbek, and is currently the loving mother of two children, and a good wife. From 2010 to 2011 she worked as an accountant and cashier for the town government. Salamat is naturally very responsible, sociable, and cheerful. She began raising animals right after marriage, specifically in 2006, with 20,000 som (KGS) worth of livestock. After the land reforms and redistribution of land plots she also began to farm. Thanks to her tireless work, she now has three milk cows, eight horses, and thirty sheep. Her monthly income is 8,000 som (KGS) from milk sales. She also farms 1.8 hectares of land, where she mainly grows beans. The harvest is sold to wholesalers. With the goal of further developing the business Salamat approached the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan to buy cows to expand her herd. She plans to invest income from use of the loan into still further expanding her herd of livestock, and also plans to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy cow

loans.name: Maudy

texts.es: Maudy, de 32 años de edad, está casada con Augusto quien es empleado y padre de sus 02 hijos de 3 y 2 años. Juntos  están cómodamente instalados en su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Maudy es la venta de comidas. Para eso instala una mesa en el frontis de su casa donde atiende muy amablemente a todos sus clientes que en su mayoría son sus vecinos y transeúntes de la zona. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por la demanda que tiene ya que en su zona es muy conocida y solicitada, siendo sus vecinas quienes le piden que retome su negocio.  Por otro lado, ella comenta que tiene problemas económicos pues con los ingresos de su esposo no les alcanza para cubrir todos sus gastos, por tanto quiere apoyarlo generándose un ingreso adicional. Por tanto éste será el préstamo número 03 con Kiva. Está contenta de saber que contará con un apoyo financiero para concretar  sus planes. Por tanto se compromete a ser responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado de 1200 nuevos soles comprará utensilios para su negocio como ollas, vasos, platos, y otros, además de mesas y sillas e ingredientes necesarios para la preparación de sus comidas buscando precios bajos por sus compras al contado y en volumen.
texts.en:
Maudy, age 32, is married to Augusto, the father of her two children, ages 2 and 3.  Augusto is employed.  Together they are comfortably installed in their own home.  

Maudy works in food sales.  For this, she is installing a table in the front part of her house where she takes care of all her customers in her friendly way.  Most of her customers are her neighbors, as well as people passing through the neighborhood.  

She considers her business very profitable thanks to the demand for her food.  This is because she is well-known and sought out in her neighborhood, since it is her neighbors who are asking her to start up her business again.  At the same time, she says that she has financial problems because with her husband’s income they can’t manage to cover their expenses.  So she wants to help him by earning an additional income.  And so this will be her third loan with Kiva.  She is happy to know that she can count on financial support to help her cement her plans.  She is committed to being responsible about making her payments.  With the 1200 nuevos soles she has asked for, she will buy cookware for her business such as pots, glasses, plates, and others.  Additionally, she will buy tables, chairs and ingredients for preparing her food, always looking for low prices, paying in cash and buying in bulk.

loans.use: to buy kitchen tools such as pots, glasses, plates, and also tables, chairs, and ingredients.

loans.name: German Antonio

texts.es: El señor Germán, trabaja como guarda de seguridad, lucha a diario para mantener los gastos de sus tres hijos estudiantes de secundaria,  con el apoyo de su esposa. El crédito que solicita lo requiere para comprar dos puertas para instalarlas a dos dormitorio que aún le hace falta esta pieza tan importante de una habitación.
texts.en: Germán works as a security guard.  With the help of his wife, he struggles everyday to take care of the expenses of his three children, all studying in secondary school.  He needs this loan to buy two doors.  These are to install on two bedrooms which are still missing this very important part of a room.

loans.use: to buy two doors for bedrooms.

loans.name: José Osmín

texts.es:
José de 30 años de edad, es una persona soltera que estudio hasta noveno grado. Se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. Junto a sus padres que le apoyan en la actividades agrícolas y en el ordeño de los animales que poseen (vacas), ya que dependen de las actividades que él realiza.

José junto a sus padres se dedican a la agricultura, oficio que aprendió de ellos;  para llegar a la parcelas camina 6  Km y trabajan durante la mañana y su madre se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a cuidar las vacas que poseen.


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar una vaca, que necesita para incrementar la producción de leche para la venta y obtener mejores ingresos. 

Él desea construir en un futuro una vivienda digna para su padre, ya la que en la que actualmente habitan es de adobe.
texts.en:
José is 30 years old.  He is single and attended school through 9th grade.  He gets up at 5:00am together with his parents, who help with his farming and taking care of the animals he has (cows), since they depend on the work he does.

José and his parents work as farmers, and he learned the work from them.  To get to his fields, he walks 6 kilometers and works during the morning, while his mother takes care of the house and the cows they own.

He is requesting this loan to purchase a cow, which he needs to increase his milk production to sell more and earn more income.  In the future, he hopes to build his parents a better house, since they currently live in a home made of adobe.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Diverney

texts.es:
El es diverney tiene 20 años, es el segundo de  los tres hermanos. Cuando empezó a crecer se dio cuenta de lo difícil que era la situación económica de la mama, el hermano mellizo y el hermano mayor se llamaba Vicente quien ya fallecio. 
La mama, quien tambien ya fallecio, trabajo en una empresa de flores de donde salió enferma, luego de trabajar muchos años en ella, debido a los químicos que manejaban en la empresa  le dio una enfermedad, que no tenia cura; el empezó a enfrentarse a una realidad de  preocupación y angustia por que el ver sufrir a la madre le impactaba mucho, ver el disgusto que ella tenia con el padre que nunca  ha vivido con ellos y  nunca le importó la vida de ellos.
Cuando el tenía 8 años, al hermano mayor fallecio, para la mama fue muy difícil enfrentarse a esta situación, después de esto ella lloraba todos los días, pero a pesar de todo ella fue muy fuerte y a los dos hijos mellizos los saco adelante en la primaria y el bachillerato antes de fallecer.
Ellos han vivido la mayoría del tiempo en arriendo, para la mama le era muy difícil pagar el arriendo y el sustento de ellos, era una persona muy responsable con el pago de los recibos y hacia que le rindiera los pocos ingresos que tenia para sacarlos adelante a el y al hermano.
La Madre a ellos los  formó en valores y les decía que no se dejaran  influenciar por las malas amistades que siempre había un límite y que ellos debían plantear parámetros.
Gracias a los esfuerzos de la madre y con la mano de dios ellos terminaron el bachillerato, a pesar de la dificultades económicas de la madre siempre  les enseño que la única forma de lograr una vida digna y buena era a través de la educación, que sin el estudio no tendiran un mejor futuro. 

La mama fallecio en el 2010, para el hermano mellizo y para el ha sido muy difícil superarla la muerte de la única persona que los apoyaba emocionalmente y económicamente.
Hace seis meses empezaron  a estudiar en campo alto y  han tenido una sumatoria de valores agregados que se les han implantado allí, para ellos ha sido de gran ayuda estudiar en campo alto, han tenido un acercamiento en conocimientos los cuales los están motivando a tener metas que cumplir, culminar los estudios con  entusiasmo y disciplina.
Se les ha dificultado en cuestión económica  el pago mensual de los estudios por eso ellos agradecen la colaboración de kiva de tener un descuento estudiantil. 


Agradezco la colaboración
texts.en:
Diverney is 20 years old, and is the second of three brothers.  When he was growing up, he noticed how difficult their financial situation was for his mother, his twin brother and his older brother, Vincent, who is now deceased.  His mother, who is also deceased, worked in a flower company where she became sick.  After working there for many years, the chemicals that she worked with made her sick, and there was no cure.  

Watching his mother suffer and seeing the disgust that she had for his father who never lived with them and never cared about their wellbeing, led him to become very preoccupied and anxious.  When he was 8 years old, his older brother died.  This situation was very difficult for his mother, and she cried everyday.  However, in the midst of all of this she was very strong and pushed the twin brothers ahead in primary school and high school before her passing.  

They have lived most of their  life in rented houses and it was very hard for their mother to pay the rent and their basic needs.  She was very responsible with the payments and made do with what little income she had to get him and his brother ahead.  Their mother provided them with their values and told them not to be influenced by bad friends because there is always a limit and they should set boundaries.  

Thanks to the efforts of his mother and the grace of God, they were able to finish high school.  Despite the financial difficulties their mom had, she always taught them that the only way to achieve a dignified and good life was through education, and without school they would not have a better future.  Their mother died in 2010, for her twin brother and him it has been difficult to get past the death of the only person who supported them emotionally and financially.  

Six months ago, they started studying in Campo Alto (A college in Bogota), and they have learned a lot during this time.
