For them, studying at Campo Alto has been a great help and the skills they have gained have motivated them to develop goals to achieve, finish there studies with enthusiasm and discipline.  Making the monthly payments for their studies has become difficult financially for them, so they are grateful that Kiva has collaborated with them for a student discount.  He is thankful for the help.

loans.use: pay for a semester of school.

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es:
El es luis fernando tiene 17 años, en este momento se encuentra estudiando en el colegio todavía, esta en grado 11 en énfasis en ciencias de la salud, por tal motivo el tuvo mucho interés en avanzar en la carrera estudiando enfermería en la institución de campo alto, ya que es una persona interesada en ayudar a las personas vulnerables, logrando a si mejorar la calidad de vida de dichas personas, ya que sse presento la oportunidad con el convenio kiva, que ofrece campo alto, el no dudo en matricularse y acepto dicho reto, que ademas lo hace mejor persona y lo sensibiliza ante la sociedad.
Luis fernando es un joven que le interesa ante todo ayudar a la familia, la cual consta de padre, madre y del hermano mayor, el cual a los 14 años tuvo una infección de tercer grado, lo cual lo dejo un estado mal durante mucho tiempo, en ese tiempo luis fernando tuvo una motivación, estudiar medicina y así lograr un día poder ayudar a el hermano y a cualquier paciente que lo necesite en un futuro, por lo cual espera seguir avanzando en su objetivo y poder realizar los sueños de el realidad.
texts.en:
Luis Fernando is 17 years old.  He is currently in 11th grade in high school and has a concentration in health sciences.  For this reason, he is very interested in starting a degree studying nursing at Campo Alto.  He is interested in helping vulnerable people and improving their quality of life, so Campo Alto offered him this agreement with Kiva.  He did not hesitate to enroll and accept this challenge, which will make him a better person and make him aware of society.

Luis Fernando is a young person who above all wants to help his family, who includes his father, mother, and older brother.  When his brother was 14 years old, he had a third degree infection which left him sick for a long time.  This gave Luis Fernando motivation to study medicine and one day be able to help his brother and any patient who needs it.  He hopes to continue forward with his goals and be able to make his dreams a reality.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of school.

loans.name: Saleema

texts.en:
Saleema is 45 years old and she is living with her seven children and her husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been selling fruits for many years. He sells seasonal fresh fruits in his hometown from his shop. He wants to increase the stock of fruits on a daily basis so he can generate more income for his family.

Saleema feels proud of her husband and appreciates his efforts even at his old age. She is taking a loan for her husband so he will be able to buy fruits in more quantity and quality. She wants to save any excess profit for any sudden future needs.

loans.use: To buy fresh and seasonal fruits and equilibrium for fruits shop.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert is 29 and still single. He lives with his parents in a rural community. Having no other source of income, he operates his motorcycle transport in his community to earn a living. He aims to become successful and financially stable in order to have a bright future. 

To achieve his goals, he is asking for additional capital of 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy gasoline, wheels and other spare parts needed for the maintenance of his motorcycle. He is hoping that someday, he will make his dream come true, as he continues to work hard and strive harder.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, wheels and other spare parts needed for the maintenance of his motorcycle.

location.town: Brgy. Don Mariano Perez, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Gulnoza

texts.ru: Гулноза молодая и умная девушка. Ей 18 лет. Она родилась и выросла на Северной части Таджикистана. Она в 8 месячном возрасте осталась сиротой. Ее отец умер. Гулнозу вырастили ее мать, бабушка и дедушка. Она в средней школе училась отлично и после окончания средней школы она поступила в Русско-Таджикский Славянский Университет. Гулноза учится в факультете Экономика и Финансы. Она данное время является студентом 2 курса и учится в заочное отделение. В свободное время она работает в микро заёмной организации. Гулноза должна оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 950 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Gulnoza is a young and intelligent woman. She is 18 years old, and was born and raised in the northern part of Tajikistan. When she was eight months old her father died, so she was raised by her mother, grandmother, and grandfather. In high school she was an A student, and after graduation she was accepted at the Russo-Tajik Salvic University. Gulnoza is studying in the economics and finance department. She is currently a second year student, taking courses by correspondence. In her free time she works at a microloan organization. Gulnoza needs to pay her tuition, but doesn't have the money. She is asking for a 950 USD loan to pay it. She is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for her education

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 7,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Teodora has been in this business for three years. Teodora earns more income from raising livestock.

Teodora has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Emely

texts.en: Emely is 38 years old and single. She is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines. Emely requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies. Emely has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, she would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Emmie

texts.en:
Emmie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell used clothing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to purchase more used clothing to sell to her customers. Emmie has been in this business for 2 years. She earns additional income from farming mango and raising livestock.

Emmie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Victor Antonio

texts.es:
Víctor tiene 44 años de edad estado civil Unión Libre vive con su esposa  y con sus hijos, de 11 y 2 años. Vive en el Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.
La ventanilla se llama SAN NICOLAS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Nicolás, perteneciente a la parroquia Ricaurte cantón Urdaneta, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Víctor se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace algunos años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas en el Dr. Agro y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.
El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes y alquiler del terreno. El préstamo le ayudado para cambiar el estilo de vida de la familia. Su sueño es tener un terrero y que los hijos terminen los estudios.
Le gusta jugar futbol.
texts.en:
Victor, 44, lives with his wife and his two children who are 11 and 2 years of age.  They live in Cantón Ventanas, in the province of Los Ríos.  

The solidarity group is called ‘San Nicolas’ and is located in the San Nicolás area, which belongs to the Ricuarte parish of Cantón Urdaneta.  This group works in agriculture and livestock.

Victor works in agriculture, growing corn and rice.  He has worked in this profession for several years.  He buys his products in small Dr Agro shops and he sells them in the market located in the same place.

The loan he is asking for is to buy manure, urea, fertilizers and to rent land.  The loan helps him to improve his family’s standard of living.  His dream is to have his own plot of land and for his children to complete their education.  In his free time he likes to play football.

loans.use: to sow corn and rice.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 34 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Julieta is borrowing 9,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Julieta has been farming vegetables for five years and also earns additional income from buying and selling livestock.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 7,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy more fish to sell for her fish-vending business.

Laila has been in this business to save enough to build a house for her family. Laila earns more income from raising livestock.

Laila has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to build a house for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Abuvali

texts.ru: Абували начинающий бизнесмен в сфере животноводства и очень хороший человек. Он живет на районе Шахритус, там где свежий воздух, чистая природа и гостеприимные люди. Абували пользуясь благоприятным климатом, хочет начать бизнес по купле и откорму скотов. Свой бизнес он собирается реализовать у себя дома в коровнике. Абували умеет ухаживать и обращаться с животными, и он решил на свое мастерство и умение заработать. Он всю свою силу и средства вложить в новую деятельность. Абували надеется, что на сумму займа он приобретет скотов, и он начнет свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Abuvali is a starting businessman in the sphere of animal husbandry and a very good person. He lives in the region of Shahrituz, where there is fresh air, pristine nature and hospitable people.

Using the favorable environment, Abuvali wants to start a business buying and fattening cattle. He is going to establish his business at his home in a barn. Abuvali knows how to care for and treat animals, and he decided to earn a living on his skills and talents. He puts all his strength and means into the new activity.

Abuvali hopes that with the loan amount he will acquire cattle and start his business.

loans.use: to purchase steers and validate a new business

loans.name: Sonia Petronila

texts.es: Doña Sonia es originaria de la ciudad de Managua. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería, el cual le ha permitido salir adelante y obtener mejores ganancias. Se siente agradecida con Kiva y MiCredito ya que ha logrado aumentar la variedad sus productos y mantener su negocio activo. Solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar: Arroz, Frijoles, Azúcar, Aceite entre otros productos de consumo. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá obtener mejores ingresos y así mejorar la infraestructura de su casa.
texts.en:
Sonia is originally from the city of Managua.  She owns a small grocery store.  This has allowed her to move forward and earn better profits.  She is happy with Kiva and MiCredito since she has been able to increase the variety of products and actively maintain her business.

She is requesting a new loan to purchase rice, beans, sugar, oil, and other products.  She says that the loan will be a lot of help since it will allow her to earn more profits and improve the infrastructure of her home.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, sugar, oil, and other products.

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru: Мухаббат опытная портниха, проживающая в городе Исфара. Ей 41 год. Она замужем. Ее муж работает водителем. Сама Мухаббат предоставляет услуги швеи. Она занимается этим делом в течение 10 лет. Мухаббат вежливая, ответственная и добропорядочная женщина. Она любит свое дело и стремится выполнить каждый заказ качественно и вовремя. К тому же ей помогают ее ученицы, которых она учит кройке и шитью. Сейчас Мухаббат хочет расширить свое дело. Она просит кредит, чтобы купить компьютерную швейную машинку.
texts.en:
Muhabbat is an experienced dressmaker, living in the town of Isfara. She is 41 years old. She is married and her husband works as a driver.

Muhabbat herself offers sewing services. She has been engaged in this work over the course of ten years. Muhabbat is a courteous, responsible and respectable woman. She loves her work and strives to fulfill every order with quality and on time. In addition, she is helped by her students, whom she teaches to cut and sew.

Now, Muhabbat wants to expand her work. She is requesting a loan to buy a computerized sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a computerized sewing machine

loans.name: Brenda Liseth

texts.es:
Brenda de 36 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado y es una persona acompañada, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.  Se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. Junto a su esposo  para realizar sus actividades diarias, mientras sus hijos van a la escuela.


Ella  se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura, oficio que le ha enseñado su esposo durante la mañana trabajan en las parcelas, camina 6 K.m. Para llegar y en el transcurso de la tarde se dedican a ordeñar las vacas para elaborar queso y venderlo 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar una novilla, la cual en un futuro se hará vaca y podrá producir mas leche para la elaboración de queso y así incrementar sus ingresos.

Ella  planea que con los ingresos que obtiene de la venta de la elaboración de queso, de la siembra y del préstamo para la compra de la novilla, podra comprar en un futuro un terreno para  pastar sus animales.
texts.en:
Brenda is 36 and was in school until the ninth grade. She lives with her husband who works in agriculture. She gets up at 4:30 am with her husband to carry out her daily tasks, while her children go to school.

Brenda works in agriculture, a job that her husband has taught her. During the morning they work on their plot of land, which they walk 6 km to get to. During the afternoon, they milk their cows to make cheese to sell.

The loan she is asking for is to buy a heifer which will allow them to produce more milk for making cheese in the future, and increase their earnings. She plans to use the extra money she makes from making cheese, growing crops and from the loan to buy a plot of land for grazing her animals.

loans.use: to buy a heifer

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum, and millet.

loans.name: John Jairo

texts.es:
El es john jairo, siempre ha sido una persona soñadora, desde que tengo conciencia, desde pequeño, su vida transcurrió lleno de muchas dificultades económicas, la mama, la mujer mas bella y luchadora, siempre sacando los hijos adelante con muchos sacrificios, recuerda cuando tenia 5 años, la madre trabaja en las florez, ella por ganar unos pesos de mas cocinaba para llevarle a los compañeros y venderles el almuerzo, el se levantaba desde muy temprano con ella y observaba como preparaba los alimentos, incluso muchas veces le colaboro, desde allí comenzó a gustarle todo lo relacionado con la cocina y siempre tuvo el gusto por la cocina.
Toda la vida ha deseado estudiar todo lo relacionado con la gastronomía, aprender todas las técnicas normas y recetas de toda índole, por eso desea entrar a estudiar a campo alto para comenzar la carrera y ser un excelente profesional en cocina, para que en un futuro pueda ser un gran profesional y ser un excelente chef y tener una gran sucursal de restaurantes de nombre reconocido, donde cada persona salga con una sonrrisa por disfrutar de la preparación de john. 
A el le hablaron sobre el convenio con kiva y le pareció una buena oportunidad para poder pagar menos y mejorar los ingresos económicos, a parte le parece muy bueno, ya que muchos estudiantes no tienen los medios económicos para pagar el semestre al precio normal.
texts.en:
This is John Jairo. He has been a person with dreams ever since he was a little boy. His life was full of financial problems.  His mother, a beautiful woman who fought hard to bring up her children at great personal sacrifice, remembers that when John was 5 she worked at Las Florez.  In order to make a few more pesos she prepared food to bring to the market and sell at lunchtime.  He got up very early with his mom and watched her prepare the food and many times he even helped. 

That was when he began to enjoy everything about cooking and he always liked being in the kitchen.  All his life he has wanted to study everything about cooking; learn all the standard techniques and recipes of all kinds. This is why he wants to study with CampoAlto and begin his career as an excellent professional in the kitchen.  One day he hopes to be a great professional and an excellent chef with a chain of well-known restaurants where everyone leaves with a smile on their face after enjoying a meal prepared by John. 

He had heard about the agreement with Kiva and he thought it was a good opportunity to pay less and improve his income. He also thinks it is worthwhile because many students don't have the financial means to pay the normal price for tuition.

loans.use: pay tuition for one semester

loans.name: Giri Puteri Group

texts.en:
Raising pigs is already a proven additional income for Ni Made and her entire family. This year her children will start school, and she cannot just rely on her husband's income. By working hard for 6 months, Ni Made achieved maximum results. All of her fattened pigs sold out for a high price. Now she can save the money in preparation for her children's school needs.

Ni Made and the Giri Puteri group decided to continue borrowing from MUK. They still need financial support until they have enough savings to use as venture capital. Ni Made is using a loan to purchase 4 superior piglets for fattening. She hopes this period can be as successful as before. She thanked MUK for the venture capital support and the training she received. MUK's support has improved her quality of life and as a woman she could be a proud contributor to the whole economy of the family. Ni Made is on the left wearing a red shirt.

loans.use: to purchase 4 superior piglets for fattening

loans.name: Urunbek

texts.ru: Урунбек живет в отдаленном регионе. Он женат и на воспитании имеет двоих детей. Урунбек более 10 лет занимается скотоводством. Он имеет большой коровник у себя дома. Урунбек в основном откармливает крупно-рогатый скот. Он выращивает сено для скота. Урунбек в этой отрасли имеет большой опыт. Его бизнес является основным источником его семьи и поэтому он хочет расширить свой бизнес. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 7000 сомони для покупки скота. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Urunbek lives in an outlying region. He is married and has two children. He has been raising livestock for over 10 years, and has a barn for the animals on his property. Urunbek mainly raises cattle and grows pasture grass for them. Urunbek has a lot of experience in this area. His business is the primary source of income for his family, so he wants to expand it. He is asking for a 7000 somoni loan to buy animals. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy cattle to increase his working capital

loans.name: Victor

texts.en: Victor is aged 58, married and has six children. The five of them are already married. To make a living, Victor provides motorcycle transport services in their town. She's been in this business for almost twenty-one years, and earns about PHP 500 daily. He is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000, to purchase oil, a sprocket, and gasoline for the maintenance of his transport motorcycle. He hopes that he can get the amount he requested to further develop and improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase oil, a sprocket, and gasoline for the maintenance of his motorcycle .

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 56 years old, married, and blessed with four children. Teresita’s source of income comes from raising and selling hogs, and she has been in this business for over five years now.  Teresita’s spouse is a farmer. 

She is now asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy feed, medicines, and vaccines for the maintenance of her hogs. 

Teresita hopes to keep improving her livestock business so that she will gain more income for her family’s welfare.

loans.use: to buy feed, medicines, and vaccines for the maintenance of her hogs.

loans.name: Nuriniso

texts.ru: Нуринисо планирует организовать собственный бизнес. Она будет продавать  носки и нижнее белье. Нуринисо 1959  года рождения. Имеет  среднее специальное  образованием по специальностям товароведа. Ранее она  работала товароведом в государственных организациях. Клиентка замужем и имеет 2 детей.  Семья состоит из 4 человека. Нуринисо будет торговать на местном рынке. Она будет арендовать торговую точку. Нуринисо будет покупать товар с оптовой части  рынка, от оптовиков, которые поставляют товар с Китая, Турции и Бишкека.  Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 долларов США для покупки носки и нижнее белье. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Nuriniso is planning to start her own business selling socks and underwear. She was born in 1959 and has a vocational education as a commodity expert. She used to work in that field for government agencies. She is married and has two children, so the family has four members. Nuriniso is going to sell at a local market, where she will rent a market stall. She will buy goods from the wholesale part of the market, from wholesalers that bring products from China, Turkey, and Bishkek. She is asking for a 1000 USD loan for buy socks and underwear. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy socks and underwear to start a new business

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lydia is 51 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Lydia has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Lydia requested a 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy an additional box of fish to sell.

Lydia has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Lydia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy an additional box of fish to sell

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 31 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by having a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Juanita is borrowing 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Juanita has been in pig fattening for three years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 58 years old and married, with five children.

Patricia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, andshe has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like snack foods, cooking oil, sugar, coffee, noodles, etc., to sell.

Patricia has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five year, and she also earns an income from farming vegetables.

Patricia aspires to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items like snack foods, cooking oil, sugar, coffee, noodles, etc., to sell

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina is 54 years old and married, with two children.

Saturnina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her general store.

Saturnina has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years, and she also earns income from raising pigs.

Saturnina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 43 years old and married with three children. With three children in school, Edna works very hard to provide for them.

Edna runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Edna has been in this business for six years, and sells a variety of items such as rice, noodles, fabric conditioner, shampoo, canned goods, etc. 

In the future, Edna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline works hard to support her family. She is married, and she has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines.

Evangeline has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell.  She has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Evangeline would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Ainakhan

texts.ru: Айнахан 43 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. Самый старший сын находится на заработках в России. Остальные дети -школьники. У Айнахан - средне-специальное образование, она окончила техникум легкой промышленности в 1989 году, послу получения диплома Айнахан работала технологом в швейном цеху. Но после распада СССР Айнахан перестала работать и начала заниматься животноводством вместе с супругом, стартовав 23 года назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Айнахан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 кобыла, 2 жеребенка, 1 нетель и 18 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 13,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айнахан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку бычков для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене.   Доходы от кредита Айнахан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на проведение свадебного торжества для сына.
texts.en: Ainakhan is 43 years old, married, and has four children with her spouse. Her oldest son is working in Russia. The rest of the children are in school. Ainakhan has a vocational high school education - she graduated from the vocational school for light industry in 1989, after which she worked as a technician in a sewing shop. However, once the Soviet Union fell, she stopped working and began to raise animals with her husband, starting 23 years ago with 5,000 som (KGS) worth of livestock. Thanks to her tireless work, she now has a milk cow, a mare, two foals, a heifer, and eighteen sheep. Her monthly income is 13,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop the business, Ainakhan contacted the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan to buy steersto feed and then sell at the market for a profit. She plans to invest income from the loan into further expanding her livestock herd, and she also plans to save money for her son's wedding.

loans.use: to buy steers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more rock for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more used clothes

loans.name: Roxana Yaneth

texts.es:
Roxana, se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 2 años, anteriormente era empleada pero no ganaba lo suficiente para cubrir sus gastos familiares, es por eso que hoy vende ropa de manera ambulante, ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.
Con el préstamo comprara camisas, blusas, pantalones, faldas y ropa interior, con lo que tendrá más productos para vender en estas fechas en las que aumentan las demanda de sus clientes, espera aumentar sus ingresos con los podrá cancelar sus cuotas y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares.
Lucha día con día para en un futuro poder comprar su casa propia.
texts.en:
Roxana has made a living selling clothes for the past two years. Previously, she was employed but did not earn sufficient income to cover household expenses. Because of that, she sells clothing all over town. She is married and has two children. 

With this loan she will purchase shirts, blouses, pants, skirts, and underwear. This will provide her with more products to sell this season when customer demand increases. She hopes to increase her income which will allow her to pay back her loan and help her husband with the household expenses. She will continue to work hard each day in order to be able to buy her own house in the future.

loans.use: to buy shirts, blouses, pants, skirts, and underwear.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 51-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her son, who is also shown in the photo. She has five years of experience in this field. Over time, she has become famous in her community for providing the best quality products in her locality. She is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. 

She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to buy packs of salts, grains and beverages to meet with the increasing demand in her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, grains and beverages.

loans.name: Saleema

texts.en:
Saleema is a 40-year-old married woman. She buys clothes of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates, and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

She is requesting a loan to buy a wide variety of clothes in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She is in her third loan cycle with a good repayment history. Saleema expects a boost in her earnings with her loan, and she plans to spend a part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: To buy clothing to resell.

loans.name: Joaninha

texts.en: Joaninha is taking a loan of $600 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as shampoo, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, soap, water, oils, eggs, bread and milk. She opened her kiosk in 2010 with her own working capital of $300. She is a hardworking woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy shampoo, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, soap, water, oils, eggs, bread and milk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more used clothes

loans.name: Yusufjon

texts.en:
Yusufjon is 20 years old. He is not married and he lives with his parents. Now, he lives and works in Kirgiziya. He is a student of the second course of medical university. Yusufjon studies in the faculty of stomatology. Yusufjon studies well. 

He must to pay for his tuition, but he has no money. He is asking for a loan of USD 1,000 to pay for tuition. He dreams of being a good medic in the future. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a married woman from Lila, Bohol. She has four children ages 8-15 who are all studying in school. Cecilia's husband is a fisherman. Before, Cecilia used to work in a school canteen to earn a living. But now she has learned a new livelihood from that and manages her own business. She has been cooking banana cue (deep fried banana in caramelized sugar) and nilusak na saging (mashed banana with grated coconut and sugar). She produces her food at home and then delivers it with her motorbike to school canteens and other stores on a consignment basis, while also supporting her husband's fishing business. 

She is asking for a loan in order to buy fish net, sugar, bananas and coconuts. She is hoping that with the support of this loan she will be able to expand her business. 

In the future, she hopes to send all her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fish net, sugar, bananas and coconuts

loans.name: Shahodat

texts.en:
Shahodat is married and has three children. Shahodat is a person who always tries to earn money and provide a better life for her children. Shahodat began her own business, dealing in animal husbandry, four years ago. She seeds cow in her house. She has a cowshed. 

She requested a loan in the amount of 800 TJS to increase the number of animals she has for sale. She hopes for Kiva's cooperation in this loan, since it will be used to improve her family's income.

loans.use: to buy cattle to increase the number of cattle.

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en: To make a living, Dennis provides transportation in his community, and he earns well from this. He successfully repaid his previous loan used to buy spare parts for his vehicle. Currently, Dennis has taken a new loan to buy tires for it as the tires need replacement. He plans to improve his business to earn more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy vehicle tires

loans.name: Melodina

texts.en:
Melodina is 26 years old. She is married with two children ages three and five.

Melodina is engaged in a cell phone electronic prepaid reloading business and also a rice farming business for three years now. The income supports her children and enables her to help her husband, who works as a Security Guard.

She is asking for a loan to buy electronic load, SIM cards, and fertilizer. From this loan, she expects a good harvest and an increase in business profitability. The additional income will go to her family's daily costs and school fees of her children.

loans.use: to buy electronic load, SIM cards, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anaclita

texts.en:
Anaclita is a vendor from the town of Albur, Bohol. She makes kalamay (a sticky sweet delicacy that is popular in many regions of the Philippines). Kalamay is made of coconut milk, brown sugar, and ground glutinous rice. Her business started a few years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy necessary items, such as glutinous rice, sugar, plastic canister and peanuts. This is very essential to keep her livelihood alive and be able to purchase food and set aside for savings.

In the future, Anaclita hopes to expand her business and increase business profitability for sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy necessary items, such as glutinous rice, sugar, and peanuts, etc.

loans.name: Oscar Fabian

texts.es:
Oscar tiene 30 años de edad es casado tiene un 2 hijos vive con el esposo y con los hijos en Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Ríos. 

Es integrante de la ventanilla de la Virgen de Guadalupe que se encuentra ubicado en la parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al cantó Pueblo Viejo. 

Oscar se dedica a la venta y ala siembra de maíz y arroz y engorde de cerdos.

Solicita el crédito para el arriendo de terreno y la compra de insumos fertilizantes abonos insecticidas y balanceado de engorde y crianza. La compra lo realiza en Ventanas y los vende en la misma localidad. La meta es mejorar los cultivos y suoeres la cosecha.

Enfrenta desafios como las enfermedades en los cultivos. En los tiempos libres le gusta dedicarse con loos hijos hacer lod deberes.
texts.en:
Oscare is 30-years-old. He is married and has two children. He lives with his wife and their two children in Cantón Ventanas in Ríos Province. He is a resident of the small town of Virgen de Guadalupe that is located in the Puerto Pechiche parish belonging to the canton of Pueblo Viejo.

Oscar is in the cultivating and selling of corn and rice and also raises pigs for a living.

He is requesting a credit to till the land and buy the following inputs: fertilizers, manure, insecticides, and balanced feed. He makes the purchase in Ventanas and sells in the same town. The goal is to improve his crops and harvest.

He faces challenges like diseases in the crops. In his spare time he likes to spent time with his children and attend to their needs.

loans.use: to buy inputs such as fertilizers, manure, insecticides, and balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Beatha

texts.en: Beatha is 46 years old. She is a widow and has been in the business for the past four years, selling stones/quarries for house constructions. With the loan, she would like to buy more stones for resale. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: to buy more quarries for use in construction.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Grace works hard to support her family.

She has business buying and selling fruits and root crops in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Grace is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional sacks of fruit and root crops to sell at her business.

Grace has sustained her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of fruit and root crops to sell.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en: Jonathan is a 51-year-old married man with six children, living in Fort Portal Uganda. His main business is transport, alongside owning a produce store, which has helped him boost his income. He is facing challenges of poor roads and he is affected by motor vehicle break downs. His dream is to construct rentals so he can have several income generating activities. Jonathan has asked for a loan to complete payment of a motor vehicle and its general repair.

loans.use: to complete payment of a motor vehicle and its general repair.

loans.name: Illiminata

texts.en:
Illiminata is 49 years old. She is married with four children.

She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for the past three years. With the loan, she would like to buy more beans and potatoes for resale.

The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: To buy more beans and potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Della

texts.en:
Della is a housewife living with three persons in the family home in Garut, a rural area located in West Java. Her husband is an entrepreneur. 

Della runs a small stall that sells snacks, drinks, groceries, and mobile phone airtime credits. She felt interested in joining Ruma because she wanted to improve her business. She is glad that her business was assisted and supported by Ruma agents. 

As her business continues, she hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to process more mobile phone airtime credits transactions on weekends. For the last three months, she has had around $18-$19 per day in sales just from selling mobile phone airtime credits. Della plans to seek more business opportunities and put aside the extra cash for her family savings.

In the photo, Della is standing in front of her stall with her daughter at the back. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credits on weekends.

loans.name: 04-07-08-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Thủy operates a food stall/restaurant selling meat. She is requesting a loan to purchase pork to resell.

Thủy is 43 years old and she is married with two children. Thủy is the group leader of the 04-07-08-Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of five members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents; her children are grown up.

In 2009, Thủy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thủy has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Thủy has been involved in this business for more than ten years. The main hardship that Thủy faces in her business is lack of capital.

With her business profits, Thủy hopes to build a new house, and hopes for her family to be healthy and happy and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase pork for resale.

loans.name: 04-06-01-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Thúy has a service business taking photographs. She is requesting a loan to purchase a camera for her photography business.

Thúy is 46 years old and she is married with two children. Thúy is the group leader of the 04-06-01-Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of six members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, and has two dependents.

In 2012, Thúy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thúy has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Thúy has been involved in this business for more than ten years. The main hardship that Thúy faces in her business is lack of capital.

With her business profits, Thúy hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase a camera for her photography business.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina is 56 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by buying and selling chickens in the Philippines. Saturnina is borrowing 29,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional chickens to sell.

Saturnina  has been buying and selling chickens for 47 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional chickens for resale.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie works hard to support her family. She is single and has a general store business in the Philippines. 

Rosie requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock of merchandise to sell in her general store.

Rosie has been in this business for three years now. In the future, Rosie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of merchandise to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 55 years old and married, with three children/  One is in school, Elsa  works very hard to provide for them.

Elsa  runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell, like canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, noodles, etc.

Elsa  has been in this business for 23 years.

In the future, Elsa would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell, like canned goods, soft drinks, egg, noodles, etc

loans.name: Ma. Salona

texts.en:
Ma. Salona is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store.

Ma. Salona has been in this business for a year; she earns more income from raising pigs.

Ma. Salona has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Perie

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Perie works hard to support her family.

She has a sewing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and pig fattening.  

Perie is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional material like fabric, threads, buttons, etc. for her sewing business.

Perie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like fabric, thread, buttons, etc. for her business

loans.name: Juvilyn

texts.en:
Juvilyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice and corn retailing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice and corn to sell for her rice and corn retailing business.

Juvilyn has been in this business for three years; she earns more income from a general store.

Juvilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. 

She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice and corn to sell

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Dionesia works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. 

Dionesia is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers at her fish vending business.

Dionesia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 54 years old and married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Rosalinda has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional materials and ingredients, such as coffee, cups, sugar, bread, etc., for her business.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and ingredients, such as coffee, cups, sugar, bread, etc., for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bags of coal for her business.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Meet Geoffrey, a farmer living in Nyamira, an area which is popularly known for growing a lot of bananas. Geoffrey is married and has two children, both of whom are of school going age. He has been practicing farming for five years; he produces and sells milk and eggs. He also has a retail business that acts as an extra source of income. He loves poultry farming the most, and that's why he wants to invest more in it. His biggest challenge in farming is lack of funds.

Geoffrey chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they give out their loans at a low interest rate, and they also meet the needs of small scale farmers by providing them with ways in which they can acquire assets for their agricultural work. This loan will enable Geoffrey to purchase more poultry and therefore produce more eggs for sale. This will increase his income base and thus enable him cater to his children's educational needs and also improve their living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more poultry and thus increase egg production.

loans.name: Adelia

texts.en:
Adelia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.  Adelia has been in this business for six years now.

Adelia requested a PHP 9,500 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

In the future, Adelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more juice, water, soft drinks and candy for her business,

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca opened her kiosk in 2011 with her own working capital of $400. She is generating a good income from selling. She lives in a town with her family; her husband is a driver.

A $1,000 loan is offered to Francisca to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store like noodles, bread, sugar, salt, milks, cigarettes, coffee, Fanta, candles, and soap. 

She has been thinking of running a big business, after years of involving herself in doing business. 

She is happy with the loan because it is offered to poor people and will help to improve her living conditions for the future.

loans.use: To buy noodles, bread, sugar, salt, milks, cigarettes, coffee, Fanta, candles, and soap

loans.name: Ainur

texts.ru: Айнур 43 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей- три дочери и 1 сын. Все дочери работают в Москве, ежемесячно высылают часть своей зарплаты родителям в Кыргызстан, а младший и единственный сын проживает с родителями и помогает по хозяйству. У Айнур - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Айнур занимается животноводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Айнур, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 2 лошади 15 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айнур обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом -на покупку кобылы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Айнур планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на приготовление приданного для дочерей.
texts.en: Ainur is 43 years old, married, and has four children - three daughters and a son. All of the daughters work in Moscow and send a part of their pay to their parents in Kyrgystan each month. The youngest child and only son lives with his parents and helps around the property. Ainur has a high school education, and to earn the primary source of income for the family she raises animals. She started 20 years ago with 10,000 som (KGS) worth of livestock. Thanks to her tireless work she now has two milk cows, two horses, and fifteen sheep. Her monthly income is 15,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop the business she came to the microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan to buy a mare to expand her herd. Ainur plans to invest income from the loan into further expanding her herd, and she also plans to save for her daughters' dowries.

loans.use: to buy a mare

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is  taking a loan of USD 1000 to improve her business. She is married, and she has three children 

She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store, such as plates, spoons, pots, ladles, rice racks, plate racks, and  buckets. She opened her kiosk since 2008 with her own working capital of USD 600. 

She is a hard-working woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

And she is happy with this loan because TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) offered it for poor people to improving their living condition.

loans.use: To buy plates, spoons, pots, ladles, rice racks, plate racks, and buckets

loans.name: Las Ovejas De Cristo Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal las ovejas de Cristo está conformada por nueve integrantes ocho mujeres y un hombre, padres y madres responsables con quince hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios de  Malpaisillo lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país.  Se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente no pudo cursar una carrera por falta de recursos  económicos. En la actualidad lucha día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos. 
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es Claudia  tiene por actividad económica una pulpería, es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, detergente, huevos, tiste, jugos, gaseosas. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Las Ovejas de Cristo agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener  un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The communal bank, Las Ovejas de Cristo (Christ's Sheep) is made up of nine members, eight women and one man.  They are mothers and a father who are responsible for fifteen children. They are from Malpaisillo which is located in the western part of the country. They are characterized as being responsible, hard workers, who want to improve their personal situation. 

Thanks to her efforts and desire to get ahead, the coordinator is Claudia.  Unfortunately, she was not able to pursue a career for lack of financial resources, but she fights day-to-day to provide a better future for her children. She has a small store where she sells groceries in small quantities such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, tiste (local beverage), juice, carbonated beverages, and detergent. She works 12 hours a day at her store selling her products.

The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and the business by buying and selling groceries so that in the near future she might increase her income. Las Ovejas de Cristo appreciates the help that Kiva investors are providing to people with scarce financial means in poor countries like Nicaragua, allowing them to work in a dignified way.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and supply the business which buys and sells groceries such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, tiste, juices, carbonated beverages, and detergent.

loans.name: Farrukh

texts.ru: Фаррух занимается куплей и продажей семян. Он оптом покупает семена сельскохозяйственных культур и затем с наценкой продает на местном рынке. Фарруху 37 лет. Он проживает в городе Исфара. У него жена, четверо дочерей и один сын. Его дочерям по 16, 13, 10 и 4 года, а сыну 8 лет. Все его дети, кроме младшей дочери являются учениками школы. Его жена не работает, она следит за детьми и ведет домашнее хозяйство. Фаррух единственный кормилец семьи. Благодаря своему малому торговому бизнесу он обеспечивает свою большую семью. Сейчас ему необходимо закупить товар и у него недостаточно средств. Поэтому Фаррух берет кредит. На сумму кредита он собирается закупить несколько мешков качественных семян подсолнечника и кукурузы и перепродать по прибыльной цене. Он надеется на финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Farrukh is involved in reselling seeds.  He buys seeds of agricultural crops wholesale and then sells them with a markup at a local market.  Farrukh is 37 years old.  He lives in the city of Isfara.  He has a wife, four daughters and one son.  His daughters are 16, 13, 10 and 4 years old, and the son is 8 years old.  All of his children, except for the youngest daughter, are school students.  His wife does not work; she looks after the children and runs the household.  Farrukh is the sole provider for the family.  Thanks to his small retail business, he provides for his large family.  Now he needs to buy merchandise and does not have enough money.  This is why Farrukh is requesting this loan.  He plans to use this loan to buy several bags of quality sunflower and corn seeds and resell them at a profitable price.  He hopes for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy several bags of quality sunflower and corn seeds for resale

loans.name: Saidaslam

texts.ru: 42 летний Саидаслам из городка Вахдат хочет начать новый бизнес. Он собирается заняться животноводческой деятельностью. Для обоснования данного бизнеса у него имеется коровник и опыт в этой сфере деятельности. Саидаслам просит кредит, чтобы купить маленьких бычков, которые станут основоположниками в новой деятельности. Причина, по которой он берет кредит, является не достаточное количество начального капитала. Саидамал несколько лет держал и ухаживал за коровами, чтобы они обеспечивали его семью молоком. Теперь, когда у него накопился опыт, он может его использовать для бизнеса. Саидамал надеется, что ему помогут начать бизнес.
texts.en: 42 year-old Saidaslam from the city of Vahdat wants to start a new business.  He plans to get involved in animal husbandry.  To start this business, he has a cowshed and experience in this type of field.  Saidaslam is requesting a loan to buy young bulls that will become the founders of this new business.  The reason for obtaining the loan is the fact that he does not have a sufficient initial capital.  Saidaslam kept and took care of cattle for several years, so that they could provide his family with milk.  Now that he gained experience, he can use it for the business.  Saidaslam hopes that he will get help with starting this business.

loans.use: to buy livestock and start his own business

loans.name: Deogracia

texts.en: Deogracia owns and operates a general store to make a living. After 16 years in the business, she earns good income for her family's needs. She successfully repaid her previous loan used for the business. She took a new loan from GDMPC micro finance to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Saturnino

texts.en:
To make a living, Saturnino operates a motorcycle transportation business and, at the same time, manages his own farm. 

He joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) last year and had borrowed a loan to cover the cost of motorcycle repairs. He used this vehicle to carry passengers and the baggage of his customers. 

In the future, Saturnino wants to improve his business.

loans.use: to cover the cost of motorcycle repairs.

loans.name: Nury

texts.en:
Nury was born in 1963, in a village that is located in the northern part of Tajikistan. She is married and has adult children.

Nury has been busy with animal husbandry for more than 8 years. Her husband helps her with selling cattle. Her income could not meet all of her financial needs, so she decided to develop her business.

She is asking for a loan of 6,000 Tajikistan somonis (TJS) to buy cattle for increasing her working capital. She hopes that this loan will help her to maximize her profit. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle for increasing her working capital.

loans.name: Marie Jeanne

texts.en: Marie Jeanne is 45 years old and married, with nine children. She has been selling milk for the past eighteen years. With the loan, she would like to buy more milk for resale. With the profits from the business, she will be able to earn more savings. She is very grateful for the last loans, which greatly helped improve the business.

loans.use: To buy more milk for resale.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a nipa roofing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF to buy additional nipa roofing to sell.

Elma has been in this business for three years. Elma earns additional income from pig fattening.

Elma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional nipa roofing to sell

loans.name: Merriam

texts.en:
Merriam is 43 years old and married, with six children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Merriam is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Merriam has been raising pigs for two years and earns additional income from food vending. She is working tirelessly to attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Aureen Erika

texts.en:
Aureen Erika, single, is 20 years old and helps her parents to earn an income.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a retail bamboo business in the Philippines and requests a 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional bamboo to sell.

Aureen Erika has previously borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF. She has been in this business for 3 years and  earns additional income from raising pigs.

Aureen Erika aspires to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional bamboo to sell.

loans.name: Marie Grace

texts.en:
Marie Grace is a married 35-year-old woman with four children who are between the ages of seven and twelve. 

She will use the loan to buy more beans and cooking oil to sell. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.  She is very happy with the loan because it will improve her business.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil and beans to re-sell.

loans.name: Joachim

texts.en: Joachim is a thirty-year-old married man, with five children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is transport, along with constructing houses and selling firewood, which has boosted his income. He started the businesses to look after his family and educate his children, as a loving father. He faces the challenge of weather changes. As a hardworking man, he dreams of buying land and establishing a farm for animals. Joachim has applied for a loan to pay workers for cutting his firewood.

loans.use: to pay workers for cutting his firewood.

loans.name: Gocha

texts.en: Gocha is a 42-year-old married man. He lives with his wife in the Vani district. His wife works at local hospital and gets 200 Gel per month. Gocha owns a plot of agricultural land, where he grows nut trees and sells the harvested nuts among villagers. Gocha is unemployed now and decided to start a taxi business since he owns a car. The start-up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 1100 Gel to install gas equipment in his car. After the gas equipment is installed, he will serve local people as a taxi driver and will be able to increase the income of the family. Gocha awaits your support.

loans.use: to install gas equipment in his car and start a taxi business

loans.name: Nona

texts.en:
Nona is a 28-year-old married woman. She lives in the Samtredia district with her husband, two infant daughters and mother-in-law. Nona is a hairdresser and works locally. Her husband  works at the railway station and earns a small monthly income. The income is not enough for the family so Nona decided to start a new business and request a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 3100 GEL to build a greenhouse. Nona will purchase the building materials and build a greenhouse to grow vegetables to sell. 

The Start Up program will be a great support for her family. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse.

loans.name: Asmat

texts.en:
Asmat is 42 years old and lives with her five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a mobile shop for many years and generates income for his family. Her husband troubleshoots mobile problems and sells accessories, including chargers and data cable, while providing recharge facilities for different networks. 

Due to an increase in the demand for mobile accessories and recharge, he sometimes has to refuse his customers. He does not have savings to further invest in the business, because he spends all of his income on household expenses. Therefore, Asmat requested a loan for her husband so he can buy additional mobile accessories and extra credit for the recharge facility. Asmat thanks Kiva and to its field partner for their honorable support.

loans.use: To buy mobile accessories and extra credit for the recharge facility for a mobile phone shop.

loans.name: Qurotul

texts.en:
Qurotul is a housewife living in Serang, a semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta. She is married and has two children; her eldest child is 9 years old, and her youngest child is 1½ years old. Her husband works in a private company. 

Qurotul runs a small stall selling mobile phone airtime credit, snacks, drinks, groceries and drinking water, and she also processes bill payments for her customers. She joined Ruma three years ago because she wanted to generate more income to fulfill her family's needs. 

Currently, she is taking a working capital loan from Kiva to boost her daily business transactions and generate more sales, especially on weekends when sales are higher than on weekdays. For the last three months, she has had around $49-$50 in sales per day just from mobile phone airtime credits and bill-payment service.

As her business continues, Qurotul is planning to add more items in her stall and seek more business opportunities. 

In the photo, Qurotul is standing in front of her stall. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credits and bill payment transactions on weekends.

loans.name: Dúo Pamomo Group

texts.es:
DUO PAMOMO 
La señora betzaida de 35 años de edad es madre soltera tiene 3 hijos reside en ciudad peronia actualmente tiene a su cargo una venta de zapatos americanos juntamente con una venta de ropa americana  ella es una persona luchadora a pesar de que hace aproximadamente  2 años falleció su esposos a salido adelante y a ha luchado para que sus hijos tengan un estilo de vida cómodo ella empezó su negocio hace algunos años y le ha ido muy bien el secretos del crecimiento de su negociomás es el no dar crédito porque le permite ver inmediatamente las ganancias de lo invertido, de sus tres hijos uno de ellos estudia y dos aun no pero que si DIOS le permite los podrá ir viendo día con día ella toca las puertas de fape en esta ocasión para solicitar un  crédito para poder invertirlo en un lote de zapatos y así poder aprovechar las ventas que vienen en esta temporada…
texts.en:
"Duo Pamomo" Group

Ms. Betzaida is 35 years old. She is a single mother with three children. She currently lives in the city of Peronia. She is responsable for selling American shoes along with American clothing.

She is a hard worker despite the death of her husband approximately two years ago. She has continued to move forward and has fought hard so that her children can live comfortably. She started her business and few years ago and it is going very well. The secret of growing her business is to not sell on credit because that allows her to immediately receive a return on her investment.

Of her three children, one at school and the other two are not. But, God willing, they will be able to study one day.

She is reaching out to FAPE to request a loan to invest in a batch of shoes. This will allow her to take advantage of the sales demand that exists this season.

loans.use: to purchase shoes secondhand.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 5,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, spices, vegetables, etc., for her business.

Susana has been in this business for two years. She earns additional income from buying and selling goats.

Susana has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, spices, vegetables, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer, age 40, is married and blessed with three children. She sells bananas in her village and earns a net income of 150 PHP daily. She also sells daily cooked foods in her village to generate additional income. Her profits are usually spent on school expenses for her children and used for additional capital for her food vending business. 

She would like to request a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP to purchase bananas for resale. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that her business will become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase bananas for resale.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Evelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming bananas and corn.  Evelyn is borrowing 9,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more bread, coffee, sugar, etc., for her business.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more bread, coffee, sugar, etc., for her business

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 42 years old and married with six children, three of whom are in school. Marilyn works very hard to provide for them.

Marilyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items for resale, such as shampoo, soft drinks, eggs, bread and chips.

Marilyn has been in this business for ten years.

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items for resale, such as shampoo, soft drinks, eggs, bread and chips.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 31 years old and married with three children. With one child still in school, Alma works very hard to provide for them.

Alma runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like snack foods, candles, canned goods, soft drinks, etc. to sell.

Alma has been in this business for three years, and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, candles, canned goods, soft drinks, etc. 

In the future, Alma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like snack foods, candles, canned goods, soft drinks, etc. to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a farmer and a mother of three children living in Nyamira, a very rich banana growing area. She has practiced farming for six years; she produces and sells milk, eggs, and bananas.  She also rears rabbits, and sells them in the local market. Her biggest challenge in farming is a lack of sufficient funds. 

Susan chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan to fund her rabbit project because their loans are at a low interest rate, and also because Juhudi supports small scale farmers.

This loan will enable her to purchase more rabbits to sell, and then it will bring in more income and thus help her take care of her children's fees and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase rabbits.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 43 years old and married with six children.  She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Amelita has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years, and also earns an additional income from food vending.

Amelita aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Nimunyonje

texts.en:
Nimunyonje is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated a fish selling business for the last three years, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the Kshs 50,000, she wants to purchase fish, cooking oil, and firewood for her business. 

She decided to join to acquire financial services for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish, cooking oil, and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Ananita

texts.en:
Ananita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a personal collection direct selling products business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy additional products from the personal collection to sell for her direct selling personal collection products business.

Ananita has been in this business for one year; she earns more income from a general store.

Ananita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. 

She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional personal collection products to sell

loans.name: Socrates Walberto

texts.es:
Walberto tiene 30 años de edad estado civil Unión libre vive con su esposa y con su hijo de 3 años, Vive en el Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.
La ventanilla se llama SAN NICOLAS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Nicolás, perteneciente a la parroquia Ricaurte cantón Urdaneta, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Walberto se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace algunos años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar en el Cantón Urdaneta.
El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es tener dinero para comprar un terreno .
Le gusta trabajar y hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Walberto is 30 years old and is in a common-law marriage. He lives with his wife and his 3-year-old son. He lives in the Cantón Ventanas district in the province of Los Rios.

The communal bank is called "San Nicolas" and is located in the rural community of San Nicolás which belongs to the Ricuarte parish of Cantón Urdaneta. This group works in agriculture and livestock.

Walberto has made a living farming corn and rice for the last few years. He buys his supplies in Ventanas and sells them in a similar market in the Cantón Urdaneta district.

He is requesting a loan to purchase manure, urea, and liquid fertilizers for harvesting corn and rice. The loan will help him increase his income for his family's consumption and to invest. His dream is to have money to purchase a plot of land. He enjoys working and playing sports.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for short-cycle farming.

loans.name: Fatin's Group

texts.en:
A young Iraqi woman, Fatin is 23 years old, married and a mother of one child. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Fatin is one of the many Iraqi women who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

Fatin learned her skills as a young girl and has turned turn them into a small, home-based business which makes women’s and children’s clothing. It is an ideal and widely accepted way to generate additional income for the family. With three years of experience in this enterprise, she would like to improve it, see it succeed and potentially grow it. Inside her home she has the typical responsibilities of a young wife and mother, and she enjoys doing an extra activity through which she can provide services to other women. 

To make her work easier to manage, Fatin is taking a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq to buy a new sewing machine and a small generator. Because she lives in an area where electricity is scarce and the power supply is often interrupted, having her own generator will enable her to effectively manage her time and plan her work without having to rely on the power supply.

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby rendering them ineligible to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients, and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for her protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and a small generator.

loans.name: Laurentina

texts.en:
Laurentina is taking a loan of 600 USD to improve her business. She is married. She is running a second hand clothing store that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy merchandise, such as shirts, trousers, shorts, short sleeve shirts and long sleeve shirts, to sell in her store. 

She opened her second hand clothing store in 2010, with her own working capital of 300 USD. Laurentina is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy shirts, trousers, shorts, short sleeve shirts and long sleeve shirts.

loans.name: Sobia

texts.en:
Sobia lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan; she is a new member of BRAC and taking her first loan. She is taking a loan for her husband, who drives an auto rickshaw. He has been driving the auto rickshaw for many years using petrol, which is very costly. Due to the increase in the cost of petrol, he sold his old rickshaw and wants to buy a new CNG (compressed natural gas) rickshaw. 

Even with the combination of their savings and the sales price of the old rickshaw, they are still short the amount needed to buy a new CNG rickshaw.  Therefore, Sobia contacted Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the loan, her husband will buy a CNG rickshaw so he can minimize fuel expenses and be able to increase his income.

Sobia seems very happy after taking this loan. She thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a CNG rickshaw to replace a rickshaw that used petrol.

loans.name: Adalgisa

texts.en:
Adalgisa is applying for a loan of $1000 to improve her business. 

She is married and has four children.  She is running a beauty salon business in her house.  She is making a good income from the beauty salon, and she wants to buy more needed items with the loan. 

She is living a town near the main road, so many people come to her beauty salon shop and she is open every day. 

She opened her business in 2009 with her own working capital of $100.

loans.use: To buy materials for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.en:
Mavjuda is 46 years old. She lives in a small village in northern Tajikistan with her husband and son. The only source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. Mavjuda has been busy with animal husbandry during the past year. Her husband helps her with managing the business. It is hardly enough to provide food for the family. 

She wants to develop the business but doesn't have money to buy more cattle. This loan will help her to increase the number of cattle, and from the profits to improve her family's living conditions. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle to sell

loans.name: Mutahira
