With the loan, she would like to buy more cooking oil, potatoes and beans for sale. She plans to use the profits for reinvesting in the business.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil,potatoes and beans for sale.

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a 'buy and sell' banana business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase additional bananas to sell for her business.

Florenda has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from her general store.

Florenda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas to sell

loans.name: Lorgia Veronica

texts.es: Doña Lorgia es originaria de la ciudad de Managua, casada y madre de cuatro hijos dos de ellos ya independientes. De 39 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería. Inicio su negocio hace dos años con capital propio y logro salir adelante. Solicita el crédito para la compra de: Arroz, Frijoles, Azúcar, Pan, Gaseosas entre otros. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá ofrecer una amplia variedad de productos a sus clientes. Su plan futuro es establecer un puesto de comida en su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Doña Lorgia is from the city of Managua. She is 39 years old, and she is married with four children, two of whom are already independent.

She has a grocery store—a business that she started two years ago with her own capital, and she has managed to make ends meet.
 
She is seeking a loan for the purchase of rice, beans, sugar, bread, soft drinks, and similar items. She believes that the loan will be a great help to her, as she will be able to offer a wide variety of products to her customers.

Her future plan is to establish a food stand in her home.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, sugar, bread, soft drinks, and similar items.

loans.name: Adelphine

texts.en: Adelphine is 23 years old. She sells various items in her shop which she has been running for the last three years. With the loan, she would like to buy more beans and rice for sale. Profits from the business will be used to put aside more savings.

loans.use: To buy more beans and rice for sale.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vinegar-making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to purchase bottles, coconut wine, etc. for her vinegar-making business.

Alma has been in this business for 16 years. She earns more income from pig fattening.

Alma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money  to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bottles, coconut wine, etc. for her business

loans.name: Patimah

texts.en:
Patimah and her husband live in a family home in Bogor, a suburban area located about an hour from Jakarta, the capital city. They have two children; the older one is going to university this year, and the younger one is still in elementary school. 

Patimah owns several businesses, such as running an internet cafe called "Warung Internet" (or "WarNet" for short), offering household items on installment, selling mobile phone airtime credits, and processing bill payments for her customers. She joined Ruma because she wants to gain more business knowledge, and earn more income. 

Currently, Patimah is taking a working capital loan from Kiva as she sees more sales are generated on weekends. For the last three months, she has had around $30-$31 in sales per day, just from selling mobile phone airtime credits. As her business continues, she's glad that her business is assisted and supported by Ruma agents. 

Patimah plans to seek more business opportunities so she can put aside the extra income for family savings. In the photo, Patimah is sitting with her "WarNet" computer. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credits and bill payment transactions on weekends

loans.name: Leni

texts.en:
Leni is a housewife living with four persons in the family home in Cibubur, a suburban area located about 30 minutes from Jakarta. Leni's husband works in a private company. As a housewife, Leni wants to help her husband and increase her family's income. Therefore she manages a small stall that sells snacks, drinks, groceries, and mobile phone airtime credits. 

A few months ago, Leni joined Ruma because she wanted to improve her business. She feels her business is improving because of the support and assistance she's gotten from Ruma agents. As her business continues, she hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to boost these transactions on weekends when sales are generally higher than on weekdays. 

For the last three months, she has had around $60-$61 per day in sales, just from selling mobile phone airtime credits. Leni plans to seek more business opportunities and put aside the extra cash for her children's education. Leni thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credits and bill payment transactions on weekends

loans.name: Izolda

texts.en: Izolda is a 67-year-old woman from Samtredia. She has six members in her family and the only source of income is from agricultural activities. They cultivate a plot of agricultural land and also have pigs. The income from this mentioned activity is insignificant and Izolda has a great desire somehow to improve her family's living conditions. She requested a loan for a poultry business. The start up program that is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo enables people like Izolda to start or re-start businesses. She was approved for a loan of 3500 USD to purchase cages, food for chickens and other inventory. This new business will be a great help for this family as they will increase their monthly income and living conditions. Izolda is grateful to all Kiva lenders for their help.

loans.use: To start a poultry business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum, and millet

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es:
Nieves nació en la ciudad de Pilco – Grande y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, ella tiene 42 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene seis hijos. 

Nieves se siente alegre por el apoyo brindado y por el préstamo anterior porque pudo incrementar el capital del negocio y pudo obtener buenas ganancias, ella desea continuar participando en este proyecto porque le ayuda mucho con el autoestima y se siente agradecida por la confianza que tienen en ella, Nieves se sigue dedicándose a la agricultura, a la ganadería y a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, gallinas, chanchos y otros, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. (La comunidad de Pilco – Grande está ubicado en el distrito de Huayllabamba dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo en el  departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Nieves was born in the city of Pilco Grande and lives in the same city where she was born. She is 42 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has six children. 

Nieves is happy about the support provided, and through the previous loan was able to increase the working capital of the business and obtain good profits. She wishes to continue participating in this project, because it helps a great deal with self-esteem and she is grateful for the trust they have in her.

Nieves is still working in agriculture, and raising livestock and small animals such as guinea pigs, chickens, pigs and other animals. On this occasion she requires the loan to buy small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens. The community of Pilco Grande is located in Huayllabamba district in Paucartambo province,  Cusco department, Peru.

loans.use: To buy small animals such as guinea pigs.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon runs a sari-sari (or variety) store, in her place in Bohol, Philippines. She has been in the business for more than two years now. This is the source of her income.

Corazon is asking for a loan to buy additional stock, including rice, canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, and other items. With this, she will be able to improve her store as well as her sales, thus increasing her profit and income.

loans.use: to buy additional stock, including rice, canned goods, and noodles

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
Lenie is 33 years of age, married, and blessed with two children. She manages a hog raising business in their village and earns a net income of PHP 3,500 per hog. She also has been selling snacks inside the school campus for additional income for almost two years . 

Due to inadequate capital she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 11,000 to purchase hog feed. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow to become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase hog feed

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en: Nerissa is a farmer from the town of Ubay, Bohol. She is a married woman and has two children. Nerissa has been in the business of farming for several years, now. She helps her husband in tilling their land. Nerissa is asking for a loan, which she will use to buy fertilizer and pesticide for the farm. Through this, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide for the farm

loans.name: Emiliano

texts.en: Emiliano is aged 45, married and blessed with five children. He manages a livestock business in their village and earns a net income of 3,500 PHP per hog. His profits were usually spent on school allowances of his children. Due to financial difficulty, he would like to request a loan from those generous lenders in the amount of 7,000 PHP to purchase hog and chicken feeds for his livestock animals. He's hoping that his business will continue to grow to earn more income.

loans.use: To purchase hog and chicken feeds for his livestock animals

loans.name: Dioqueta

texts.en:
Dioqueta works hard to support her family. Dioqueta is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 2 years now.

She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers. Dioqueta would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ardiana

texts.en:
Ardiana works hard to support her family. She is married, and she has a stone-cropping business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for nine years.

Ardiana requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional equipment for her business.

In the future, Ardiana would like to save money, to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment for her stone business

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
Asuncion is 67 years old and married. She has nine children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur, running a fishing and fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has been doing this work for 10 years.

Asuncion requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional materials and gear for her business.

Asuncion would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and gear for her business

loans.name: Baby Girl

texts.en:
Baby Girl is 28 years old and single. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for three years. She sells a variety of items. 

She requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks like canned goods, shampoo, detergent soap, soft-drinks, cooking oil, diapers, etc., to sell. In the future, Baby Girl would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like canned goods, shampoo, detergent soap, soft-drinks, cooking oil, diapers, etc., to sell

loans.name: Benjie

texts.en:
Benjie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a welding business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

Benjie requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional tools and equipment for her business.

In the future, Benjie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional tools and equipment for her business

loans.name: Bernadita

texts.en:
Bernadita works hard to support her family. Bernadita is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

Bernadita requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials and ingredients like rice, coconut leaves, etc. for her business.

Bernadita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and ingredients like rice, coconut leaves, etc. for her business

loans.name: Amna

texts.en: Amna is a 50-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands including food, health and clothing. She, with her husband, is doing agriculture work and has been for many years. She crops different vegetables and fruits and sells them in the local market. Her son also assists her in growing various crops by watering soil for good quality production. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her 5th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan amount to purchase different types of seeds along with the packs of insecticides and pesticides. This would help her to grow more crops which ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds along with packs of insecticides and pesticides.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en: Shahida is 50 years old and a married woman. She is the mother of three children. The man shown in the photo is Shahida’s husband, who is a driver by profession. He provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Shahida has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000. She will use the loan for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Shahida is hoping that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy school supplies, clothing, footwear and cosmetics.

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena is a 40-year-old woman from the town of Panglao, Bohol. She is married with seven children. The oldest is 17 while the youngest is two years old. She runs a variety store and sells various items ranging from eggs, coffee, and cooking oil. to soap and canned goods.  Her business started more than five years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy assorted grocery products  and fishing materials, to maintain the inventory of her store, so as to augment her income.  

In the future, Ma. Elena hopes to expand her business and increase her business profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy  assorted grocery products and fishing materials

loans.name: Jefferson Leonardo

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como Estancia Vieja en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las socias  del Grupo De Crédito Estancia Vieja. Lugar de gente humilde y dedicada a la agricultura y al comercio en general.
En este lugar vive el señor Jefferson, tiene 39 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos de 15, 13, 12, 10 y 8 años, los tres mayores  estudian en colegio y los menores en escuela. Su mujer es comerciante. 
Don Jefferson  y su mujer para sacar adelante a su familia se dedican al comercio, ellos venden ropa de todo tipo, zapatos, zapatillas entre otros productos, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también se desplazan los días de ferias a otras ciudades, en las cuales instalan un local en la calle de estas ciudades para así vender su mercadería y tener los recursos necesarios para salir adelante y darles una buena educación a sus hijos, ellos llevan más de 10 años dedicados a esta actividad con la cual salen adelante.
Este  crédito lo va utilizar en comprar ropa, zapatos, zapatillas entre otras cosas que venden. Lleva 4 ciclos en el  Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y a bajos intereses. Su sueño es un carro para realizar sus ventas.
texts.en:
In the area known as Estancia Vieja in the Colon parish in the city of Portoviejo, every fifteen days the associates of the Grupo de Crédito Estancia Vieja meet. It is a place of humble people who are dedicated to agriculture and general business. 

Jefferson lives in this place. He is 39 years old and has a common-law marriage in which he has five children who are 15, 13, 12, 10 and 8 years old. The three oldest ones study in high school and the younger ones are in elementary and middle school. His wife is a businesswoman.

In order to move their family forward, Jefferson and his wife work in business. They sell clothing of all types, including shoes and tennis shoes, among other products. Their form of sales is door to door, and they also go around on fair days in other cities, in which they set up a shop in the street of these cities, in order to sell their merchandise and have the necessary resources to move forward and give a good education to their children. They have dedicated more than 10 years to this activity with which they move forward. 

He is going to use this loan to buy clothing, shoes, and tennis shoes, among other things that they sell. He has been with Grupo de Crédito for four cycles and he likes it because the loans are quick and at low interest. His dream is a car to make his sales.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, tennis shoes, etc.

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Lita works hard to support her family. She has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Lita is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell in her charcoal business.

Lita has been strengthening her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal for sale

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline works hard to support her family. Evangeline is married and has a abaca-weaving business in the Philippines.

Evangeline requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase abaca fiber to sell.

Evangeline has been in this business for 14 years now.

In the future, Evangeline would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase abaca (plant) fiber to sell

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Juliana requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell. She has been in this business for 26 years now.

In the future, Juliana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: John Baptist

texts.en: John Baptist used the previous loan to do some construction on his incomplete residential house. However because the house is big, the 2,000,000 UGX loan did not do much (the current status of the house will be posted shortly in the journal). He is requesting another loan so that he can complete the house and finally inhabit it. He is hard working.

loans.use: To complete his house.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena works hard to support her family. Elena is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

Elena has been in this business for 12 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is married with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Narcisa is 42 years old and has three children who are in school.

Narcisa has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.

Narcisa has been in this business for 23 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Esteban Pascual

texts.es: Don Esteban es originario de la ciudad de Boaco, soltero y padre de dos hijos. De 29 años de edad. Es de oficio Agricultor, se dedica a la siembra de Arroz. Inicio su negocio hace tres años con la ayuda de su Papa. Su meta próxima es sembrar dos metros de Arroz y comprar una vaca. Solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes, sipermitrina, diésel entre otros químicos para la siembra. Estima que el crédito le ayudara a incrementar su producción y obtener mejores ganancias. Su plan futuro es mejorar la infraestructura de su casa.
texts.en:
Esteban hails from the city of Boaco. He is single and the father of two children, and is 29 years old.

He is a farmer and makes his living growing rice. He began his business three years ago with the help of his father. His next goal is to plant a two-meter plot of rice and to buy a cow.

He is applying for the loan to buy fertilizers, cypermethrin [an insecticide], diesel and other chemicals for the sowing. He anticipates that the loan will help him increase production and to get better earnings.

His future plan is to improve the infrastructure of his house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, cypermethrin [an insecticide], diesel and other chemicals for the planting.

loans.name: Maa Bhagabati Shg Group

texts.en:
Mamata, 35 years old, is married, has one child, and lives with him and her husband in a village that belongs to the Khurda district of Odisha, India. She has always worked in agriculture. She has been growing her own crops along with her husband for many years, since the area where they live is agricultural and apt for these crops. She grows potatoes, corn, beans and cabbage. She sells this produce in the local market. She has applied for this loan to keep her crops well maintained.

On this occasion, she, along with her group, is applying for this loan of 250,000 INR. She will use her portion to buy seeds, fertilizer, insecticide, and herbicide for her crops and to have better harvests. Her goal is to increase the income for her family.

She belongs to the "Maa bhagabati SHG" self help group, which is made up of 10 members. In the photo, the lady standing with raised hand is Mamata. They all make their living in potato farming in the area and live in the same community.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer, insecticide, herbicide and other items for her crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase an increased amount of vegetables, cassava, flour, and food items.

loans.name: Señor De Los Milagros Group

texts.es: Elisa de 53 años es soltera y no tiene hijos, actualmente pertenece al grupo “Señor De Los Milagros”  constituida por 07 mujeres emprendedoras y activas.  Con los deseos de superarse Elisa inicia su negocio, la cual hace más de 15 años que  cuenta con una bodega en su vivienda. Elisa se siente feliz pues con su esfuerzo ha llegado a cumplir algunos de sus sueños como construir parte de su casa. Su último crédito lo destinará para la compra de abarrotes, bebidas y golosinas. Su siguiente meta es de terminar de construir su casa. El grupo “Señor De Los Milagros” agradecen a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito. Elisa se encuentra sentada, es la primera del lado derecho.
texts.en:
Elisa is 53 years old and does not have any children. She currently belongs to the group "Señor De Los Milagros" (Our Lord of Miracles) which consists of 7 enterprising and active women. Elisa started her business with the desire to better herself, and she has now run her grocery shop from her home for more than 15 years. She is happy because with her strength she has managed to achieve some of her dreams such as building part of her house.

This latest loan will be used to buy groceries, drinks and candy. Her next goal is to finish construction on her house. The "Señor De Los Milagros" group is thankful to the lenders who have made this loan possible. Elisa is sitting down to the right of the picture.

loans.use: to buy groceries, drinks and candy.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is a married woman and a mother of three children from Ubay, Bohol. Conchita has been engaged in a hog-raising business for more than five years now. This is the source of her income.

Conchita is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise. With this loan, she will be able to improve her hog-raising business and augment her income.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Gracelyn

texts.en:
Gracelyn is aged 31, married to a farmer, and blessed with two children. She is selling vegetables and fish to earn an income. She usually earns about PHP 300 a day and uses it to buy meals and serve as a revolving capital for her business. 

She wanted to increase her sales. That's why she is now asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy fish and vegetables (eggplant and tomatoes) to sell. She hopes that her sales will gain and earn more income from her business.

loans.use: to buy fish and vegetables (eggplant and tomatoes) to sell

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a married mother of seven children from CPG, Bohol, Philippines. She has been engaged in the rice farming business for several years. Her husband operates a chainsaw machine. These are the sources of their income.

As of now, Rebecca needs a loan for her business. She is asking for a loan, which she will use to buy additional fertilizer and pesticide for the farm and spare parts for the chainsaw. With these purchases, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm, thus augmenting her harvest yield and income. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizer and pesticide for the farm and spare parts for the chainsaw

loans.name: Cenona

texts.en:
Cenona is 58 years old and married with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

She has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a 24,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Cenona has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Cenona would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Daniela

texts.en:
Daniela is 46 years old and married with six children. With three children currently in school, Daniela works very hard to provide for them.

Daniela runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more goods like canned goods, noodles, snack foods, sugar, milk, cooking oil, etc. to sell.

Daniela has been in this business for 7 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, snack foods, sugar, milk, cooking oil, etc. 

In the future, Daniela would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more goods like noodles, snack foods, canned goods, sugar, milk, cooking oil, etc. to sell

loans.name: Desideria

texts.en:
Desideria is 57 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Desideria has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

Desideria has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Desideria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Juhayla

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Juhayla works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising chickens. Juhayla is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to purchase more ingredients for her food production business.

Juhayla has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients for her food production

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es:
María, solicita capital para comprar arcilla, nacazcol barro, para continuar elaborando sus productos, ya que en estas fechas de fin de año sus encargos aumentaron y necesita entregar a tiempo sus pedidos.
Con el crédito anterior invirtió en materiales para su negocio, lo que le dio más clientes satisfechos, mayores ventas y mejoro su economía.
texts.en:
María needs money to buy clay and nacazcol (a type of dye) to continue making her products. This is because it is the end of the year and so she gets more orders and needs to deliver the goods on time. 

She invested her earlier credit in supplies for her business, and thus could satisfy more customers, increase her sales and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy clay and nacaszcol (a type of dye).

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 55 years old and widowed. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a buy and sell soft drinks business in the Philippines. Carmelita requested a 12,500 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy additional cases of soft drinks to sell.

She has been in this business for 7 years. Carmelita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional cases of soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Demuri

texts.en:
Demuri is 62 years old and a farmer. He is from the village of Vejini, in Gurjaani district. He lives with his wife, daughter and grandson. His daughter works as a cashier, and gets 250 GEL in monthly income. Demuri has been involved in agricultural business from early childhood. His parents were farmers, and this is a traditional activity for the family. He owns a vineyard and sells grapes, in season.

He wants to expand the family farming activity, so he sought credit among local financial institutions. The Start-up Program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor people to get loans for starting or restarting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program, to get a loan of 3,500 GEL. He will use the loan for purchasing grape vine seedlings and expanding the vineyard, and also to purchase calves. He will cultivate the purchased seedlings and will pick more grapes in future, after expansion of the vineyard. He will also raise the calves, and the family will start producing dairy products to sell -- for example, cheese and yogurt. They could also use the milk products for feeding the family. The new business initiative will give Demuri a chance to have financial stability.

loans.use: To buy calves, and expand the vineyard with new vine seedlings

loans.name: Ozada

texts.ru: Озаде 51 год, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Озады - среднее образование, всю свою сознательную жизнь она занимается разведением скота, имеет большой опыт в животноводстве, также имеет стабильные доходы от своего бизнеса, дети и супруг помогают ей по хозяйству. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Озада занимается животноводством, стартовав 30 лет назад, с покупки скота на 1,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Озады, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 15 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Озада обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом -на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Озада планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на улучшение материального положения семьи.
texts.en: Ozada is 51 years old and married. She and her husband are bringing up three children. Ozada has secondary education;  from an early age on, she has been raising livestock. She has plenty of experience in animal farming. Her business brings in a stable income. Her husband and children help her in the business. Raising livestock is the main source of income for Ozada's family. She launched this business 30 years ago by buying animals for 1,000 KGS. Thanks to Ozada's hard work, her farm now includes two dairy cows and 15 sheep. Her monthly income is 5,000 KGS. In order to develop her business further, Ozada turned to the Bai Tushum & Partners microfinance institution for a loan to increase her headcount by buying  sheep. Ozada plans to use the resulting revenue for an additional increase of livestock. She plans to save up money to improve her family's life conditions.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is 40-years old married woman, living with her spouse and five children in the area of Lahore. Her husband is a wholesaler of rice; he buys the rice from harvesters at a low price and sells it to the retailers in Lahore city. He buys rice of various kinds such as basmati, super kernel etc. He has been doing same practice for many years and has many reputed retailers who like to buy rice from him in large quantity. In this tenure he has built up positive relationships with the retailers. 

With the increase in new customers and demand, he wants to buy rice in bulk, so that he can easily cope with the rapid increase in demand. In this way he would be able to increase his monthly income and savings as well.  Rubina praises the honorable supporters; she thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy rice in bulk to sell to the retailers.

loans.name: Osbert

texts.en:
Osbert, 29, resides in the outskirts of Nabbingo. Three years ago, he started a mobile money business. Osbert needed to create a new source of income to support himself after he failed to find formal employment.

Osbert's business is strategically located. His major business challenge is a lack of capital, which makes it difficult to adequately serve his customers.   When his business has inadequate financing, it hinders his company's growth and expansion. Therefore, Osbert is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 UGX to add capital to his business.

loans.use: invest in his mobile money business

loans.name: Ssegoza

texts.en:
Ssegoza is 42 years old and a resident of a rural Nazinga zone. He has three children and two dependants. Ssegoza has the obligation of taking  care of his late sister’s children and is  paying  their tuition from the little income he earns from his business.

He started this business three years ago as source of income to support his family since he is the sole bread winner of the entire family as his wife is jobless.

His business is strategically located, but his major challenge is inadequate capital, which doesn’t enable him buy enough stock for his business, thus hindering its growth and expansion.  Hence he is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 UGX. His neighbours commended him for being a hardworking, determined and supportive person in society.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in the retail shop

loans.name: Norvil

texts.en:
Norvil is a 39-year-old woman from the town of Dauis, Bohol. She is married with two children, ages 10 and 6 years old respectively. 

Norvil is a fish vendor. She sells fresh fish to earn a living. Her business started more than five years ago. Her husband is a fisherman. Together, they work hard to support their family. 

She is asking for a loan to buy fishing materials like plastic screen, nylon and wire, to improve her husband’s catch.

In the future, Norvil would like to expand her fish-vending business to support the education of her children as well as improve her status of living.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like plastic screen, nylon and wire.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
Agustina is married with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Agustina is 57 years old and has two children who are in school.

Agustina has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell.

Agustina has been in this business for one year. In the future, Agustina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Cina

texts.en:
Cina is married with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Cina is 44 years old and has three children who are in school.

Cina has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Cina requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Cina has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Cina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is 38 years old and married with four children in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

For the past five years Lucena has sold fish in the Philippines. She is applying for an 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Lucena’s aim is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en:
Dionesia is married and has operated a restaurant for the past 35 years. She is applying for a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy chicken, fish, vegetables, etc. for her dishes.

Dionesia works hard to support her family. She wants to make more money so she can expand her business.

loans.use: to buy chicken, fish, vegetables, etc. for her dishes.

loans.name: Maa Patkhanda Group

texts.en:
Radhika, the lady standing second from left with raised hand in the photo, is a widow from the village of Risigaon, Nuapada district in Odisha, India. She is a very active and confident woman of 49 years. She resides in a small house with her only son and daughter-in-law. 

After the death of her husband, as head of her family Radhika with confidence took on the responsibility of managing the family and started  running a general grocery shop in her small house with items like soap, shampoo, washing powder, sugar, tea, oil, etc. She started the business with a small investment of her own. At that time her monthly net income was around 2,000 INR and it was very difficult on her part to maintain the family with a small income. 

When Mahashakti started work in the area, Radhika motivated three other members of her village and formed a Joint Liability Group named Maa Patkhanda to access loans for the development of her business. Her son helped her by purchasing inventory from nearest market, six kilometers away. To date, Radhika has already accessed two loans of 10,000 and 14,000 INR and has been able to expand her business. With her increased income she also constructed a permanent stall adjoining to her house for her general store. Presently she is earning a monthly income of 5,000 INR. 

Radhika says this income is also not enough to make her dream of building a house for her family a reality. She wants to expand her business further, so she will utilize the present loan for purchasing items like rice, wheat, lentils, oil, soap, potatoes etc. for her general store. This will help her to reduce her purchasing and transportation costs as she will replenish her stock less frequently. She hopes that this investment will give her more income and with enough savings, she will be able to construct a house for her family. The other three members of the group are Basanti, Jamuna and Mukta who are running a general store, a Tiffin (tea) stall and an electrical repair center.

loans.use: To pay items like rice, wheat, lentils, oil, soap, potatoes, etc. for her general store

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to purchase more linens and thread to sell.

Arlyn has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Arlyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more linens and thread to sell

loans.name: Gegham

texts.en:
Gegham is from Kapan town, where he earns his living by providing construction service for locals. Gegham has been involved in the construction sector for two years now, and it helps him to support his family. Gegham lives with his wife and does his best to provide appropriate living conditions for her. 

Gegham receives different orders from locals and provides both internal and external renovation of houses. Now, to be able to purchase new tools needed for providing renovation service, Gegham applied for this loan. It will enable him to organize his work more effectively and provide better quality service to his clients.

Gegham has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is important for Gegham and he hopes that lenders will support him to continue providing service and supporting his family.

loans.use: to purchase new tools needed for providing renovation service

loans.name: Reynilda

texts.en:
Reynilda works hard to support her family. Reynilda is married and has a business buying and selling used clothing in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of used clothes to resell.

Reynilda has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Reynilda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Maa Tarini Shg (G) Group

texts.en:
"Maa Tarini SHG" is a self help group of eleven members from a small village of Odisha, India with Laxmi being selected to act as the Kiva representative. Laxmi is standing sixth from right in pink sari with her hand raised. The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant vegetables, flowers, maize and paddy (rice). 

Laxmi is a reliable member of the group. She is married and has two children. Laxmi is 43 years old and has been working as a farmer for the last 12 years to support her family. In addition to this, Laxmi is very active in her group and is involved with a farming institute to learn new concepts of farming. She described her harvest last year as good. She hopes to continue working in this activity to grow more.

Working with this group and with People's Forum has improved Laxmi's life because she has more farm training and has been able to put aside money to feed her family. In the future, Laxmi hopes that her profits from 2014 can be used to send her children to a good school.

Laxmi will use her portion to cover the initial cost of purchasing seeds and fertilizer. People's Forum continues to provide training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment. With support from People's Forum and the Kiva loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and hybrid seeds of maize, paddy (rice), vegetables and small flower plants.

loans.name: Norair

texts.en:
Norair is a 44-year-old married man, from Akhalkalaki district. He has a wife, two sons, and a mother, who gets monthly assistance from the local government. His wife works at a kindergarten and generates 160 GEL monthly. 

Norair has his own car, which he uses for agricultural product distribution. He brings products door-to-door and sells them locally. He cultivates a plot of agricultural land, and harvests fruits and vegetables. Norair's income isn't stable, as you noticed, so he wants to start an activity that will give him everyday income and a more stable salary. 

He requested a loan and was approved with the start-up program that gives people a chance to start or re-start businesses. He will use this 500 USD for starting another activity, to take place at the local shopping market, selling his fresh products from this crowded place. 

This business initiative will be profitable, as it has good location, and Norair will do his best for business expansion in the future. 

He awaits your support.

loans.use: To start a retail business with fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetics like body lotions, hair pomade, body spray, etc

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy beer, soda, juice, wine and spirits, and to open a wholesale shop

loans.name: Godofredo Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos nació en la ciudad de Puno pero actualmente vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco, él tiene 53 años de edad y es casado y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene un hijo, él trabaja en una entidad del estado en el área administrativa y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento de la casa. 
Agradece a los inversionistas por el apoyo brindado y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas puntuales y con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Carlos was born in Puno but lives in the beautiful city of Cusco.  He is 53 years old, married, and has a son.  He works as a civil manager and needs a loan to do maintenance on his house.

He is grateful to the lenders for their support and is committed to making his payments on time and responsibly.

loans.use: to make home improvements.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en: Belinda is 42 years old and married to a farmer. She has been blessed with two children. Belinda has been selling bananas in their village for almost five years. She earns a net income of PHP 200 daily. She also sells vegetables, for additional income. Her profits are usually spent on their food expenses and purchasing hog feed for her hogs. Due to a lack of capital, she would like to obtain a loan amounting to PHP 9,000. She will use this amount to purchase bananas and other fruit varieties to sell. She's hoping that her business will become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase bananas and other varieties of fruit to sell

loans.name: Severo

texts.es:
Severo es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en casa de familiares la misma se encuentra ubicada en la zona Villa Exaltacion de la ciudad de El Alto.
El estudio hasta el nivel secundaria. Actualmente trabaja de chofer propietario de Trufi en uno de los sindicatos de choferes de la ciudad, con su ruta es de ciudad Satelite a San Pedro. 
El crédito lo requiere para el mantenimiento de su movilidad. Compra de repuestos y mantenimiento y cambio de fluidos.
El sueño de Severo  es que su movilidad este en buenas condiciones para asi poder tener mejor calidad de vida.
Es la tercera  vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Severo is single and does not have any children. He lives in his family home located in the Villa Exaltacion area in the city of El Alto. He studied up to Junior High level. He currently works as a taxi owner-driver in one of the city's driver unions. His route goes from Ciudad Satélite to San Pedro.

He needs this loan to maintain his mobility, to buy spare parts and for maintaining and changing fluids. Severo's dream is to keep his car in a good condition so that he can have a better quality of life. This is the third loan he has taken with IMPRO, and the first through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, and maintain / change the fluids in his taxi.

loans.name: James Mark

texts.en: James Mark, who is married and has a 2-year-old son, is from Ubay, Bohol. He has been in the farming business for more than 5 years and it is the source of his income. James Mark is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. This will allow him to improve the productivity of his farm, thus augmenting his yield and income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is married and the mother of two young children, living in Ubay, Bohol. 

She earns a living through her hog raising business. She is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and feed for the pigs. 

She hopes to make her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise and feed for the pigs

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: María tiene 42 años, es madre soltera de 2 hijo de 13 y 5  años de edad quiénes son su fuerza para salir adelante. Hace 2 años que se dedica a la venta de jugo de caña. Beneficiaria utilizará el crédito para montar un kiosco de venta de jugo de caña. Su gran sueño es tener su negocio más grande, el cual le permita mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos.
texts.en: Maria is 42 years old and the single mother of 2 children, ages 13 and 5.  They are her force with which to get ahead.  She has been selling sugar cane juice for two years and she will use the money from this loan to set up a kiosk to sell juice.  Her great dream is to have a larger business that will allow her to improve the quality of life for her children.

loans.use: to et up a food kiosk.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is from the village of Antonino, Alicia, in the Philippines.  She is 51 years old and married to Dominador, who helps her to manage their photography business. She has been in this business for almost 20 years and usually earns a net income of PHP 500 a day. 

The couple wants to give their three children a better quality of life. With regards to her goal in life, Lolita is requesting a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy ink, bond paper, laminating pouch film, and photo paper for her business. 

She hopes that through the loan she requested, she will able to earn higher income than the usual income she obtains from her business.

loans.use: to buy ink, bond paper, laminating pouch film, and photo paper for her business

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca, who is married and has two young children, is from Ubay, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari (convenience) store, selling various goods and items to the people in her area.

Rebecca is asking for a loan to buy additional merchandise, such as canned goods, candies, chips, snack foods, seasonings, soap and toiletries. This will allow her to improve her stock, thus augmenting her sales and income. Rebecca hopes to make her business a success. She also wants to save money for her children's future schooling.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Olivia Evangelina

texts.es:
Olivia, se dispone a adquirir la materia prima para continuar atendiendo mejor a sus clientes, comprara maíz, frijol, chicharrón, quesillo y gas propano, lo que le facilitara el crecimiento de su negocio.
Con el capital anterior su negocio brindo un mejor servicio, atrajo más clientes, sus ventas son mayores y tiene más ingresos extras.
texts.en:
Olivia is applying for a loan that she will use to buy supplies for her food sales business: maize, beans, chicarron, cheese and propane for her gas cooker.  
She used past loans to improve her service and attract more customers, investments that increased both her revenue and income.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food sales business.

loans.name: Amada

texts.en:
Amada is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell for her fish vending business.

She has been in this business for 14 years. She earns more income from buying and selling dried fish. Amada has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to repair and renovate her family home in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is married. For the past three years, she has run a food vending business in the Philippines. Editha works hard to support her family. 

Editha is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy more ingredients for her business. She plans to purchase ingredients such as bananas, sugar, and cooking oil. Editha would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, 43, is married and has three children. She works hard to provide for her family. Elizabeth aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

For the past ten years, Elizabeth has been running a general store in the Philippines. To earn additional income, she also sells fruit. Elizabeth is requesting a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock for her store. Not including this loan, Elizabeth has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks for her store

loans.name: Rodrigo Salomon

texts.es:
Rodrigo, se decidió por otro préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, plaguicidas, abono y insecticidas, lo que le ayuda a proteger y mejorar sus cosechas de aplatanó, maíz y pipián.
 Con el capital que se le facilito anteriormente el obtuvo una cosecha abundante, y de calidad, mejoro sus ventas, ha recibido ganancias más altas, en su familia todos se encuentran muy saludables.
texts.en:
Rodrigo will use this loan to buy the supplies he needs--manure, fertilizer, insecticide, etc.--to protect and improve his next maize and pipian crop.  
He used past loans to improve both the quantity and quality of his crops, investments that increased his returns and his family's economic situation.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Zviad

texts.en:
Zviad is 42 years old and a married man, who lives with his wife and son. His wife works as a sales lady at a local store and gets a 200 GEL fixed salary. His son is unemployed, for now. The main income of the borrower and his family is a small agricultural activity. Specifically, they have 50 yielding peach trees and 30 cherry trees, and they sell the fruit, in season.

As the family has only seasonal income now, Zviad decided to start trading in fruits and vegetables throughout the year. He sought credit among local financial institutions, but his attempts were unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions. The Startup Program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor people to get loans for starting or restarting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program, to get a loan of 500 Gel for purchasing products to sell. Zviad has his own car and will transfer products to the capital of Georgia and sell them there. This credit will be a great support for the family, as they will get stable income. Zviad awaits your support.

loans.use: To trade in fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Dimitri

texts.en:
Dimitri is 35 years old, from the Zugdidi district. He is married with two school-age children. Dimitri’s wife works as a salesperson at the local fair market, selling various household items. 

Dimitri’s economic activity is his newly-started store in his district. Specifically, a week ago, he hired the commercial space and purchased merchandise such as dishes and small home appliances for resale. He works as a salesperson himself and hopes his business will be lucrative. In order to expand his store, Dimitri is requesting this loan. With the received amount, he will buy a check machine and add stock to his store.

The business will start normally and become the main source of income for the family. Dimitri hopes for your support.

loans.use: to buy a check machine and stock of merchandise for his store

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is grateful for the loan facility advanced to her by Ugafode Microfinance. Her husband being a builder, they realised that if he applied his skills, it would be cheaper to start their own house instead of renting, which was not sustainable given their meagre resources. 

They thought it wise to start a small house with their little savings to be supplemented by a loan. They hope to pay back using the profits from the retail shop as well as the husband's income. Stella is hard working and resilient.

loans.use: To buy building materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more red oil for her business.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 45-year-old married woman; she has been successfully running a business selling animals for many years. She buys animals such as baby goats and calves at low prices, brings them up, and sells them near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries). 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation; currently she requests a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase two more calves. She is in her sixth loan cycle with good repayment history.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing better a standard of living to her  family through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela is a 33-year-old vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. 

However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors, along with the packs of laces, zippers, and buttons. It will allow her to stitch up more dresses on time to generate a healthier source of income. 

She is in her third loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors, along with packs of laces, zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia, age 34, is a married woman. She makes delicious ‘dahi bhallay’, a dish consisting of balls made from ground lentils, deep fried and served in a yogurt sauce. Sofia has worked hard to gain popularity and recognition within her town. She has been successful in consistently making sales and earning a healthy revenue from the business. 

In order to increase her sales, Sofia has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 from Kashf Foundation to purchase packs of flour, oil, salt and spices. She is in her third loan cycle with a good repayment history. Sofia wishes to spend part of her revenue on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase packs of flour, oil, salt and spices.

loans.name: Malinche Group

texts.es:
María Emelina: Es una mujer luchadora, jovial, tiene 41 años de edad, es originaria de la Ciudad de Bilwi,  madre soltera de 6 hijos,  de los cuales 5 son adultos y gracias al esfuerzo de su madre son profesionales que ya han formado su familia. El menor, que tiene 20 años, tiene problemas  psicomotores, por lo que no asiste a la escuela, sin embargo su madre lo cuida con esmero y en conjunto con una maestra a domicilio está aprendiendo a leer y escribir.

Hace 10 años estableció su pequeña pulpería, en la cual vende granos básicos, chiverías, sardinas, café y desinfectante. Actualmente solicita financiamiento para comprar nuevos productos: 3 bolsones de meneíto, 3 cajillas de huevo, una docena de pasta de diente, un bolsón de papel higiénico, un bolsón de sopas instantáneas, dos docenas de cloro, una docena de gelatina para el cabello, avena en ristra, una caja de café, un bolsón de pinolillos y galletas. Su sueño es que con el incremento de sus ganancias pueda seguir creciendo su negocio y continuar apoyando a su hijo y nieta que tiene a su cuido.

María Auxiliadora: Vende chiverías, fresco, frutas, enchiladas y gaseosas en la Escuela Normal de Puerto Cabezas y en su vivienda vende frijoles cocidos. Solicita financiamiento para comprar mercadería. Su sueño es tener una pulpería en su casa. Maria ha promovido entre sus compañeras conformar el grupo Malinche con el propósito de recibir su primer financiamiento de parte de PANA PANA. 

Francisca: Es una mujer emprendedora, decidió formar parte del grupo con el propósito de iniciar su propio negocio y generar sus propios ingresos, al dedicarse a la venta de carbón, tortillas de maíz, frijoles cocidos y queso en su vivienda. Solicita financiamiento para comprar: 15 libras de  queso, un quintal de maseca, medio quintal de frijoles. Su sueño es tener una pulpería y comprar sus electrodomésticos.
texts.en:
Maria is a hardworking and jovial 41 year old woman.  She is from the city of Bilwi  and it the single mother of six children, 5 of who are fully grown, working as professionals, and have families of their own  thanks to her efforts.  The youngest is 20 years old and has physiological motor problems and is not able to attend school.  However his mother cares for him with great care and she and a teacher are teaching him to read a write.

10 years ago she set up a small store where she sells basic grains, “chiverias,” sardines, coffee, and disinfectant.  She is asking for a loan to buy new products, 3 bags of “meneíto,” 3 cases of eggs, a dozen tubes of toothpaste, a bag of bathroom tissue, a bag of instant soup, two dozen bottles of bleach, a dozen tubes of hair gel, oatmeal, a case of coffee, and a bag of “pinolillos” and cookies.  Her dream is to increase her earnings so she can continue growing her business and continue supporting her son and granddaughter whom she cares for.

María Auxiliadora sells “chiverías,” fresh fruits, enchiladas, and soft drinks in Escuela Normal de Puerto Cabezas and also sells cooked beans from her house.  She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise.  Her dream is to have a store in her house.  Maria and her fellow members joined the Malinche group to get their first loan through PANA PANA. 

Francisca is an enterprising woman and decided to join the group so she could start her own business and generate her own income by selling charcoal, corn tortillas, cooked beans, and cheese out of her home.  She is asking for this loan to buy 15 lbs of cheese, a quintal of “maseca,” and half a quintal of beans.  Her dream is to have a store and be able to buy her appliances.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Ya'qoob

texts.en:
Ya'qoob is 38 years old and lives with his wife and his five children in Ramallah. He works in the drilling works. His dream is to educate his children and give them the best in their life.

Ya'qoob is asking Ryada for this loan to buy wood to install cabinets in the kitchen, and paint it. This will help him to take a step forward because he has a shortage of money to buy the things he needs. 

He is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: to buy wood to install cabinets in the kitchen, and paint it.

loans.name: Porferia

texts.en:
Porferia is a 36-year-old woman from the town of Dauis, Bohol. She is married with three children aged fourteen, twelve and eight years old. Her husband works as a laborer to help support their family.

For more than five years now Porferia has run a sari-sari, or variety store, where she sells various items like noodles, chips, sugar, canned goods, soap and shampoo. She is applying for a 7,000 PHP loan to buy extra soft drinks, sacks of rice and other items to meet the demands of her neighborhood customers and her family's daily needs.

Porferia’s aim is to increase her business’s profitability so she can pay for her children’s education as well as become a successful business woman.

loans.use: to buy extra stock for her shop.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia works hard to support her family. Delia is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Delia requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Delia has been in this business for 30 years now.

In the future, Delia would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia works hard to support her family. Lucia is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net.

Lucia has been in this business for five years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net

loans.name: Ararat

texts.en:
Ararat is from Masis town. He lives there with his wife, and together they are involved in a retail business. They rent a small store in the center of the town, and sell clothing. The couple works hard to satisfy the market demand and serve their customers' needs. 

By applying for this loan, Ararat now asks financial support to be able to buy a new stock of clothing to sell in the store. 

The loan will greatly assist Ararat in increasing his turnover, and he hopes for lenders' support.

Ararat has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of clothing for selling in the store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more red oil for her business.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos de 59 años de edad es madre soltera y habita en casa propia junto a su hija quien ya es mayor de edad y su nieto. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tamales (preparación alimenticia a base de masa de maíz, pollo y verduras). El negocio lo tiene en su lugar de residencia y la venta la realiza de forma ambulante.De esta forma ha sacado adelante a su hija y ha llevado el sustento diario. Con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del piso de la vivienda ya que actualmente es de tierra. Con el crédito comprará cemento, arena y grava.
texts.en: Santos is a 59 year old single mother. She lives in her own home with her adult daughter and her grandson. She makes and sells tamales (made with corn meal, chicken, and vegetables). She runs her business in her neighborhood and travels on foot to make sales. This is how she’s been able to get ahead for her daughter’s sake and meet daily needs. With the ultimate goal of improving living conditions, she’s asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest the redoing the floor in her home which is now a dirt floor. With this loan, she’ll buy cement, sand, and gravel.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and gravel to build a floor in her home.

loans.name: Cicik

texts.en:
Cicik is a 44-year-old woman who is married to I Wayan Sutama, a 48-year-old entrepreneur. They have been blessed with 3 children: Santana, 10, and Nandi, 7, are elementary school students and Galuh, 5, attends kindergarten. 

Cicik and her husband run a driving instructor business, which they initiated using their own capital. Cicik manages administrative matters while her husband provides the driving lessons. Their car presently requires maintenance but, unfortunately, they do not have enough money to do so. Cicik has requested a loan of IDR 4,500,000 to be spent on car maintenance.

loans.use: to pay car maintenance expenses

loans.name: Carmen María

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Nueva Esperanza se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.
Aquí vive la señora Carmen, tiene 57 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos mayores de edad, dos de sus hijos viven con ella. Su marido ya no trabaja por motivos de su edad. 
Doña Carmen para salir adelante y en sociedad con una hija instalaron en su casa una tienda de víveres que empezaron con el primer crédito que recibió del banco,  allí vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su hija y ella trabajan allí y ya son 12 años con este negocio el cual les da para vivir honradamente.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 12 años y le gusta porque así empezó su negocio. Su sueño es tener buena salud
texts.en:
The Nueva Esperanza credit group meets in the Picoaza parish of Portoviejo every two weeks.  This area is known as being a very commercial zone, for its traditional San Pedro festivals, and the happiness of its people.

Carmen lives here.  She is 57 years old, married, and has three adult children, two of whom live with her.  Her husband doesn’t work because of his age.

Carmen and her daughter set up a food store in their home in order to get ahead in society.  They started it with the first loan they got from the communal bank and sell all types of products such as rice, sugar, cooking oils, detergents, beans, vegetables, and fruits.  She works every day from 6:00 am to 8:00 pm and sometimes later.  She and her daughter have been working this business for 12 years and have been making an honest living. 

They will use the money from this loan to expand the business and stock this store with rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergents, sausages, and other primary needs products.  She has been with the credit group for 12 years and she likes it because she started the business there.  Her dream is to be in good health.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Melbin Rodolfo

texts.es:
Melvin tiene 37 años de edad, estado civil Unión Libre vive con su esposa y con sus hijos de 10, 6 años, Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos
La ventanilla se llama SAN NICOLAS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Nicolás, perteneciente a la parroquia Ricaurte cantón Urdaneta, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Melvin se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace algunos años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar y en Cantón Urdaneta.
El crédito solicito para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es darles el estudio a sus hijos y mejorar en los negocios
Le gusta trabajar en el campo.
texts.en:
Melvin, 37, lives with his wife and two children, 10- and 6-years old, respectively.  They live in Ventanas, a district of Los Rios province.
The SAN NICOLAS community bank is located in San Nicolas, a rural area in the district of Urdaneta.  The members of the bank make their livings from farming and livestock businesses.
Melvin has made his living growing maize and rice for several years now.  He buys what he needs in Ventanas and sells what he grows there and in Urdaneta district.  
Melvin is applying for a new loan that he will use to buy the supplies he needs to plant his next maize and rice crop.  Past loans have helped him to increase his income and better care for his family.  For the future, he wants to grow his business and ensure that his children get good educations.
Working his fields is something he enjoys, he says.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Isabel Cristina

texts.es: Isabel, tiene 32 años de edad, es casada, vive con su hijo de 3 años en casa familiar, desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar para ayudar a su familia con los gastos, ha trabajado en varias instituciones privadas de su ciudad, actualmente labora en una empresa de seguros como asesora de ventas, paralelamente estudia  Administración de empresas en la Universidad. Beneficiaria utilizará el dinero para costear tratamiento médico de su hijo. Su sueño es terminar su carrera profesional para buscar un trabajo de tiempo completo el cual le permita comprase su casa y mejor la calidad de vida de su hijo y familia
texts.en: Isabel is 32 years old, married, and lives with her three year old son at a relative’s house.  She had to start working when she was very young so she could help with the family expenses.  She has worked in several private institutions in town and currently works for an insurance company as a sales advisor and is also studying management at the university.  She will use the money from this loan to pay for medical expenses for her son.  Her dream is to finish her education so she can look for a full time job that will allow her to buy a house and improve her and her son’s quality of life.

loans.use: to pay medical expenses for her son.

loans.name: Dario

texts.en: Dario, who is married and has seven grown-up children, is from Ubay, Bohol. He earns a living through his retail business, selling various goods and items to the people in his area. Dario is asking for a loan to buy additional stock, such as canned goods, noodles, candies, biscuits, chips, snack foods, beverages, soap and toiletries. This will allow him to improve the variety of his stock, thus augmenting his sales and income.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in his store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of maize, thus increasing her current inventory levels.

loans.name: Honorine's Group

texts.fr: C'est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Honorine (dont le doigt est levé sur la photo), est âgée de 49 ans. Honorine est mariée à un certain Louis. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Honorine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple subvient ensemble aux divers besoins du ménage. Honorine a très peu fréquenté l’école. Pour se prendre en charge et assurer les besoins de ses enfants, Honorine prépare de la nourriture (riz, etc.) qu'elle vend à son domicile depuis une vingtaine d'année. Honorine achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Honorine sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qui permettra certainement à Honorine et à son groupe d’accroître leur stock de produits et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
This is a group of three people, the members of which live in the same neighborhood. The group leader is Honorine (whose finger is raised in the photo), who is 49 years old. Honorine is married to a man by the name of Louis. The couple has four children, some of whom attend school and all of whom are in their care. Honorine lives with her children and her husband. The couple provides for the various needs of the household.

Honorine attended very little school. In order to take care of herself and to see to the needs of her children, Honorine has been cooking food (rice, etc.) that she sells from her home for some 20 years. She purchases her supplies in a market in Benin. This is the second time that Honorine has solicited a loan from ALIDé, which will without doubt allow Honorine and her group to expand their stock of supplies and to better respond to customer demand.

loans.use: To purchase food and condiments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to restock her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Victor Antonio

texts.es:
Víctor tiene 24 años de edad, estado civil Unión Libre vive con la esposa y con su hijo de 3 meses, Vive en el Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.
La ventanilla se llama SAN NICOLAS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Nicolás, perteneciente a la parroquia Ricaurte cantón Urdaneta, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Víctor se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace algunos años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas en Agroquímica Carlita y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.
El crédito solicito para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es salir adelante con su familia.
Le gusta ser responsable en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Víctor is 24 years old and in a common law marriage. He lives with his wife and their 3 month old child. He lives in the province Canton Ventanas de los Rios. The state is called San Nicholas which is located in Recinto San Nicholas, in the Ricaurte parish and the Urdaneta canton. People in this state work on farms or in fisheries. Victor has working as a famer for a few years, growing corn and rice. He buys supplies in Ventanas from Agroquimica Carlita and sells them in the market there. 

He’s asking for a loan to buy manure and fertilizers for his corn and rice crop. This loan will help him increase income that he uses for family expenses and investment. He dream is to get his family ahead.  He likes being a responsible worker.

loans.use: to plant corn and rice.

loans.name: Gertrudis De Jesus

texts.es:
Gertrudis, opta por otro crédito para completar la siembra de maicillo y terminar la cosecha de tabaco,frijol y maíz, invertirá en la compra de abono y pago de mano de obra, para el tratamiento de sus diferentes cultivos y le garantiza una buena cosecha.
Con el crédito anterior Gertrudis pudo comprar los insumos necesarios para preparar el terreno donde cultiva, mejoro su producción, ha aumentado su área de cultivo, sus ingresos han mejorado y ha podido cancelar sus deudas.
texts.en:
Gertrudis has opted for another loan to finish planting millet and harvesting tobacco, beans, and corn. She will invest in labor costs and paying for manure to treat her different crops and guarantee a good harvest. 

With the last loan Gertrudis was able to buy supplies she needed to prepare the land for cultivation and improve her production. She increased the size of her crops, her income grew, and she was able to pay off her debts.

loans.use: to buy manure and pay for labor.

loans.name: Vazha

texts.en:
Vazha is from Persati, a village located in western Georgia. He is thirty-two years old and married. Vazha lives with his parents, sister, retired grandmother, wife, and two toddlers. 

To earn a living, Vazha operates a distribution business. Specifically, he buys various fertilizers and animal feed in bulk at the capital city market and distributes the products in his district and neighboring towns. Although Vazha works hard, his earnings are still modest and hardly enough to cover the expenses of his large family.
